texts.en: Narcisco is 58 years old. For about 11 years, he has been working as a security guard at a company near his town. This is how he makes a living and supports his family. Narcisco wants to finish building a retaining wall before winter comes because his land washes away and he wants to protects it since it's his only asset. Narcisco is requesting this loan from Fusai to invest in the purchase of bricks, cement, sand, and iron. He hopes to receive this funding and thus proceed with the construction as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, and iron to finish building a retaining wall.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is a 42-year-old man who is married to Emiliana, a 41-year-old woman. They have three children, namely Rolis, 18, a senior high school student; and Fernando, 13, and Jenifer, 8, both of whom are elementary school students.

Abraham is a contractor who is usually involved in irrigation and building projects. The income generated from the business is about IDR 1,800,000 each month. For the small projects, Abraham usually employs 7 or 8 laborers. 

Recently, the laborers have finished their work on the irrigation project. Unfortunately, the company that finances the project has not fully paid the payment to Abraham from which he would pay the laborers; and Abraham does not have enough money to do so. Therefore, he requested an individual loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. The loan will be spent on the laborers' wages.

loans.use: to pay laborers' wages.

loans.name: Imelda De La Paz

texts.es: Imelda de 31 años de edad se dedica a la elabora y venta de antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. que vende cerca de su lugar de residencia, gracias a las ventas que realiza y a la ayuda de su esposo han logrado solventar los gastos de su hogar. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus hijos,  Imelda pide financiamiento para la compra de productos que utiliza en la elaboración de sus antojitos como: aceite, papas, maiz para los tamales, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración y asi poder seguir manteniendo su hogar y poder solventar los gastos que se le pueden presentar.
texts.en:
Imelda, who is 31 years old, makes a living by making and selling snacks such as: french fries, fried cassava, empanadas, tamales, etc. She sells these near her house and thanks to the sales she makes and the help of her husband they have been able to pay their household expenses. She lives in her own home with her husband and children. 

Imelda is asking for a loan to purchase products which she uses in the production of her snacks such as: oil, potatoes, corn for the tamales, plantains and all the ingredients for their production. This will allow her to maintain her home and be able to settle any expenses that she might be faced with.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, corn for tamales, plantains and all ingredients necessary for her snacks

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Meet Stephen, a farmer located in the Muranga area of Eastern Kenya, who has been farming for 6 years. He stated that he loves farming because of the income he gets out of it. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea, and horticultural crops.

Stephen chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer training to the farmers before giving them loans so that the farmers will be able to make wise decisions while taking their loans. During the training, he learned about financial management. This loan will give him a better opportunity to yield more produce and thus get more income, which will help him improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Crista Isabel

texts.es:
Crista de 36 años de edad, es una mujer emprendedora, que por diversas razones no pudo continuar estudiando, pudiendo solamente estudiar hasta segundo grado de educación básica; pero que no se rindió y siempre ha buscado la forma para que su familia tenga garantizado el sustento diario, está casada y su esposo tuvo que emigrar a Estados Unidos, pero que no le ha ido tan bien como creía  en ese país, que además de estar desintegrada la familia, es difícil encontrar un trabajo que le permita ayudar a su familia en El Salvador. Ella tiene 3 hijos los cuales están estudiando.


Crista se dedica  a la venta de leche, en este momento tiene tres vacas lecheras, a las cuales cría y cuida desde hace varios años, cuando su marido emigro, ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de cuidar las vacas, con poca experiencia en esta actividad, fue poco a poco aprendiendo. Además de esta actividad, tiene que realizar los quehaceres del hogar.

El crédito lo utilizara en la compra de un molino para nixtamal y harinas. En el cantón, ella ha podido detectar demanda del servicio, debido que los habitantes de este lugar tienen que movilizarse grandes distancias, porque  no hay molinos cerca. Si se le ayuda con el crédito podrá obtener ingresos que le permitan garantizar el sustento de su familia, además del beneficio que tendrán las personas, las cuales demandan el servicio.


En un futuro desea tener un negocio que sea rentable y  que su familia pueda tener con este,  los ingresos suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas y que así no sea una necesidad emigrar a otros países, ya que esto genera la desintegración familiar y en lugar de mejorar dificulta la situación.
texts.en:
Crista, who is 36 years old, is an entrepreneurial woman who for various reasons was not able to continue in school, being able to attend only through the second grade of basic education. But she did not give up, and she has always sought a way for her family to have a guaranteed daily sustenance. She is married, and her husband had to emigrate to the United State, but it didn't go as well for him as he had believed it would in that country. In addition to breaking up the family, it is difficult for him to find work that allows him to help the family in El Salvador. She has three children who are in school.

Crista sells milk. At this time she has three milk cows, which she has raised and taken care of for a number of years. When her husband emigrated, she had to take charge of caring for the cows with little experience in this activity, but she learned little by little. In addition to this work, she has to do the household chores.

She will use the loan to buy a mill for nixtamal (corn) and flours. She has been able to sense a demand for this service in the canton, because the inhabitants of this area have to go great distances because there are no mills nearby. If she is helped with the loan, she will be able to obtain income that will allow her to guarantee the sustenance of her family, in addition to the benefit for the people who request the service.

In the future she wants to have a business that is profitable and that her family can have with this, with income sufficient to cover the basic necessities so that it will not be necessary to emigrate to other countries, since this causes broken-up families and instead of improving the situation, it makes it worse.

loans.use: to buy a mill for nixtamal (corn) and flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Wilfredo De Jesús

texts.es:
Wilfredo de 25 años de edad, es un joven con iniciativa, buscando siempre mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Estudio hasta quinto grado, pero al dificultarse la situación por las limitantes económicas de sus padres, tuvo que introducirse de lleno al campo laboral, dejando en segundo plano los estudios, Actualmente está acompañado y su compañera de vida trabaja en la misma granja donde es empleado él. Tienen un hijo, el cual es la razón de luchar día con día por su presente y futuro.


Trabaja desde hace tres años en una granja de su cantón, él se desempeña en el área de fabricación de concentrados para los animales que manejan en dicha granja. Este oficio lo aprendió  gracias a compañeros que ya tenían experiencia y se fue introduciendo en la actividad. Anteriormente intento lograr el “sueño americano,” pero en el intento de cruzar las fronteras,  fue deportado y tuvo que comenzar de cero en su país. Actualmente trabaja de lunes a sábado de 6:00 am a 4:00 pm de la tarde. 

El préstamo lo utilizara en la compra de dos terneras, con ello aprovechara la oportunidad de comprarlas a un precio cómodo, las criara y engordara y luego las venderá a un mejor precio, obteniendo un buen margen de ganancia en este negocio.

Su sueño es poder tener una fuente de ingresos estable, él ve como un buen negocio el trabajar con ganado, su padre anteriormente manejaba con ganado y le iba bien, su deseo es poder convertirse en un gran comerciante y así poder cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia. Sabe que aquí en su país puede hacer muchas cosas buenas y poder salir adelante, sin tener que emigrar a otro país.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 25 years old. He is a young man with initiative always looking to improve the living conditions of his family. He studied up to Grade 5 but given the financial difficulties of his parents he had to enter the workforce, leaving his studies aside. He now has a common-law wife who is employed on the same farm as Wilfredo. They have a son which is his reason to strive every day for his present and his future.

He has worked for 3 years on a farm in his canton. He works in the fabrication of concentrated feed for animals which they have on the farm. He learned this skill from co-workers who have experience in the field and introduced him to it. Before that he tried the “American Dream” but attempting to cross the border he was deported and had to re-start from zero in his country. He works from 6 am to 4 pm Monday to Saturday

The loan will be used to buy two calves taking advantage of an opportunity to buy them at a good price. He will raise them and fatten them in order to sell them at a profit, obtaining a good profit margin in the deal.

His dream is to have a stable source of income. He views raising cattle as a good business. His father used to do this and things worked out well for him. Wilfredo wants to become a big businessman and be able to cover the basic needs of his family. He knows that he can do a lot of good things here in his country without having to emigrate to another country.

loans.use: to buy two calves.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel, 31, is from Nyahururu. He is married to Naomi, and they are blessed with two children aged six and four years old.

Samuel has been running his farm for the last 10 years. To buy a piece of land to improve and expand his farming activities, he has applied for his second loan, for 104,620 Kenyan shillings, from Vision Fund Kenya.

Samuel's monthly income is 30,000 KES. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and pay back his loan.

In the future, he hopes to be a successful farmer.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to improve and expand his farming activities

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 35, is from Nakuru. He is married to Mary, and they are blessed with two children aged 12 and six years old.

Joseph has been running his business of making and selling charcoal stoves and metal boxes for the last eight years. To buy more scrap metal and other raw materials to make stoves and boxes, he has applied for his third loan, for 67,500 Kenyan shillings, from Vision Fund Kenya.

With his previous loan, Joseph managed to raise his monthly income from 25,000 KES to his current one of 40,000 KES. He has plans to use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to educate his children and pay back his loan.

In the future, he hopes to be the main distributor of charcoal stoves and metal boxes in his area.

loans.use: To buy materials for making charcoal stoves and metal boxes.

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen is a 45-year-old man who is married to Rosalina, a 43-year-old teacher. They have been blessed with 4 children: Anista is 12-year-old junior high school student, Uce is a 10-year-old elementary school student,  Iki is a 7-year-old elementary school student; and Ari is 4 years old.

Marthen owns a kiosk business to sell rice, instant noodles, detergent, soap, etc. The business has operated since 1997. He spent  500,000 IDR of his own money to initiate this business. He plans to sell gasoline in his kiosk  and needs more money to do so. He requests an individual 6,000,000 IDR loan from TLM. The loan will be spent on gasoline, detergent, and snacks for his kiosk.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, detergent, and snacks for his kiosk business.

loans.name: Abdel Rahman

texts.en:
Abdel Rahman is a 19-year-old single man from Jabalia city. He lives with his family in a small simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. This is the only source of income for the family. Abdel is a high school student where he studies science.  He is a very clever young man. Abdel would like to register at the university and earn a BA degree in science.

Abdel took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN.  This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Abdel will be able to write his reports and read articles online. 

Abdel appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Yoeun

texts.en:
Yoeun is married with three grown-up children. She is 47 years old and lives in Kien Svay district, Kandal province. She is homemaker who spends all of her time taking care of the household. Her husband is the main breadwinner of the family. Other supplementary income comes from her three children who are employed in various careers.
 
Yoeun will use this loan to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members and to improve her household sanitation practices. Thanks to the water loan program with a special rate offered by Hattha Kaksekar Limited (HKL), Yoeun is encouraged to focus on ensuring healthy living conditions, to safeguard the health of her family and to protect the environment.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine and septic tank for the sake of her family members.

loans.name: Mbugua

texts.en:
Mbugua, 61, is married and the father of four children. He owns rental houses in Kangemi. He has been in this business for 30 years and gets a monthly income of 130,000 Kenyan shillings.

This will be Mbugua's fifth loan with Vision Fund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to renovate his rental houses. 

He earnestly desires to live a debt-free, poverty-free, happy life in the future.

loans.use: to renovate his rental properties

loans.name: Monique

texts.en:
Monique is a 30-year-old married Cameroonian woman with four children. The oldest child is an 18-year-old university student and the youngest child is three months old. 

She has sold wood for over six years and her experience promotes a stable business. Her business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. This loan will be use to increase her turn over by forty percent.

loans.use: to buy wood to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is 60-years-old and married with three children. Luciana works very hard to provide for them.

Luciana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more goods to sell in her general store.

Luciana has been in this business for nine years and sells a variety of items such as cooking oil, noodles, beers, biscuits, etc. 

Luciana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 43-years-old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Lucille has a rug making business in the Philippines. Lucille requested a PHP 10,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fabric, etc. for her business.

Lucille has been in this business for six years. Lucille would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fabric, etc. for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lydia is 47-years-old and has three children who are currently in school.

Lydia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Lydia requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food production business.

Lydia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Jenefer

texts.en:
Jenefer works hard to support her family. She has a live-in partner and operates a general store business in the Philippines.

Jenefer requested 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

She has been in this business for 8 years and would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: will buy oil, pepper, rice, coal, etc., to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more potatoes and greens for her  business,

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 27 years old and single. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requests 27,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase detergent, canned goods, juice, coffee, shampoo, and other items to sell.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, canned goods, juice, coffee, and shampoo. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase detergent, canned goods, juice, coffee, shampoo, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 37-year-old married woman with four children (three attend school).

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines.   She is a very hard working entrepreneur and has been in this business for 5 years.

She requests 22,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish to sell to her customers.

 In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana works hard to support her family. Juana is single and sells firewood in the Philippines.  Juana has been in this business for 1 year.

Juana requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

In the future, Juana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 45-year-old married woman with six children (5 attend school). 

Lucia has had a food vending business in the Philippines for 5 years. She is a very hard working entrepreneur and requests 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks and cold water to expand her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil and used clothing for her business

loans.name: Ma. Lorena

texts.en:
Ma. Lorena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Lorena is 39-years-old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Lorena has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. Ma. Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell.

Ma. Lorena has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ma. Lorena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business to grind coconut meat.  Maria has been in this business for 20 years.

Maria requests 11,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase more coconuts.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts to sell.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo es integrado por tres socios trabajadores, coordinado por el señor Roberto de 32 años, acompañado y con tres hijos a cargo de las edades de 5, 4 años y el bebé de un mes de nacido, se dedica a la compra-venta de cosechas de temporada, actualmente requiere el crédito para invertir en cosechas de jocote, tamarindo y mango, porque son las frutas que mayor demanda están teniendo, al invertir en esta frutas obtendrá mayores ganancias por lo que les ofrecerá a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. También tenemos a la socia María de 47 años de edad, quién ofrece el servicio de venta de comida en su domicilio desde medio día hasta en la noche, otra socia es la señora Javiera de 29 años de edad que comercializa ropa interior de niños, damas y caballeros, en su comunidad.
texts.en:
This group is made up of three hardworking members. It is coordinated by Roberto. He is 32 years old and is married with three children in his care. They are 5, 4, and 1 month old. Roberto makes a living buying and selling seasonal crops. At this time, he needs a loan in order to invest in jocote, tamarind, and mango crops. These fruits have the highest demand right now. By making this investment, Roberto will obtain better earnings to help him offer his family a better quality of life. 

Maria is another member of this group. She is 47 years old and offers her service selling food from her home. She works from noon until night. The other group member is Javiera, 29 years old, who sells underwear for children, women, and men, in her community.

loans.use: to buy jocose (a fruit), tamarinds, and mango.

loans.name: Mtazamo Group

texts.en:
Hadija who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still in school.  She has been running a tailoring business for six years now.  She works from 8am to 10:30pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Hadija's 18th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to increase her tailoring materials, renovated the shop which is big and attractive and can now serve more people. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She is really happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay for school fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy tailoring materials and to make more dresses. She dreams of being successful in life.

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group, Mtazamo, which has six total members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and to make more dresses.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a sewing business in the Philippines.  Marilyn has been in this business for 21 years.

Marilyn requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fabric, thread, and other items for her sewing business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and requests a new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy additional fabric, thread, and other items for her sewing business.

loans.name: Al- Mydan Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Mydan. It consists of three ladies who reside in Aden, Yemen. This group has requested financial aid from AMB to boost their business.

The group's representative, Aeda, is a 52-year-old married woman with two children. Her oldest child is 29 and the youngest is 27 years old. Aeda is the leader of the group. 

Aeda studied up to the secondary school level. In order to support her family financially, she decided to sell food. In the beginning, she sold food door-to-door. Aeda started her business seven years ago. Now, she has a small shop in one of the schools in her area. The money that she earns from this humble business is not enough to improve her income and most of what she earns goes to pay her family's expenses. For this reason, she applied for 100,000 YER from AMB  to purchase more food for her small shop.

Aeda looks forward to expanding her business and opening a grocery business in her area to provide a better future for her family. Her dream is to renovate her old house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  food for her small shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cartons of fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy slippers, flour, sugar, and other items to expand her sales.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa es una señora de 47 años de edad, con 3 hijos, originaria del Municipio de Somotillo, se caracteriza por ser una señora honrada, inteligente, social, responsable en su trabajo y su familia, con muchos deseos de superación, se desempeña como  conserje en el Hospital Raymundo García desde hace 5 años, manifiesta que a pesar de los tropiezos que ha pasado a sabido salir adelante por sus  hijos que son los que la inspiran y los que la motivan, por lo que se presento a Ceprodel a solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales, cemento, bloques, para la construcción de un cuarto de habitación y poder brindarle a sus hijos un techo digno donde vivir,  así mismo mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Felipa is 47, has 3 children and is from the Somotillo municipality. She is described as an honest, intelligent and social woman who is responsible regarding her work and family. 
With a huge desire to succeed, she has worked as a janitor at the Raymundo Garcia Hospital for 5 years. 
She says that despite the setbacks that have happened, she has keept getting ahead for her children who are the ones who inspire and motivate her. 
She is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to buy materials such as cement, blocks, for the building of a bedroom so that she can give her children a decent roof over their heads. This way she can improve her and her families quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cement and blocks

loans.name: Khuntabhuyan Shg Group

texts.en: Khuntabhuyan Self Help Group has nine members who are all from the same neighborhood. The lady standing with her hand raised is Kausalya, the leader of the group. Kausalya is a 39-year-old married woman from a small village in the Jajpur district in Odisha, India. The couple has five children who are schooling. Kausalya lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. For the past 12 years, she has been involved in growing and selling vegetables. Her husband helps her in this activity. All the members of this group are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc. In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Kausalya, together with her group, has requested a loan of 162,000 INR to purchase vegetable plants, seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, vegetable plants, fertilizers and pesticides for vegetable farming.

loans.name: Maa Sarala Shg Group

texts.en: Maa Sarala Self Help Group was formed with 10 members in 2009 in a small village in Odisha. They all came together to help each other, to solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They choose Susama as the leader of their group. The lady standing with her hand raised is Susama. She is a 45-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children. For the last 20 years, Susama’s husband has been working as a farmer to manage his small family. It is not sufficient to manage the family. So Susama is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in farming and selling vegetables and paddy in the market. She has four years experience in this business. She has requested a loan to buy vegetable seeds and plants, fertilizers, pesticides, and other advanced tools for farming, so that she can contribute to her family’s income. Susama says that by selling vegetables, she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to purchase vegetable seeds and plants, fertilizers, pesticides, and other advanced tools for farming

loans.name: Mahalaxmi Shg Group

texts.en: Mahalaxmi Self Help Group has eight members who are all from the same neighborhood. The president of this group is Champabati. In the picture, the lady standing with her hand raised is Champabati. Champabati is a 29-year-old married woman from the Jajpur district in Odisha, India. The couple has three children who are in school. Champabati lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. For the past five years, Bharati has been involved in the activity of growing and selling vegetables.  Her husband and her parents help her in this activity. All other members of this group are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, cattle farming, etc. In order to strengthen the business and respond to customer demand, Bharati, together with her group, has requested a loan of 80,000 INR for purchasing seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. Their goal is to expand their business activities.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Osama

texts.en:
Osama is a 27-year-old married man from Rafah city. He is the father of one son and two daughters. Osama is an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. He tries to increase his income so he can improve his family's living conditions. Therefore, Osama also works using a small van to buy products and resell them to local traders. It is a good business and helps him to cover part of his family's expenses.
 
Osama took out a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more products and resell them to local traders. By taking out this loan, Osama will be able to improve his business and also his income. 

Osama appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more products and resell them to local traders.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali, 50 years old, is a rural woman living in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and wood) with her husband Ranjit and three children (two sons and one daughter) who are students.  Anjali is illiterate and only knows how to sign her names but her husband has a higher secondary education.  But they are providing an education to their children. One is in grade nine, one is in college and the eldest son is in the university. They live in the small village of Sarkarpara in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Anjali is a housewife. Her husband runs a grocery shop in their house. He is the only earning member for such a large family, where three children are students. Anjali is a very enthusiastic and optimistic woman.  Now Anjali decided to start a milk supply business. She has applied for a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow. She plans to sell the cow milk from door to door to her neighbors, which has a good demand in their locality. This will allow her to generate a good income to take care of her family and meet the educational expenses of her children.

Anjali dreams of upgrading their house to a concrete-made house in the future with the profit generated from the business. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply business.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is 30 years old.  She is from a small village in the district of Jalpaiguri. She has completed her primary education.  She is married to Haridayal, 45 years old, who attended school up to grade two. They have two children (one son and one daughter). Both children are students in grade 11 and 10, respectively. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, straw and bamboo).

Arati's husband is a small farmer. He grows green vegetables on his own farm to sell to his neighbors.  The income from their agribusiness is not sufficient to provide their financial sustenance. So, for additional income, Arati runs an animal husbandry business. She started this business three years ago and now she has three goats and one cow.  To generate more income, she wants to purchase another cow, as she wants to sell cow's milk to the villagers.

Arati has requested a loan from BJS to purchase one more cow so that she can sell more milk and earn more money for the financial stability of her family. She dreams of investing the earnings from the business into further increasing the quantity of her livestock and saving money to upgrade their house to a concrete-made house.

She gives thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Bishaya

texts.en:
Bishaya is an enterprising woman.  She is only 26 years old, married and has three children (one son and two daughters), two of whom are in school.  The third one is only two years old. She lives with her husband Pradip, 28 years old, and children in a remote village in the district Jalpaiguri.  They are uneducated and can sign only their names. They could not get an education as their parents could not support them financially. Their children are in grade four and one, espectively.

Bishaya's husband is engaged in an agribusiness. They have farmland of their own where he grows different vegetables in different seasons. Bishaya also contributes her efforts in growing crops, doing cleaning work, cutting the crop, laying the manure etc.  

Now Bijaya is requesting a loan from BJS to start a gourd business.  She plans to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and manure to cultivate this vegetable.  Her plans for the future are to have a large plantation of gourds. She can then earn more and strengthen her business.  In addition, Bishaya's priority is to provide a good education to her children with her income.

She is thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation.

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a rural woman from the village of Kalirhat in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She is 36 years old, married and blessed with two daughters. She lives in their own kachha house (house made of mud, bamboo and straw) with her daughters and husband.  Gita is uneducated and only knows how to sign her name. Her parent's poor financial resources could not provide her with an elementary education.  So she is very much concerned about her daughters’ education. They read in grade two and five respectively.

Gita's husband Jagadish, 57 years old, is associated with anagribusiness. He is very friendly and hardworking.  He works very hard on his own plot of land where he sows potatoes, onions and garlic. His harvest product is of very good quality, and he sells it in different markets near his home.  Gita, though a housewife, helps him in her husband's work.

Gita is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), to invest in a new cultivation of chilies in their farmland. As the product has a good market demand, she has chosen this business. She wants to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and manure that she needs for sowing.  She is eager to increase the sales, to earn more money and provide her family an economic stability.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers of chillies for cultivation.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in Kapan town with her husband and two sons. Her family is hard working: they keep livestock and are mainly involved in bee-keeping. Two years ago, Marine started a small business choosing to purchase and sell clothing and dressmaking supplies as this is a profitable business in the region. Realizing that the business helps her to cover her family's daily costs, she would like to expand it further.

Marine has requested this loan so she can buy new stocks of supplies to sell to customers. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy new stocks of supplies to sell to customers

loans.name: Sumati

texts.en:
Sumati is a 26-year-old woman.  She is married and a mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She lives in the small village of Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri with her children and husband.  Her husband Naresh, 44 years old, is a farmer by profession.  Both Sumati and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  One of their children is in grade five.

They have ancestral land where her husband grows vegetables. He sells the produce to the local people.  He is the main source of income for the family, but his income is hardly enough to provide food for the family in the present situation where the prices of essential commodities are going up by leaps and bounds. In order to provide additional income, Sumati is engaged in animal husbandry. She has one dairy cow.  She feeds the cow and sells milk at local markets. Sumati wants to expand her business by selling more milk by purchasing one more cow, but she does not have enough money.

Sumati requested a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow. She hopes to get additional profit as more cows means more milk. Sumati plans to invest the earnings from the loan to increase the number of domestic livestock and save money to make a concrete-made house for their own use.

She is grateful to both Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Teresa Judas

texts.pt:
A Sra Teresa de 36 anos de idade, casada e mae de 6 filhos dos quais 3 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario os 3 sem idade para frequentar escola. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade actividade que esta a ezercer a mais de 7 anos, seus produtos vende na porta da sua casa uma vez que ela nao possue um estabelecimento comercial.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (feijao verde, refregerante, arroz, caldos, cebola, farrinha de milhoe mais deversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa is 36 years old, married and the mother of 6 children. 3 of her children are in primary and secondary school and the other 3 are not of school-going age. She's an informal trader, selling basic products, which she has been doing for more than 7 years. She sells her products from the door of her home as she doesn't own a commercial establishment.

With this loan she plans to buy basic products (green beans, sodas, rice, stocks, onions, corn flour and other products) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.use: buy basic products (green beans, sodas, rice, stocks, onions, corn flour and other products) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.name: Felĺcia

texts.pt:
A dona Felίcia de 29 anos de idade é mãe solteira de 2 filhos que estudam no nίvel primário, vive na casa própria e trabalha como empregada doméstica e também é comerciante.
Diz que com o valor do empréstimo irá comprar açúcar, óleo, feijão, omo para reforçar o seu negócio que faz na sua casa.
No futuro espera reabilitar a sua casa, vedar com muro o seu quintal e voltar a estudar como forma de puder concorrer para uma emprego melhor.
Diz que que tem como desafios a insuficiencia de fundos e compromete se a pagar pontualmente e voltar a solicitar mais emprestimos
texts.en:
Mrs. Felícia is 29 years old, a single mother of 2 children who go to primary school and lives in a house she owns. She works as a maid and is also a trader.

She says that with this loan she will buy sugar, oil, beans and washing powder (Omo) to reinforce the business that she runs from her home.

In future she hopes to re-do her home, put a fence around her garden and go back to school so that she can get a better job.

She says her challenge is the lack of funds and commits to paying back her loan on time so that she can solicit further loans.

loans.use: buy sugar, oil, beans and washing powder (Omo)

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean, aged 39, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Mary Jean has had a salted peanuts vending business in the Philippines for the past five years. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like peanuts, salt, etc. for her business.

Mary Jean would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like peanuts, salt, etc. for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, oil, onions, okra, rice, etc. to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish and meat to expand her sales

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miguela is 51 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Miguela has a food vending business in the Philippines. Miguela requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, fish, spices and pork for her food production business.

Miguela has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Miguela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as vegetables, fish, spices and pork for her food production business

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en: Rufa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Rufa requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell. Rufa has been in this business for 10 years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
As a live-in partner parent of one child, Susan works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling slippers in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dressed chicken. Susan is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more slippers to sell. Susan has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more red oil, rice, pepper and maggi cubes to expand her sales

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a man who lives in his own house that no has electricity or piped water.  For the past year, he has operated a motorcycle business, operating from the market where neighbours and passersby are potential customers. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his place of operation during the rainy season.

With the KES 50,000 loan he wants to purchase another motorcycle for his business.

loans.use: to purchase another motorcycle for his business.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Meet Loise. She is a farmer living in the Muranga area of Central Kenya with her husband and 4 children; all of school going age. She has been into farming for the past 10 years earning an income from eggs and tea crops.What she enjoys most about farming is the income she gets after selling her produce. Her biggest chaallenge is low prices of farm output in the market.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they charge a low interest rate on their loans. During the training she learned how small holder farmers grow their income with what they have. Through this loan she will be able to produce milk for her family consumption and also for selling for income.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 22-year-old single man from Rafah city. He lives alone in a small simple house, and he works in transferring goods to the local traders using a rental rickshaw. It is a good business but not stable. Mahmoud would like to improve his business. 
Mahmoud took a Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new rickshaw for transferring goods. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to increase his income and improve his living conditions.  Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for transferring goods.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en:
Peninah is a married woman. She lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business, and dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 40,000, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat, maize, and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fufu for her business

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman with children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. She operates a vegetable-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other vegetable sellers in her area.
 
With the KES 15,000 loan she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits and green vegetables

loans.name: Fawzi

texts.en:
Fawzi  is a 23-years-old single man from Jabalia City. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father is an employee in the public sector where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. Fawzi is a  university student where he studies health science.

Fawzi took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan Fawzi will be able to write his reports and read articles online. 

Fawzi appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a 54-year-old woman from Nyahururu. She is married to John and they are blessed with 3 children aged 18, 16 and 12 years old.

She is a shopkeeper, a business she has been running for the past 16 years. To enable her to buy more stocks of sugar, cooking fat, rice, salt, soap and soft drinks, she has applied for her fourth loan of KES 54,000 from VisionFund Kenya, having successfully paid her previous loan of KES 40,000.

Her monthly income has increased from KES 30,000 before she got her previous loan to KES 35,000 after the loan. She has plans to use the anticipated profits from her expanded business to educate her children and to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to open a supermarket or a wholesale store.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, rice, cooking fat, salt, flour, soap and soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Kasichana

texts.en:
Kasichana is a married woman with children; all of whom attend school. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her kids.

She has operated a vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a stiff competition from other vegetable operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of tomatoes, potatoes, fruits, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Diana Marie

texts.en:
Diana Marie is 25 years old and married with one child. Diana Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Diana Marie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Diana Marie has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, coffee, milk and cereals. 

Diana Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irene is 50 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Irene has a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Irene requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Irene has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Mina

texts.en:
Mina is a hairdresser from Kapan town. She lives there with her little daughter and mother. Mina's mother has a retirement pension and also takes care of her little grandchildren, as Mina works day and night in the beauty salon. 

Mina rents a small space for providing the service, and works hard to gather a good income. 

She has now applied for this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for her hairdressing service. The loan will help her do her work easier and faster. 

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for hairdressing service

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is a hardworking man who struggles to make ends meet. His greatest monthly expenses is food.

He has operated a motorcycle business, and he appreciates the previous loan. 

He is again requesting another loan of Kshs 50,000 to buy another motorcycle for the continuity of his business.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle for the continuity of his business.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce owns a food stall business, where neighbours and town dwellers eat. She appreciates the previous loan that helped her to boost her business.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil for the business. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods such as sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more pepper, bitter ball, rice, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Jogieh Lyn

texts.en:
Jogieh Lyn is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years now, and works hard to support her family. 

Jogieh Lyn requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi has been cooking food and selling to passersby and neighbours.

With the Kshs 50,000, she wants to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil to add to her stock. 

Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

She appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase two bundles of wheat flour and cooking oil to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, coal, fish, meat, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Venerando

texts.en:
Venerando is a 50-year-old man from the town of Guindulman, Bohol. He is married with six children aged 9 - 29. 

He is engaged in a food vending business, a sari-sari (general store) and drives his motorela (motorized carriage) for an income. He has been doing this for six years now. He is asking for a loan to buy fish, seasoning, vegetables and meat.

In the future, he hopes that his business will thrive and increase profitability for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fish, seasoning, vegetables and meat

loans.name: Panfila

texts.en:
Panfila is married and has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for eight years now, and she works hard to support her family.

Panfila requested a PHP 14,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruit and vegetables for her vending.

Panfila would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables for her vending.

loans.name: Merlie

texts.en:
Merlie is 53 years old and married with two children, who are currently in school. Merlie works very hard to provide for them.

Merlie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. Merlie has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items, such as detergent soap, coffee, and sugar.

In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine has been involved in retail for 10 years with her husband. Their son is a policeman working at the regional police station.

Karine currently sells potatoes. Using their own truck, they take the harvest to nearby communities to sell. The business is small but profitable and it provides Karine and her husband with a sustainable income.

Now, she has applied for this loan to renovate their truck, which is too old and damaged. Karine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tires and truck restoration.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. She cites school fees and food as being her greatest monthly expenses.

Mariam has operated a beauty salon business for the past three years. Her potential customers are her fellow neighbors and people at the marketplace. She dreams of earning more income and incorporating hairdressing skills in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase chemicals and air conditioners for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice by the bag to expand her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is a hardworking woman who works hard to make ends meet. She appreciates all the support she has received. 

Once again she comes to you requesting a loan of KES 50,000 to buy a motorcycle for her business. 

She thanks Yehu and Kiva at large.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her business.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur is 32 years old. He is just married and they don't have any children yet. His wife is a student of Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute.

Artur graduated from the Chemistry Faculty of Vanadzor State University and then Medical University. He has already been working for 5 years as a chief doctor and dentist. He managed to establish his small dental clinic, which over the years has become popular thanks to Artur’s professional manner and skilled work.

Artur is asking for a loan as he needs to buy some new tools for his dental clinic and also some medicine for the therapeutic processes. He wants to maintain the good reputation of his dental clinic that he has built up in the last 5 years.

loans.use: to buy some new tools for his dental clinic and also some medicine for the therapeutic processes

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina works hard to support her family. Regina is married with a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for two years.  Regina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.  She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sumita

texts.en:
Sumita, 33, is an energetic married woman. She is raising one son and one daughter with her husband. They live in a remote region in the district Jalpaiguri. Both Sumita and her husband, Naresh, age 39, are illiterate and can sign their names only. But both their children go to school and are in grade 5 and grade 3.

To provide the primary income for the family, Sumita's husband does agricultural work. They don't have any land, so he works on hired land. His income is hardly enough to run the family after giving the rent for the hired farmland and bearing the educational expenses of the children. 

In order to provide additional income, Sumita is trying to do some business of her own for the betterment of the family. She is involved in animal husbandry. She has two cows and three goats, which add a little financial assistance to the family.

Now, she wants to buy another cow and forage and medicine for her cattle. She wants to start a milk products business to raise her family income. She wants to make milk products such as curd, butter, paneer, etc. and sell to her neighbours. She has chosen this because these are the products that have high demand in the market. So she has requested a loan from BJS.

She hopes that this will increase her business to give a decent and financially strong lifestyle to her family. In future she wants to increase her domestic livestock quantities and build a cowshed.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow and forage and medicine for the cattle.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna, age 46 years, is a married woman. She faced a lot of financial problems soon after her marriage as her husband's income was not sufficient to meet the expenses of their household. Her husband, Narayan, age 52 years, is a small farmer by profession, who works on others' land. They have only one son who is a college student. Both Swapna and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only. They live in the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.

Swapna started a business of animal husbandry when they were facing financial problems. She started selling milk of cows and goats to contribute in the family income. She has become famous for providing good-quality milk. She also sells animals to generate an extra amount of income. She has improved her business to meet the expenses of day-to-day of life.

Now she applied for a loan from BJS to purchase one more cow to generate more income. She is hopeful that this loan will bring positive changes to her business and she will be able to fulfill her dreams like educating her son properly and purchasing a car for their own use and to rent for another means of income.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Los Girasoles Group

texts.es:
Yesenia es una de las integrantes de Banco Mujer Los Girasoles, tiene 29 años de edad, es casada y madre de 3 niños menores de edad, 2 de ellos estudiantes de primaria.  Ella es un comerciante con mucha experiencia, inicio su negocio ya que vio la necesidad de colaborar con los gastos del hogar, ya que su esposo que es chofer de un camión de carga recibe un salario muy bajo. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita y el anterior le permitió tener más cantidad de mercadería para ofrecerles a más clientes en otras comunidades cercanas, y así aumentar sus ventas. Yesenia es una mujer muy emprendedora, que se ha trazado metas a corto y mediano plazo, su prioridad es seguir apoyando a su esposo, y especialmente aportar para los estudios de sus hijos, pero también piensa en un futuro cercano poder estudiar ella también y completar su secundaria. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para damas y zapatos tipo sandalias que se venden muy bien es está época de verano. 
Junto a Yesenia están 9 señoras más que van a invertir en diferentes actividades  como comercio, pequeña industria y también agropecuarias.
texts.en:
Yesenia is a member of the "Mujer los Girasoles" bank. She is 29 years old, married and a mother to three children, all minors; two of the children are attending primary school. Yesenia is an experienced businesswoman. She started her business as she saw a need to help with household costs as her husband is a lorry driver and receives a very low salary. This is Yesenia's second loan. Her first allowed her to buy more merchandise to offer to more customers in other nearby customers. By doing this, Yesenia was able to increase sales. 

Yesenia is a very enterprising woman who has identified short- and medium-term goals. Yesenia's priority is to continue supporting her husband and help with her children's education. In the future Yesenia would also like to study and complete high school. This loan will be used to invest in buying clothes and sandals for women, which sell well in the summer.

Alongside Yesenia work nine women who will invest in different work, including businesses, manufacturing and agricultural work.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes and sandals to sell.

loans.name: Nueva Luz Group

texts.es:
Desde hace mas de cuatro años, Yolin ha venido trabajando en la faena de pezca en alta mar,pero por el peligro al cual se expone diariamente, ha pensado en cambiar de actividad, para ahora dedicarse a la compra-venta de moluscos (concha.

Yolin, vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijas de 9,6,5 y 1 año; su esposa a mas de ayudarlo en el negocio de la compra-venta de la concha, se dedica al cuidado del hogar y de sus hijas.

Yolin, espera en un futuro no muy lejano, ver un progreso en este negocio, vender concha en mayor numero y brindar a sus hijas la posibilidad de continuar sus estudios en una carrera universitaria, que muchos no tienen las posibilidades en esta ciudad.

cabe indicar que Yolin vive actualmente en un barrio a orillas del mar en San Lorenzo, ha logrado construir su casa propia y esta en un lugar estrategico para el negocio de la concha.



INFORMACION ADICIONAL

YOLIN es el lider del grupo "NUEVA LUZ" conformado por 5 hombres y 3 mujeres, quienes vienen trabajando en forma organizada desde hace 20 meses 

Yolin aparece en la fotografia levantando su mano derecha y el grupo se considera con mucha fortaleza y deseos de trabajar en el desarrollo de su barrio.
texts.en:
For over four years, Yolin has been working in high sea fishing. However there are dangers involved in this work and so he has decided to change jobs to now buy and sell molluscs.

Yolin lives with his wife and four daughters - aged nine, six, five and one year old; Yolin's wife helps with the business of buying and selling the shellfish and also looks after the home and their daughters.

Yolin hopes that in the not-too-distant future he will see progress at his business. He wants to sell more and offer his daughters the opportunity to study at university, something that many people in this city cannot do.

Yolin currently lives in the Orillas del Mar barrio of San Lorenzo. He has managed to build his own house and is located in a strategic area for running his business.

Additional information:

Yolin is leader of the "Nueva Luz" group which has five men and three women as members. They have been working together for 20 months.

In the photo Yolin is the man with his hand in the air. The group is strong and has a desire to work so that their barrio will progress.

loans.use: to buy molluscs.

loans.name: Mahasina

texts.en:
Mahasina is a 25-year-old married woman of Dhupguri who is blessed with two children. She has read up to grade 8 and her husband is illiterate, but knows how to sign his name. 

She runs her animal husbandry business and looks after her family throughout the whole day while her husband is a farmer who sells vegetables and crops in their local market. 

From BJS (Kiva’s partner) she has taken loan to purchase a cow so that she can earn money by selling milk and milk products. The earnings from her husband’s business are very low, so she has shifted to another sector so that she can earn more money and run their family. 

Mahasina is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save money so that she can give a good future to her children and improve her family’s financial condition. She also hopes to build a concrete house with her business profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling more dairy products in her local area.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit lives in Sevan City in the Gegharkunik region. Anahit is 42 years old and she lives in this nice city with her husband and daughter. Her daughter is a student of Yerevan State University in the faculty of Romance and Germanic philology in the paid division. In the future she hopes to be a translator of English and French Languages. She likes her profession very much and she has great hopes after graduation to find work in this field. 

Anahit works as a chief accountant at one of the sports schools of Sevan. Her husband works in a flour-mill as the head of production. They both do their best to provide their single daughter with the best living conditions, but still they cannot manage to solve all of the financial problems connected with her.

This will be Anahit’s second Kiva loan, which she is requesting again to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees. This is like the previous loan that also helped them to solve this very important problem on time.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter’s tuition fees

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma has operated a food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She appreciates her previous loan.

Here again Fatuma is requesting another loan to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans that boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, beans and sugar for her business..

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana always struggles to improve her food stall, trying to sell more and save money in order to have a more formal establishment. She is requesting a loan to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken, and food packaging. She appreciates the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy beans, sugar, oil, vegetables, beef, chicken, and food packaging

loans.name: Deysi Del Carmen

texts.es:
Deysi, solicita un nuevo crédito lo invertirá en la compra de verduras, carnes, arroz, azúcar, especias, aceite, entre otros materiales para fortalecer el negocio y continuara satisfaciendo a  sus clientes y mejorando su economía.
El crédito anterior le permitió adquirir mercadería fresca para la venta de comida y pupusas, con su economía más estable ha tenido oportunidad de salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Deysi is applying for a new loan that will be used to buy vegetables, meat, rice, sugar, spices, oil and other supplies. These goods will strengthen her business and she will be able to continue to satisfy her customers and improve her financial situation.

Deysi's previous loan helped her to buy fresh merchandise for selling food and "pupusas". With more stable finances, Deysi has been able to prosper with her family.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, rice, sugar, spices, oil and other supplies.

loans.name: Flor Del Carmen

texts.es:
Flor, es una mujer emprendedora que por iniciativa propia hace tres años llevo a cabo la apertura de una venta de comida y pupusas, en ocasiones le colaboran su mamá o su hermana, su ventaja es que el local en donde lo tiene ubicado es propio, ella es acompañada y tiene una hija de 2 años.
Con el capital comprara bebidas, carnes, aceite, arroz, quesillo, verduras, gas propano, condimentos, huevos entre otros materiales para la elaboración de los distintos menús, espera tener más clientes nuevos y obtener ganancias que le servirán para pagar la deuda con un buen record crediticio y contribuir en los gastos de su casa.
Su sueño es que su negocio tenga una rentabilidad óptima para ofrecer un buen futuro a su hija.
texts.en:
Flor is an enterprising woman who, through her own initiative, started her own business selling meals and "pupusas" (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans) three years ago. Her mother or sister sometimes help with the business. One advantage that Flor has over other businesses is that she owns the premises where she works. Flor has a partner and a two-year-old daughter. 

This loan will be used to buy drinks, meat, oil, rice, cheese tortillas, vegetables, propane gas, condiments, eggs and more. These supplies will help to create different menus. Flor hopes to gain more new customers and raise profits that will help her to pay her loan with a good credit rating and to cover household costs. 

Flor's dream is for her business to be as profitable as possible in order to offer her daughter a good future.

loans.use: to buy drinks, meat, oil, rice, cheese tortillas, vegetables, propane gas, condiments, eggs and more.

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani lives with her father in Kapan town. She is a hairdresser. Two years ago she rented a small space in one of the local beauty salons. Due to her hard work, Ani was able to gather a number of loyal clients who value the quality of work that she provides. 

Ani has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing service. This will be a big support for Ani and her work, letting her make her work more effective.

Ani has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials needed for providing hairdressing service

loans.name: Rufa

texts.en:
Rufa is 59 years old and comes from Guindulman, Bohol. She is married with nine grown children. She has owned a sari-sari store for three years now, which allows her to earn 3,000 PHP per month. Her store caters to the needs of her neighborhood. She sells basic household items like seasonings, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack foods and soft drinks. She also weaves nipa (palm frond) shingles for extra income. 

Rufa is asking for a loan of 4,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of rice, candy, biscuits, soft drinks, juice powder, cooking oil, toothpaste and detergent.  She is hoping that with the loan she will no longer experience a lack of items needed by her customers. Her income will be used for food and to put aside savings.

loans.use: to buy rice, candy, biscuits, soft drinks, juice powder, cooking oil, toothpaste and detergent

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Sherly is 50 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Sherly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

Sherly has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, palm oil, pepper, vita, fish and others food items to expand her business,

loans.name: Rosa Estrella

texts.en:
Rosa Estrella is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosa Estrella is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Rosa Estrella has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosa Estrella requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business such as spices, fish, meat, etc.

Rosa Estrella has been in this business for 36 years. In the future, Rosa Estrella would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business such as spices, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Sargis

texts.en:
Sargis lives in Sevan city in Geghakunik region. He is married and he has two daughters. Both of them are students; his elder daughter studies at the Yerevan State University in the faculty of Government and Economics, while his younger daughter studies at the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute at the faculty of Fine Arts. Both of them study in the paid divisions. 

Since Sargis is the only employed person in his family, he can hardly manage to make ends meet. All financial questions are his responsibility to solve and he feels very upset since, working the whole day long, he still does not have the chance to provide for his family properly as he wishes. 

Sargis is asking for a loan of 370,000 Armenian drams since he must pay his daughters’ tuition fees, 180,000 drams for his elder daughter’s education and 190,000 drams for his younger daughter’s education.

loans.use: to pay for his daughters’ tuition fees

loans.name: Rosena

texts.en:
Rosena is 43 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Rosena works very hard to provide for them.

Rosena runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like soft drinks, detergent, soap, juice, sugar, beer, etc. to sell.

Rosena has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items. 

Rosena would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like soft drinks, detergent, soap, juice, sugar, beer, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to clothing for babies, diapers, washing bowls and children's wear

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is 55 years old and married with one child.

Jelly works hard to provide for her family running a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase bath soap, toothpaste, canned goods, cereals, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

Jelly has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF prior to this loan.  She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods and construction materials.

Jelly aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase bath soap, toothpaste, canned goods, cereals, milk, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Tamela

texts.en:
Tamela is from Masis town where she lives with her husband, mother-in-law and two grown children. For five years, Tamela has been involved in the retail business. She sells clothing and different types of cosmetics locally and in nearby communities. 

Tamela is requesting this loan to being able to enlarge the stock of clothing supplies to resell to her clients. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for new stock of clothing supplies to resell to her clients

loans.name: Hasina

texts.en:
Hasina is 30 years old, married and living in Dhupguri. Her parent’s poverty, ignorance and lack of knowledge did not allow her to receive more education. Now Hasina is a mother of two children and both of them go to school. 

Hasina is a housewife who also looks after her livestock. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is a farmer. Hasina and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their children and so that their future is not affected by poverty and ignorance. 

This loan will give them an opportunity to make her dream of expanding her business come true. Hasina and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken hold on the market for selling milk products and also vegetables. 

She is now very happy and leading a successful life due to BJS and Kiva’s financial support.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad is 59 years old and married with six children. 

Trinidad is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. Trinidad requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional livestock to sell.

Trinidad has been buying and selling livestock for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Trinidad would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married and has  children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for the family.

For the past three years, she has operated a green grocery business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is seasonality of products reducing the sales. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of green vegetables, tomatoes and onions for resale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother who lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces the major challenge of strong competition in her business. But she dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting, Elizabeth wants to buy more bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans and hence boost her business.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Zoya

texts.en:
Zoya is a nurse with 20 years of working experience. She lives with her husband and 22-year-old son. Her husband works at a local store as a gatekeeper.
