Zoya herself has, for over 20 years, been providing medical care service for patients at home. She is very nice and a qualified nurse and locals value her a lot. 

Zoya has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase some tools and equipment needed for her work. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

This loan is very important for Zoya.

loans.use: to pay for tools and equipment for providing  medical care for patients at home

loans.name: Maa Mangala Shg Group

texts.en:
In 2011, nine women from a small village in Odisha stepped out and decided to build a secure future for their families. They formed a group named Maa Mangala Self-Help Group. The members of Maa Mangala Self-Help Group are all women from the district of Jajpur in Odisha, India. 

One of them is Puspalata, who was selected as their president. In the picture, the lady standing with raised hand is Puspalata. 

Puspalata is 33 years old and lives with her husband and her four children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in the activity of cultivation for a long time. 

She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighbourhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on the leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, but later on, she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, lady fingers and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. 

Now she has a new idea to purchase some more seeds, vegetable plants, fertilizers, and pesticides to increase her production and grow vegetables on a large scale, for which she has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chalema

texts.en:
Chalema is 26 years old. She is from a remote region of the district Jalpaiguri. She is married. Her husband, Motiyar, is 44 years old. They are illiterate and can only sign their names. They are raising two school-going daughters who are in grades 7 and 8. They live in their own house in Dhupguri.

Chalema's husband is a trader of green vegetables. He buys vegetables from the farmers of their village and sells in the local market. His income is so scanty that it can hardly cover the household expenses and at the same time the educational expenses of their daughters. So to help her husband, Chalema runs an animal husbandry business. She started this business few years back. She has now one milking cow and one goat. She wants to increase the number of cattle and improve the family's living condition.

Chalema has taken a loan from BJS, which extends helping hands to needy rural woman to start up businesses. She plans to purchase a goat for her animal husbandry. She hopes in future she will sell the goats to the local butchers to generate more income. The additional profit from her business will enable her to provide better education to her children and a decent lifestyle to her family.

She is very much grateful to the lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a goat for her animal husbandry.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 38 years old from Duero, Bohol. She is married with two children aged one and two. She has owned a sari-sari store for two years now, which allows her to earn 3,000 PHP per month. Her store sells items such as seasoning, canned goods, noodles, eggs, toiletries, snack food and soft drinks. 

Carol is asking for a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy additional stock of rice, candy, biscuits, soft drinks, juice powder, cooking oil, toothpaste and detergent. She is hoping that with the loan she will not lack items needed by her customers. Her income will be used to buy food, add to her savings and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of rice, candy, biscuits, soft drinks, juice powder, cooking oil, toothpaste and detergent

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is from Duero on the island of Bohol, the Philippines. She is 54 years old and married with three adult children. For four years now, she has been operating a food vending business in her neighborhood, selling snacks such as rice cakes, pancakes and home-cooked viand. She is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like sugar, flour and cooking oil. 

Divina would like to add more snack types in the future to attract more customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Anointing Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Anointing and on their first loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group has five members. They sell fish and maize.

The featured borrower is Ayishatu, who is 44 years old and married with children. This loan benefits the small micro entrepreneurs group where Ayishatu is a member. She says that this is the first time she has joined ID-Ghana. She joined through an invitation from a cousin who is a member of the institution. 

Currently, she has a business selling fresh fish that she buys from the fishermen and sells to customers. She says that the business started with a little capital she had, and it still will need financial support. That is why she has come to ID-Ghana, so that she can grow the business.

The group will need a total amount of GHS 1,800 to grow their businesses.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish from the the fishermen and sell to customers.

loans.name: Soma

texts.en:
Soma is a rural housewife from the small town Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She has a primary education. She is 29 years old and blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  All of her children go to school.  Her husband, Ananda, is illiterate and engaged in a business of firewood. They all live in their house.

Soma's husband is a hardworking man with a great desire to get ahead personally and professionally.  He is a small businessman who sells firewood. He collects firewood from the wholesalers of his own village and nearby villages and sells to the retailers. Since firewood is used as fuel for cooking in rural areas, it is a very lucrative business. He has been in this business more than 15 years and his dreams are to make improvements to his house, give better education to his children, and to grow his business. They also want to cut a pond in their land behind their house for their own use.

Soma has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to help her husband by purchasing more firewood so that they will have a bit more income and they will fulfill their dreams.

Soma thanks her lenders for giving her the loan to go ahead with their business.

loans.use: To purchase more firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mandiasuni Shg Group

texts.en:
Mamata, the lady standing with her raised hand in photo, is 24 years old and married. She has four children of whom all are in schooling. Her family lives in a village of the Jajpur District in Odisha, India. She and her husband earn a living through working as farmers and cultivating rice and vegetables. Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 4,000 INR per month to meet her family’s needs. 

Mamata is leading a group named Mandiasuni Self-Help Group. Its 10 members are applying for the loan with Peoples' Forum. The members of Mandiasuni SHG are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, general store, dairy farm, wood business. 

Mamata is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides and some irrigation tools for her farmland.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a native bag-making business in the Philippines. She has been doing this for seven years and she also earns more income from raising pigs.

Josephine is borrowing 40,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her bag making.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending and buying and selling charcoal. Delia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lene Irene

texts.en:
Lene Irene works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Lene Irene requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for two years now.

Lene Irene would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks for her business

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is 65 years old and married with two children. 

Virgincita is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Virgincita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Virgincita has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Virgincita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Catalino Rey

texts.en:
Catalino Rey is 38 years old and has two children. He is married and has one child who is currently in school.

Catalino Rey is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. He requested a PHP 15,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his pigs.

Catalino Rey has been in pig fattening for 14 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Catalino Rey would like to save money to provide a secure future for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his pigs

loans.name: Benilda

texts.en:
Benilda is a married woman with four adult children. She owns a sari-sari (general store) in the community of Duero, Bohol. She sells items like chips, canned goods, noodles, toiletries and seasonings. For four years now, this has been her livelihood, earning her 8000 PHP per month. 

Benilda is asking for a loan to buy gasoline, slippers, and rice. She dreams of becoming successful in her business so she can even help in raising her grandchildren and sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy gasoline, slippers, and rice

loans.name: Kelyn Cecibel

texts.es:
Kelyn, invirtió el financiamiento anterior en aumentar los productos de la tienda con los que su cartera de clientes ha crecido, sus nuevas ventas le dan mejores ganancias y le sirven para modificar la infraestructura de su vivienda y mejorar las circunstancias de su grupo familiar.
El capital que solicita lo utilizara para comprar bebidas, golosinas, pan, jabón, aceite, granos básicos, papel higiénico, etc., para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Kelyn invested the previous loan in increasing the products she sells at her store. Her clientele has grown and her new sales bring better profits and have made her able to modify the infrastructure of her store and improve her family circumstances. 

The capital she is asking for will be used to buy beverages, snacks, bread, soap, oil, basic grains, toilet paper, etc. to meat the basic needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snacks, bread, soap, oil, basic grains, toilet paper, etc.

loans.name: Joyna

texts.en:
Joyna operates a business of selling food consumables, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the loan she is requesting,  she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food stall

loans.name: Marlon Anderson

texts.es:
Esta es la historia de un Joven adolescente,  Llamado Marlon Anderson él es  un joven con muchas ganas de estudiar  ya que  curso  la primaria  siendo un excelente estudiante; terminando la primaria a los ocho Años de Edad.
El Ingresa a hacer  el bachillerato a los ocho Años  de edad  aun, y culminándolo  a los  quince años.
 Siempre se destacó por ser un estudiante muy  dedicado, comprometido, inteligente e inquieto por el aprendizaje.
El ya lleva un año  de haber terminado  los estudios  y  en estos momentos  es  muy difícil ingresar a una universidad;  debido  a que él, no cuenta con los recursos  necesarios para dicha educación,  ya que la Madre  del joven  es cabeza de  familia  y con mucho esfuerzo   quiere  que    el  hijo   lleve a cabo los estudios de educación superior, el joven  quiere ingresar a Estudiar en La sede  las Mercedes;  porque quiere superarse y adquirir  mayor conocimiento sobre el diseño gráfico y publicitario,  pues este programa  es uno  de los favoritos  porque   le enriquece  el  léxico y  el nivel intelectual, le permite ser  un empleado pro activo  en el área, porque  desea  ser  competitivo en el ámbito laboral  y mejorar los ingresos  para así en el futuro tener una  mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This is the story of a young man named Marlon Anderson who has a great desire to continue his studies. He was an excellent student in primary school which he finished aged eight. He then went on to high school which he completed at age fifteen. He has always been a dedicated, committed and intelligent student, always eager to learn.

He's already been a year out of school; at the moment it is very difficult to return to university as he lacks the necessary money. His mother is head of the family and wishes greatly that her son could complete his higher education courses. 

Marlon wishes to study at the Mercedes head office as he wants to get ahead and learn more about graphic design and advertising. This program would enable him to enrich his vocabulary and challenge him intellectually. It would permit him to be a forward-looking employee as he wishes to be competitive in the workplace and increase his income so he can have a better standard of living.

loans.use: Pay for a semester of education

loans.name: Mónica Yazmín

texts.es:
Mónica es una mujer activa y pujante, a sus 31 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 6 y 10 años.
Desde hace varios años se dedica a vender comida que ella misma prepara como tamales y morcilla, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre quien le colabora cada fin de semana en la preparación y venta de los productos y, además todos los miércoles le hacen encargos especiales en la empresa donde labora su esposo, así logra generar recursos para aportar a la economía familiar, teniendo la oportunidad de poder pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.
El crédito solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de un congelador e insumos al por mayor (verduras, carnes, pollo, granos, entre otros), esto le permitirá tener más espacio para el almacenamiento de los productos y podrá cumplir con la preparación y entrega oportuna de los pedidos, con lo que se beneficiarán sus ventas e ingresos.
Mónica sueña con tener su negocio en un local abierto al público en el que pueda atender mayor flujo de clientes y así mejorar la rentabilidad de su labor, garantizando así una estabilidad financiera para dar una buena educación a sus hijos y disfrutar con su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mónica is an active and driven woman. She is 31 years old and lives with her husband and their two children, aged 6 and 10. For several years, she has sold food that she prepares herself, such as tamales and blood sausage. She learned this trade from her mother, who works with her every weekend preparing and selling the food. In addition, every Wednesday, they fill special orders at the business where her husband works. This way, they are able to generate resources to contribute to the family budget, and she has the chance to spend more time with her children.  

She is asking for the loan to buy a freezer and ingredients wholesale (vegetables, meat, chicken, grains, and more). This will allow her to have more space to store her products and be able to prepare and deliver her orders in a timely manner. This will benefit her sales and her income. Mónica dreams of having her business in a locale open to the public where she can have a bigger flow of customers and thus improve the profitability of her work. This will guarantee financial stability to give her children a good education and enjoy a better quality of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and some ingredients wholesale (vegetables, meat, chicken, grains, and more)

loans.name: Kelvin Francisco

texts.es: Kelvin tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa, su hijo de 2 años y su hijastra de 14 años de edad. Kelvin y su esposa se ganan la vida mediante la comercialización de variedad de ropa para dama desde hace 5 años. Las ventas las realiza en las principales zonas de su localidad y muchas personas prefieren sus productos. Kelvin desea terminar de construir su vivienda dado que no ha podido terminarla por falta de recursos económicos. Por lo anterior solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, hierro, cemento, grava y arena y así finalizar su vivienda y poder mudarse lo antes posible.
texts.en: Kelvin is 38 years old and lives in his own house along with his wife, his two year-old son and his step daughter who is 14.  Kelvin and his wife earn a living by selling a variety of clothing for women.  They have been working in this field for 5 years.  They make sales in the main shopping areas in their town and many people prefer their products.  Kelvin wants to finish building his home since he has not been able to finish it due to a lack of economic resources.  For that reason he is asking for a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI in order to invest in the purchase of bricks, iron, cement, gravel and sand in order to finish his home and be able to move in as soon as possible.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of bricks, iron, cement, gravel and sand in order to finish his home

loans.name: Ana Cristina

texts.es:
Son las siete de la mañana y el olor a cafecito caliente sale de la casa de Ana María Villareal,  ya todo está listo para que la gente pase a comprar un desayuno ligero por si les agarro la tarde. Ana es originaria de la ciudad de Granada, tiene 57 años, está casada y tiene cuatro hijos. Sólo logró completar sus estudios de primaria, sin embargo eso no la detuvo para salir adelante. Junto a su esposo, que es vendedor ambulante en el mercado, quieren brindarle un futuro prospero a sus hijos.
Sus ventas han incrementado, por lo que solicita un préstamo y así comprar más contenedores, vasos, platos y granos básicos. Uno de sus objetivos es condicionar mejor la casa, para darle más espacio a la cafetería y de esta manera su clientela siga aumentando.
texts.en:
It's seven in the morning and the aroma of hot coffee is coming from the house of Ana María Villareal. Everything is ready for people to come in and buy a light breakfast before it gets late. Ana is from the city of Granada. She is 57 years old, married and has four children. She was only able to finish primary school. Nonetheless, this didn't stop her from getting ahead. She and her husband, who is a street vendor in the market, want to offer their children a prosperous future.  

Her sales have increased and that is why she is asking for a loan to buy containers, cups, plates and basic grains. One of her goals is to fix up her house more so the cafe can have more space so that her customers will increase.

loans.use: to buy more containers, cups, plates and basic grains.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloría tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos de 8 años, 6 años y 3 años de edad. Gloria  se dedica a la prestación de servicios domésticos desde hace mucho tiempo. Desea construir un pequeño muro en su vivienda para que sirva como protección y al mismo tiempo que pueda servir para sentarse por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, ladrillo, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder construir el muro lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Gloria is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and three children aged 8, 6, and 3. She has been a domestic servant for many years. She wishes to build a small wall at her house for protection and which, at the same time, will allow her to feel safer. 

Gloria has approached FUSAI to ask for a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand and gravel. She hopes to obtain the money so she can build the wall as soon as possible.

loans.use: Buy cement, bricks, sand, and gravel

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with children. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a charcoal selling business. She sells from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With the loan she is requesting of KES 30,000, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is a 37 year-old, married woman from Duero, Bohol. She has two children ages four and 12. 

Florita operates a shop where she sell cell phone accessories such as cases, prepaid and sim card to her customers.  She started her business four years ago and earns about 6000 PHP per month. 

Florita is asking for a loan to buy cellphone cases, batteries and sim cards.  The income that she hopes to generate will provide her family with food, pay basic household bills and save for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy cellphone cases, batteries and sim cards.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more water, soap, rice, toothpaste, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Inocensio

texts.en:
Inocencio is 31 years old and from the municipality of Duero, Bohol. He is single and engaged in making and selling snacks such as chicharon (pork cracklings), polvoron (powdered milk candy made of flour, sugar butter and powdered milk), macaroni salad and other candies.

From this business he earns an average income of 4,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) per month. He is asking for a loan to buy pork skin, macaroni shells, sugar, milk and flour. The income that he will generate will provide his family food and help pay the basic household bills.

In the future, he hopes to be more successful in his business.

loans.use: to buy pork skin, macaroni shells, sugar, milk and flour

loans.name: Glerry

texts.en:
Glerry is 38 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Glerry works very hard to provide for them.

Glerry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Glerry has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as bread, rice, eggs, detergent soap, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Glerry would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary Glen

texts.en:
Mary Glen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a native bags-making business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Mary Glen has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from a general store.

Mary Glen has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her native bags-making business.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: María Eugenia tiene 35 años de edad, es soltera, se dedica a sembrar café, lechuga, repollo, culantro y albahaca.En esta zona es muy difícil desplazarse a un supermercado a comprar estas legumbres, por lo que es un buen mercado para vender estos productos. Con ayuda de su esposo logra sembrar y mantener correctamente estos cultivos,desea este crédito para comprar más semillas y herbicidas con el fin de lograr el sabor y crecimiento adecuado. Esto le permite consumir ellos mismos estas hortalizas y vender buena cantidad al que lo desee. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la facilidad de tramitar un crédito y baja tasa de interés.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is 35 years old. She grows coffee, lettuce, cabbage, cilantro, and basil. In the area where she lives it is very difficult to get to a supermarket to buy this produce so there is a good market for it. With help from her husband María Eugenia manages to sow and look after her crops. 

With the loan money she plans to buy more seeds and herbicide in order to improve the flavour and ensure proper growth. The family can consume the produce and also sell a large amount to whomever wishes to buy it. She chose Fundación Mujer for the ease of getting a loan and the low interest rates.

loans.use: Buy herbicide and seeds

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married and works hard to support her family.  She runs a fishing business in the Philippines.

Elisa requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.  She has been in the fishing business for 42 years.

Elisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Shogher

texts.en:
Shogher is from Kapan and she lives with her only child, Eva, who is 13-years-old. 

Shogher has been involved in a retail cosmetics and clothing business for four years. She is a hard worker and is very nice to her customers. 

Now Shogher is asking for a loan. She would like to buy more cosmetics and clothing to sell to her customers, in order to meet the demand for her products.

Shogher has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up funds to people who do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics and clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, oil, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia is 45 years old, married to a farmer and lives in Duero, Bohol. For five years, she has earned a living by farming vegetables like string beans and eggplants. She earns an average income of 5,000 PHP a month and is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides. The income that she earns will provide her family food and pay basic household bills and school fees for her four children, who range in age from 5 to 10 years old.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Gervasia

texts.en:
Gervasia is 63 years old from Duero, Bohol.  She is married with four adult children. In spite of her age, Gervasia works hard to earn a living. 

For 30 years now she has raised hogs to earn an income.  Gervasia usually earns about 8000 PHP after she sells her fattened hogs. 

Gervasia is asking for a loan of 11000 PHP to support her business and to buy piglets, hog pellets and growth booster feed. 

With this loan she will be able to focus on caring after her hogs and feed them so they will grow healthy.  This will make it easier for her to market, in four months. 

Gervasia is grateful that even at her age, she can still work hard to support her needs.  In the future, she hopes to expand her piggery business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, hog pellet and growth booster feed.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child still in school, Carmen works very hard to provide for them.

Carmen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Carmen has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, toothpaste, noodles, etc. 

Carmen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rovelyn

texts.en:
Rovelyn is single and has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Rovelyn requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Rovelyn has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Rovelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Alexander De Jesús

texts.es:
Alexander, con 37 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y pujante, vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos, quienes son su principal motivación para luchar constantemente en busca de su bienestar.
Actualmente se encuentra desempleado y, con el ánimo de generar ingresos para solventar los gastos de su hogar, decidió emprender su propio negocio, un minimercado que estará ubicado en el barrio donde reside, para lo cual ya tomó en arriendo un local pero requiere comprar estanterías, vitrinas y surtido al por mayor (granos, pastas, lácteos, carnes frías, galletería, productos de aseo), razón por la que se motiva a solicitar el apoyo del crédito. Esto le permitirá dar inicio a su proyecto productivo con el que espera generar ingresos para su familia y brindar oportunidades de empleo.
Al abrir su negocio, Alexander estaría cumpliendo su mayor anhelo, por lo que luchará incansablemente para sacarlo adelante y lograr posicionarlo en el sector, para así garantizar una estabilidad económica que le permita brindar una educación de buena calidad a sus hijos y un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida para toda la familia.
texts.en:
Alexander, 37 years old, is a vigorous and hardworking man who lives with his wife and their 3 children, who are his principal motivation for constantly struggling in quest of their wellbeing.

At present Alexander is unemployed and, with the determination to generate income to cover household expenses, he decided to open his own business, a mini-market to be located in the barrio where he resides. To do this, Alexander has rented a location but he needs shelving, display cases, and a selection of merchandise to be purchased at wholesale (grains, pasta, milk products, frozen meat, biscuit tins, and cleaning products). That is why he is requesting a loan. This will permit him to launch his productive project, with which he hopes to generate income for his family and also offer employment opportunities.  

Upon opening his store, Alexander will be achieving his major desire and he will struggle tirelessly to advance and succeed in positioning it in the sector, to guarantee the economic stability that will allow him to provide his children with a good quality education and a better standard of living and quality of life for all the family.

loans.use: buy shelving, display cases, and a selection of merchandise at wholesale (grains, pasta, milk products,frozen meat, biscuit tins, and cleaning products).

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline has been blessed with children and she is happy for that. She owns a house but does not have access to electricity nor piped water. 

For the past four years, Caroline has operated a retail shop, selling household consumables to local customers. She faces a major challenge related to the cost to transport her supplies to her place of business. 

With the loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, beans, maize flour and soft drinks.

loans.name: Marcela

texts.en:
Marcela is a 56-year-old woman from the town of Valencia, Bohol.  She is married with four adult children. 

She has been involved in the fish vending business for five years.  This helps Marcela bring in a 4000 PHP profit every month. 

Marcela is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish to sell in her community.  Her income will help pay for household bills and enable her to buy her family a healthy meal.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Teojerma

texts.en:
Teojerma is 52 years old and married with four children.

Teojerma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her general store.

Teojerma has borrowed and repaid twenty loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from buying and selling brooms and retailing gasoline.

Teojerma aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en: Lorelie is 42 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for her children, all of whom are currently in school. She earns a living by running a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as snack foods, milk, coffee, noodles, cereals, and candies. Lorelie has been in business for 10 years would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida, 33, is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Four of her children attend school.

Bienvenida has a native mats weaving business in the Philippines. She requests a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her business.

Bienvenida has been in business for five years. She would like to expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia operates a grocery vegetables selling stall at the local market to town dwellers and neighbors. 

She faces a challenge related to the high cost of transporting her vegetables to her place of operation.

With the Kshs 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.  She appreciates your support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes and onions.

loans.name: Anik

texts.en:
Anik lives in Stepanavan with her parents and sister. Her father is currently working as a laborer outside of the country. Anik herself has been doing a retail business. She sells cosmetics at home. Due to her nice attitude and hard work, she receives a number of orders from her clients. 

By applying for this loan Anik asks for financial support for purchasing new stock of cosmetics for her customers. The loan will greatly support Anik to meet her clients' orders, and she would be very grateful to lenders for their goodwill.

She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a 60 year-old owns and operates a Sari-sari (convenience) store in Valencia, Bohol.  She is married with two adult children. 

For the past seven years, Myrna has run her business. She is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of merchandise such as canned goods, chips, candies, chips and biscuits to replenish her store's inventory. 

In the future, she plans to buy more products and items that she does not currently carry, to increase her overall income.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, chips, candies, chips and biscuits.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past two years, Nyevu has operated a charcoal selling business.  She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby.  Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation.

With this Kes 50,000 loan, Nyevu wants to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for resale.  Nyevu decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 30 bags of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is a married woman; she has children, all of whom attend school.  Charity owns a house but it does not have electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her kids.

Charity sells potatoes, vegetables and charcoal from home to neighbors and passersby. She faces stiff competition from other retail operators in her business.
 
With the Kshs 50,000 loan Charity wants to purchase sacks of charcoal, green vegetables and potatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal, green vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu operates a fish-selling business. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business and competition as well.

With the 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase bundles of fish for resale. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future, and she appreciates the support.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish for resale

loans.name: Carlos Arnulfo

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 46 años de edad, está casado y tiene 5 hijos, sus 2 hijas mayores ya formaron su propio hogar, en casa solo viven sus 3 hijos y su esposa, por lo tanto son los únicos que dependen de él.

Él es agricultor, siembra maíz y maicillo, además tiene ocho años realizando la siembra de sandía, decidió dedicarse a esta labor debido a que en el lugar donde vive la tierra es muy fértil para la sandía, el lugar donde él siembra está a 2 minutos caminando de su casa, sus hijos mayores le ayudan con el trabajo en la agricultura y la siembra de sandía, su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 12:00 del mediodía pero por las tardes siempre supervisan el sembradío.

El dinero lo utilizará para cancelar el alquiler de la tierra donde siembra la sandía, comprará la semilla y los fertilizantes necesarios para obtener una buena producción, la necesidad satisfecha es el de tener el capital necesario para iniciar con el trabajo.

Sus planes a futuro son tener su propio terreno para cultivar y no tener que gastar en alquiler, y también le gustaría incrementar la producción de sandía.
texts.en:
Carlos is 46 years old, married, and has 5 children. His 2 eldest daughters have already formed their own households. Just 3 children and his wife, his only dependents, still reside with him.

Carlos is a farmer who sows corn and maicillo. For the last 8 years, he has also grown watermelons. Now he has decided to focus on the latter, given the fact that at the place where he lives the earth is very fertile for watermelon. The location is just a 2 minute walk from his home. Carlos' older children help him with the agricultural work and with planting watermelon. His daily work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until noon. Then afternoons, he always supervises the preparations for planting.

Carlos will use the money to pay the rent for the land where he will sow watermelons, and to purchase seeds and the fertilizers necessary for good production. He takes great satisfaction in acquiring the funds necessary to initiate the work.

Carlos' future plans are to have his own land to cultivate and not to have to pay rent, and also, he would like to expand his watermelon production.

loans.use: to pay the rent for land where he will plant watermelon, and to buy the necessary seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en: Ruzanna lives in Kapan town and has been in the business of selling clothing out of her house for the last year. This business is profitable in her community, which is why she would like to continue it. She used to travel to nearby countries to buy items to sell, but now would like to place her orders through suppliers so that she can spend more time with her family, including her parents and brother. Ruzanna has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides loans with easy payback terms to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit. The loan will provide huge support to Ruzanna's business and she is excited about receiving help from Kiva and SEF International.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en: Gulnazi is 56 years old, married and lives in the Gurjaani district with her son and husband, who works at a local market for a fixed salary. The family has a farm and she works hard on the land, growing and selling cereals locally. However the income isn't enough to cover all their daily expenses, which is why Gulnazi decided to expand her activity. To do this, she has requested a loan that was approved under the terms of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo that gives people a chance to start or re-start a businesses. With a loan of 10,00 GEL, she will buy fruits and vegetables to sell. She will occasionally go to the capital and buy products at wholesale prices that she sells for retail prices. This will give her a chance to earn more income and become financially independent. Her goal is to save enough money to provide a better future for her son. Gulnazi thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to begin selling produce.

loans.name: Paterna

texts.en:
51-year-old Paterna is married with two adult children. She lives in Valencia, Bohol and relies on hog raising for an income. This has been her business for five years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more feed for her hogs. Once this is available, she can just take care of her hogs without having to worry about the expense of feed.  

She plans to continue investing in hog raising and making her business even bigger for her family’s better future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.ru:
Уктам трудолюбивый и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 49 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Вместе со своей семьёй он живёт в сельском посёлке. Вот уже около 15 лет Уктам занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуры. И от этого бизнеса он получает хороший доход. Он  выращивает  сельхозкультуру, такую как  лук, зерно, помидор и  другое. В этой работе ему помогает его семья. А также Уктам работает плотником и мастером по строительству домов.

От своей работы Уктам получает приемлемый заработок. И сейчас он хочет отремонтировать свой дом, поставить хорошие и качественные пластиковые окна и двери. Но для этого у него недостаточно денежных средств, чтобы купить все необходимые строительные материалы. Поэтому Уктам обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку строительных материалов для ремонта своего дома. Он заранее благодарит Арванд за финансовую поддержку и надеется на положительный результат.
texts.en:
Uktam is a hardworking and positive man of the age of 49 years. He is married and has two children. He lives in a village together with his family. Uktam has worked with field crop cultivation for a period of 15 years already. He gets a good income from this business. He grows crops such as onions, corn, tomatoes and so on. His family helps him with the work. Uktam also works as a carpenter and master house builder. He receives an acceptable income from this work. 

Currently Uktam would like to renovate his house, installing good quality windows and doors. He does however not have sufficient financial means for purchasing all the building materials. Therefore, Uktam turned to Arvand and would like to take a loan to purchase building materials for renovating his house. He thanks Arvand in advance for the financial support, and hopes for a positive result.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Lusine

texts.en:
Lusine lives in Vanadzor town with her husband and two children (18 and 12 years old). She has been providing sewing services for locals at home. Due to her hard and good-quality work, Lusine receives many orders from her customers. She requested this loan to purchase materials to meet current orders. This will be a big support for Lusine's small business and she would be very grateful to lenders. 

Lusine has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials for providing sewing services.

loans.name: Astghik

texts.en:
Astghik lives in Vanadzor town with her husband and two little kids. Her husband is a migrant worker. Astghik alone has been providing design services. She receives orders to organize different evening parties, and due to her talented work, Astghik is highly valued among locals in Vanadzor town. She requested this loan to purchase tools and materials needed for providing her service. 

Astghik has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for tools and materials for providing design services.

loans.name: Lyudmila

texts.en:
Lyudmila lives in Sisian town with her husband, father-in-law and 8-year-old child. Lyudmila has been providing culinary services in Sisian town. She rents a small space in the center of the town and receives different culinary orders from locals. She is very qualified and a hardworking cook who does her best to satisfy her clients' needs. 

Lyudmila has now applied for this loan to be able to purchase materials that she needs for providing her culinary service. She has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for materials for providing culinary services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more eggs to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy  cows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more perfume to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more baby clothing and slippers for her business

loans.name: Yehowa Adom Group

texts.en:
These ladies are part of the group called Yehowa Adom and are from Dansoman. It is composed of women who know each other from the neighborhood. They are women with the average age of 40 years old. They live in large traditional families in Dansoman-Accra, Ghana.

Eunice is the featured borrower. She is engaged in the buying and selling of soft drinks. She has been in this type of small-scale commerce for several years and is highly sought-after.

In order to meet the growing need of their customers, the group members decided to join the ID-Ghana's loan program. They are on their seventh group loan.

Eunice plans to use her loan to buy 10 cartons of Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite and Malta Guinness to sell to customers. She procures her goods from the wholesaler depot in Accra. She hopes to earn a good monthly profit, which will allow her to repay the loan and to reinvest in her business of selling soft drinks.

loans.use: To buy 10 cartons of Coca-Cola, Fanta, Sprite, and Malta Guinness to sell to customers.

loans.name: María Estela

texts.es:
María tiene 33 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor, tiene 5 hijos, solo dos de ellos estudian en la escuela y los demás han formado sus propios hogares, y nadie mas depende de ella. 

María tiene un puesto de frutas en el mercado, cuenta con 18 años dedicándose a la venta, esta actividad la aprendió de una amiga q se dedicaba a lo mismo. El mercado donde ella vende le queda a 30 minutos de su casa y se va en bus y nadie mas de su familia se involucra en el trabajo pues su esposo trabaja todo el día en la agriculura.    

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más frutas y verduras, como jocotes, naranjas, manzanas, guineos, tomates, ejotes y aguacates, esto les permitirá tener más productos a la venta y mejorar las ganancias pasara sacar adelante a su familia.

Dentro de sus planes está siempre tener el negocio pero tener un local indicado para la venta de su mercadería.
texts.en:
María is 33 years old and did not have the opportunity to go school. María has a partner - a farmer - and the couple has five children. Only two of the children are in school; the others have their own homes. Nobody else depends on María.

María has had a fruit stall at the market for 18 years. She learned this trade from a friend who did the same work. The market is 30 minutes from María's house - she arrives their by bus - and she works without help from other family members.

This loan will be used to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, mangoes, apples, tomatoes, string beans and avocados. This will allow María to offer more products for sale and she will earn higher profits to help the family prosper.

One of María's future plans is to keep her business to have a place to sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables, such as oranges, mangoes, apples, tomatoes, string beans and avocados.

loans.name: Soraida Cristina

texts.es:
La perseverancia de Soraida Ayala es el vivo ejemplo de un emprendedor, pues inicio vendiendo frijoles cocidos en su casa, después gracias a préstamos fue creciendo poco a poco, hasta tener una venta completa. No obstante, en sus escasos 5 años como comerciante y dueña de una pulpería en Granada, sufrió un grave declive debido a que su ex-esposo robó en su establecimiento, dejándole grandes pérdidas en el negocio. Sin embargo, junto a su esposo actual, decidió levantar de nuevo la pulpería y se sumó a la venta de ropa usada. 
Desde entonces, sabe que con el apoyo de su esposo, la motivación de su hijo de 19 años y el préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA, se visualiza con un negocio estable, que ofrezca más variedad.
Solicita el crédito para comprar: Arroz, Azúcar, Frijoles, entre otros granos básicos. Además su visión principal es comercializar ropa por toda su comarca y por qué no poseer su propia tienda.
texts.en:
The perseverance of Soraida Ayala is the living example of an entrepreneur. She started selling cooked beans from her house and then thanks to her loans grew little by little until she had a complete range of sales. Forever with only 5 years as a businessperson and owner of a small store in Granada she had a serious decline as her ex-husband robbed her store leaving her store with great losses. However with her present husband she decided to open the store again, adding the sale of used clothing.

Since then knowing that she has the support of her husband and motivated by her 19 year old son and the loan from MiCrédito and KIva she can see a stable business which offers more variety. She is requesting a loan to buy rice, sugar, beans and other basic grains. Also her main vision is to sell her clothing in the whole area as she does not have her own store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and other basic grains.

loans.name: Botir

texts.ru:
Ботир добродушный и трудолюбивый мужчина в возрасте 50 лет.  Он женат и имеет троих детей. Со своей семьёй Ботир живут в сельском посёлке.  Для того, чтобы иметь доход на проживание Ботир занимается своим бизнесом. Вот уже на протяжении 10 лет он занимается выращиванием сельхозкультуру, а также выращивает лук. Затем, когда собирает урожай, вывозит на большой базар и  там продаёт свой урожай. Раньше он занимался деканством и потом решил реализовывать свой урожай.

Также как дополнительный доход, Ботир имеет от другого вида бизнеса. У него имеется несколько голов скота, которых он выращивает для дальнейшей продажи. Но сейчас Ботир  хочет расширить бизнес, именно по выращиванию сельхозкультуры.  Но сейчас у него недостаточно собственных денежных средств, чтобы закупить семена для посева урожая. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет взять кредит для закупа семян для посева. Ботир очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Botir is a good-natured and hardworking man of the age of 50 years. He is married and has three children. Botir lives in a village with his family. 

In order to have an income for living, Botir has his own business. He has worked with growing crops for a period of 10 years already, and he also grows onions. After he has gathered the harvest, he goes to a large bazar and sells it there. Earlier he worked with dekhan farming, but then he decided to sell his harvest. As an additional income, Botir has another business. He has a few heads of cattle, which he breeds for selling. 

Currently Botir would like to expand his business of field crop cultivation. However he does not currently have sufficient private funds to purchase seeds for sowing crops. Therefore he turned to Arvand and would like to take a loan to purchase seeds for sowing. Botir hopes for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy seeds

loans.name: Ilda

texts.pt:
A Sra Ilda de 32 anos de idade, casada e mae de 1 filho que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primario. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade e vestuario actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 5 anos, seus produtos sao adquiridos na visinha Africa do Sul e vende na porta da sua casa uma vez que ela nao possue um estabelecimento commercial e os vestuarios vende pela encomenda.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necessidade (refregerante, arroz, caldos, cebola, farrinha de milho mais deversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.

Tem como desafio construer um estabelicimento commercial, melhorar as condicoes da dieta almentar e espandir o seu negocio para os grandes mercados.
texts.en:
Mrs Ilda is 32 years old, married and has 1 son who goes to primary school. She's an informal trader who has been selling basic products and clothes for the last 5 years. Her products are bought in neighbouring South Africa and she sells them from the front door of her home as she doesn't own a commercial establishment and she makes clothes to order.

This loan will be used to buy essential products (sodas, rice, stocks, corn flour, onions and other products) to increase the volume of her business.

Her challenge is to build a commercial establishment, improve the nutrition in her diet and expand her business to the big markets.

loans.use: buy essential products (sodas, rice, stocks, corn flour, onions and other products) to increase the volume of her business.

loans.name: Khuriyat

texts.ru: Хурият жительница одного не из многих городков Таджикистана Турсунзаде. Ей 28 лет. Она живет вместе с родителями с сестренкой и сыном. Хурият мать одиночка. На данный момент отец и сестра Хурията находятся на территории Российской Федерации. Следить за ребенком, за сыном ей помогает мама. Чтобы вырастить сына и помочь родителям обеспечить семью Хурият занимается животноводством. Она выращивает скотин на скотном дворе. Сейчас она решила купить несколько телят и расширить малый бизнес с целью увеличения дохода, потому что ее сын растет и надо думать о его образовании. Хурият искреннее надеется на Вашу помощь.
texts.en:
Khuriyat is a resident of one of the few towns in Tursun-zoda, Tajikistan. She is 28 years old. She livest together with her parents, sister and son. Khuriyat is a single mother. Currently Khuriyat's father and sister are in the Russian Federation. Her mother helps her look after her child, her son. 

In order to raise her son and help the parents support the family, Khuriyat works with livestock breeding. She breeds cattle in the cattleyard. Currently she has decided to purchase some calves and expand her small business with an aim to increase the income, because her son grows and she needs to think of his education. Khuriyat sincerely hopes for your help.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for expanding her small business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs like manure, pesticides, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль, 43 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей, все дети самостоятельны и живут отдельно,двое дочерей и сын работают в Российской Федерации. Все члены семьи с радостью помогают по хозяйству, сама заемщица очень ответственная и трудолюбивая. Назгуль имеет средне-специальное образование и на протяжении 20 лет занимается сельским хозяйством. На сегодняшний день заемщица имеет в хозяйстве 4 дойные коровы и 10 овец, что приносит ей ежемесячный доход в размере 20,000сомов (KGS). В Банк "Бай-Тушум" Назгуль обращается в первый раз, на полученные средства она планирует купить коров, это позволит ей расширить свой бизнес и улучшить условия проживания. Также в ближайшее время Назгуль хочет женить своего сына.
texts.en:
Nazgul is 43 years old, married and has five children. All the children are independent and live separately; two of the daughters and one son work in the Russian Federation. All members of the family help with the household with pleasure. The borrower herself is very responsible and hardworking.

Nazgul has vocational education and has worked with agriculture for a period of 20 years. Currently she has four dairy cows and ten sheep at her farm, which brings her a monthly income of 20,000 som (KGS). 

Nazgul turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for the first time. She plans to purchase cows for the loan received. This will allow her to expand her business and improve her living conditions. Nazgul would also like to marry her son away in the near future.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Lucas

texts.pt:
Tem 31 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, pai de 4 filhos menores e os que tem idade escolar tem acesso a escola, vive na casa própria, é agricultor com larga experiencia e sua maior fonte de renda e é primeira vez que toma crédito com a Hluvuku
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar sementes, pestecidas, adubos e ferilizantes para produzir batata Reno.
Seu maior sonho é poder adquirir uma viatura que facilite o escoamento dos seus produtos para o mercado.
Seu maior desafio é o risco que corre na sua actividade:  cheias e excesso de calor
texts.en:
Lucas is 31 years old, lives with his partner and is the father of 4 children. The ones who are old enough go to school and they all live in a house he owns. He's a farmer with vast experience which is where most of his income comes from and this is his first time requesting a loan from Hluvuku.

With this loan he'll be able to buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to produce Reno potatoes.

His biggest dream is to be able to buy a vehicle to facilitate getting his products to market.
His biggest challenge is the risk he runs with his farming: floods and excessive heat.

loans.use: buy seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to produce Reno potatoes.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.pt:
Tem 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente, mãe de 2 filhos menores e com acesso a escola, tem uma empregada que lhe ajuda nas suas actividades, cria frangos, para além da barraca que tem de venda de diversos produtos alimentares e conta com ajuda do esposo que é agricultor.Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar pinto, razão e vitaminas, para criação de frangos de engorde
Seu maior sonho é ampliar mais o seu negocio e ganhar o mercado.
Quanto aos desafios ela se considera pouco avançada, uma vez que já tem casa própria e já mobilada e pelo facto de contar ainda com ajuda do seu esposo.
texts.en:
Leonor is 28 years old, lives with her partner and is the mother of 2 minors who both go to school. She has a maid who helps her in her activities, raising chickens as well as the stall from which she sells various food products. She counts on her husband's help who is a farmer. With this loan she plans to buy chicks, rations and vitamins for the breeding and fattening of chickens.

Her biggest dream is to expand her business and win market share.
As for her challenges, she considers herself to be ahead of the game as she already owns her own furnished house and can count on her husband's help.

loans.use: buy chicks, rations and vitamins for the breeding and fattening of chickens

loans.name: Sifa

texts.pt:
SIF dde 32 anos de idade é natural de Namaacha, Província de maputo, mae de 3 filhos menores de idade, cuida também da sua sobrinha que com elea vive.
com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar produtos de primeira necessidade (farinha de milho e oleo de cozinha) para revenda.
O seu maior sonho é ampliar sua residencia e adquirir uma viatura.
O seu maior desafio é encontrar fundos para ampliar seu negocio e consequentimente aumentar a renda familiar
texts.en:
Sifa is 32 years old and is from Namaacha, Province of Maputo. She is the mother of 3 children who are all minors and also looks after her niece who lives with her.

With this loan she plans to buy essential products such as corn flour and kitchen oil for resale.

Her biggest dream is to expand her home and buy a vehicle.
Her biggest challenge is to find the funds to expand her business and consequently increase her family's income.

loans.use: buy essential products such as corn flour and kitchen oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more vegetable and garden seeds to expand her business.

loans.name: Iván De Jesús

texts.es:
Iván es un campesino trabajador y pujante de 52 años de edad, casado y padre de 3 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo y dedicación. 
Durante 15 años se ha dedicado a realizar las labores del campo, trabajando como empleado en diferentes cultivos, actualmente labora como administrador en un cultivo y, de manera independiente, tiene su propio cultivo de hortensias, las cuales sembró desde hace 7 meses en la finca de su esposa. Con el crédito que solicita comprará plántulas, abonos y otros insumos agrícolas para preparar sus cultivos para la próxima cosecha que se dará en aproximadamente 3 meses, la cual venderá a las diferentes floristerías del municipio donde reside y en el mercado local.
Iván manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es tener un cultivo muy productivo, que le garantice una estabilidad económica para brindar educación universitaria a sus hijos y disfrutar con su familia de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Iván is a vigorous and hard-working farmer of 52 years of age. He is married and the father of 3 children who he has brought up with effort and dedication. In the 15 years he has laboured in the fields he has worked as an employee on various farms. Today he works as an administrator on a farm and independently has his own flower crops which he has been growing for the past 7 months on his wife's land.

With the loan he has requested he will buy seedlings, fertilizer and other agricultural inputs for the next crop which will be in about 3 months. He will sell them to the various florists in the municipality where he lives and in the local market.

Iván says that his main goal is to have very productive crops which would guarantee a stable financial situation so he can provide University education for his children and enjoy a higher standard of living with his family.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, fertilizer and other agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Sebastián

texts.es:
Sebastián es un joven campesino con un espíritu de superación que lo lleva a buscar alternativas para salir adelante. A sus 19 años de edad, trabaja como operario en un cultivo de flores, pero, con el ánimo de complementar sus ingresos y ocupar todo el tiempo que le queda libre, desea alternar su empleo con una actividad independiente, pues quiere comprar ganado de levante y ponerlo a producir, los animales estarán ubicados en la finca de un conocido que no le cobrará arriendo, es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar terneras de levante y así dar inicio a su nuevo proyecto productivo, aprovechando todos los conocimientos que obtuvo de su padre y ponerlo en práctica para generar ingresos.
Sebastián, con su tenacidad y empuje, sueña con tener una actividad económicamente estable, que le permita tener la posibilidad de costearse una carrera universitaria para sí tener mejores oportunidades laborales y ser un profesional íntegro, que vela por el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Sebastián is a young man living in the country with the desire to overcome obstacles, which leads him to seek alternatives to get ahead. At 19 years old, he works as an operator at a flower farm, but in order to supplement his earnings and occupy all of his free time he wants to alternate his job with an independent business. He wants to buy cattle to raise and put the cattle into production. The animals will be located on the farm of someone he knows who will not charge him rent. This is why is asking for the support of the loan, to buy calves to raise, thus starting his new productive project, taking advantage of all of the knowledge that he obtained from his father and putting it into practice to earn an income.

With his tenacity and drive, Sebastián dreams of having a financially stable business that will enable him to pay for a university education in order to have better work opportunities and be a full professional who provides for his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy cattle to raise and put the cattle into production

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes, opta por un nuevo crédito para surtir de manera inmediata su inventario para elaborar la comida, comprara chorizo, carnes, pescado, arroz, leña, especias, verduras, frijol, entre otros ingredientes, se mantendrá trabajando y obteniendo los ingresos que necesita.
Con la inversión anterior fortaleció el negocio teniendo así la oportunidad seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su familia y cancelando su deuda.
texts.en:
Mercedes is opting for a new loan to stock her inventory immediately so she can make food. She will buy chorizo sausage, meats, fish, rice, firewood, spices, vegetables and beans, among other ingredients. She will keep working and obtaining the income she needs.

She strengthened her business with the previous investment, thus having the opportunity to keep giving a good service to her customers, covering her family's basic needs and paying off her debt.

loans.use: to buy chorizo sausage, meats, fish, rice, firewood, spices, vegetables and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more coal and dried meat for her business,

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Meet 38-year-old Eliza from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with three children.  For the last five years, her children have been attending school. Eliza established her local food business because she wanted to generate income to take care of her family. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems within her operation area.

Eliza requires a loan to purchase more roasted meat to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Eliza plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more roasted meat to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and caustic for her business,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy palm oil in bulk (by the gallon).

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Sama from Waterloo in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with four children.  Three of her children are currently attending school. In 2007, she established her palm wine business. She began her business because she wanted to generate income to take care of her family. She works at the business seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems within her operations area.

Sama requires a loan to purchase more palm wine to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Sama plans to expand her business to t higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm wine to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil to sell

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Mariée à un employé à la zone franche, Akouvi âgée de 30ans est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle revend depuis 2007 des bijoux et friperies de façon ambulante. Le profit lui permettra d'avoir une boutique pour exposer ses produits et contribuer au bien - être de la famille. Elle a démarré en 2007.
texts.en:
Married to a duty-free employee, Akouvi is 30 years old and a mother of three; two of the children attend school.

To help her spouse with the family's expenses, she has been retailing second-hand clothes and jewelry door-to-door since 2007. With profit, she will be able to open a shop to display her wares, and to contribute to the family's well being. She launched her business in 2007.

loans.use: to buy jewelry and second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es:
Cornelio es un joven de 24 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, decidió casarse pero no pierde el deseo de seguir estudiando, su esposa se dedica a los trabajos domésticos y a cuidar de su pequeño hijo de un año de edad, Cornelio y su familia viven en la vivienda de su padre, pero las únicas personas que dependen del son su esposa y su hijo.

Cornelio se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías de arcillas, hamacas, lazos, matates etc. el trabajo ha venido de generación en generación en su familia, desde que estaba pequeño se dedica a esta actividad gracias a sus padres que le enseñaron a elaborar las artesanías. El producto que elabora lo distribuye  en el pueblo mas cercano donde tiene que cargar los bultos para  transportarlos en el bus, sale por la mañana a dejar los pedidos al pueblo.  Cornelio  también se dedica a la agricultura en la siembra de granos básicos (maíz y frijol).y también su esposa le ayuda en la elaboración de las artesanías.

El préstamo que él está lo necesita para la agricultura pues, ya se acerca el invierno y el desea preparar la tierra para poder sembrar su cultivos de maíz y frijol, lo invertirá específicamente en la mano de obra, para preparar la tierra, comprará la semilla y 3 sacos de abono para las plantas y otra parte lo utilizará para comprar más materiales (hilo) para elaborar sus productos, gracias al préstamo le permitirá cosechar los granos para darles el sustento alimenticio a su familia.

En el futuro Cornelio desea ampliar mas su producción de arcilla, poder comercializarlo en otros pueblos que todavía no ha podido vender y no pierde la esperanza de seguir estudiando junto con su esposa y también desea construir su propia casa digna para su esposa y su hijo, él desea seguir trabajando muy duro en esta actividad que le genera buenos ingresos económicos para su familia.
texts.en:
Cornelio is 24 years old who studied up to Grade 8. He decided to get married but he hasn't lost his desire to continue studying. His wife does domestic work and takes care of their one year old son. Cornelio and his family live in his father's house but the only people who depend on him are his wife and child.

Cornelio works making handicrafts of clay, hammocks, knots, grinding stones etc. This work has been passed down from generation to generation in his family. He has been doing this since he was young as his parents taught him how to make handicrafts. He sells his product in the closest town. He has to bundle the product up to take it on the bus. He leaves early in the morning to sell his goods. Cornelio is also a farmer who grows basic grains (corn and beans) and his wife helps him with his handicrafts.

The loan Cornelio is requesting is needed for his crops as winter is coming and he wants to prepare his land to plant corn and beans. Specifically he will pay for labor to prepare the soil buy seeds and 3 bags of fertilizer. And another part he will invest in materials (thread) to make his handicrafts. Thanks to this loan he will be able to harvest the grains that will feed his family.

In the future Cornelio wants to increase his production of pottery to be able to sell it in other towns where he has not sold. And he has not lost his hopes to continue his studies together with his wife. And he also wants to build their own house dignified for his wife and child. He wants to continue working hard in his business that generates good income for his family.

loans.use: to invest in preparing his land, pay for labor, buy seeds and fertilizer and buy thread for his handicraft products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice, and seasoning

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en: Juanita is 29 years old and married with two children. She earns a living through a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Juanita has been fattening pigs for 5 years, and also earns additional income from direct-selling Avon and Natasha products. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Karen Mae

texts.en: Karen Mae is 28 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, as well as feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs. Karen Mae has been in pig fattening for 4 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, as well as feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rizalina

texts.en: Rizalina is 54 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store. Rizalina has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 43 years old, married and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, chips, etc.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from fish vending and rice retailing. She aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, chips, etc.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 65 years old, widowed and has one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elvira has a dried fish business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Elvira has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a "dresses for rent" business in the Philippines.

Erlinda has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dresses for her business. She has been in this business for 45 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional dresses for her business.

loans.name: Ana Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Ana, a parte de la venta de pupusas ha instalado una tienda en la que ofrece productos de primera necesidad, de esta manara ofrece un mejor servicio a sus clientes, por lo que requiere de más capital de trabajo para comprar aceite, arroz, sal, chicharrón, quesillo, boquitas, jugos, gaseosas, aderezos, gas propano, entre otros materiales para fortalecer el negocio.
Para Ana el financiamiento anterior que se le facilito a través Kiva le ha permitido tener la materia prima para mantenerse trabajando y mejorar su economía, su familia se encuentra muy bien.
texts.en:
Ana, in addition to the sale of pupusas, has set up a store where she offers staple products. In this way she offers a better service to her customers, so that she requires more working capital in order to purchase oil, rice, salt, crackling, "quesillo" (a type of soft cheese), snacks, juices, soft drinks, seasonings and propane gas among other materials in order to strengthen her business.
