For Ana, the previous financing that she was provided through Kiva has permitted her to have the raw materials in order to support herself working and to improve her economic standing. Her family is doing very well.

loans.use: to purchase oil, rice, salt, crackling, "quesillo" (soft cheese), snacks, juices, soft drinks, seasonings, propane gas and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fuel and phone cards for her business

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es:
Nelson tiene 40 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado y ahora está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a la elaboración de pan, tiene cuatro hijos que asisten a la escuela y son los únicos que dependen de él.

Nelson es agricultor y también se dedica a la venta de sorbetes en la ciudad, la agricultura la aprendió de su padre y a la venta de sorbetes lo aprendió por un amigo que le ofreció trabajo, y ahora le va muy bien a Nelson realizando esta actividad, el lugar donde cultiva está a una distancia de 5 minutos caminando desde su casa, y el lugar donde realiza está a 30 minutos en autobús, el trabajo agrícola lo hace de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD y cuando sale a vender sorbetes lo hace de 2:00 AM a 5:00 PM.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo utilizará para la preparación de la tierra para la siembra de maíz, cancelará la cuota por arrendamiento de la tierra y comprará los insumos agrícolas, con la ayuda del crédito él podrá cubrir estas necesidades.

Su plan es seguir trabajando para mejorar su vivienda, este es su mayor sueño junto con su esposa, el préstamo les ayudará para mejorar su producción de maíz y luego venderlo y poco a poco ahorrar para mejorar su casa todo esto lo lograran trabajando juntos por un solo objetivo.
texts.en:
Nelson is 40 years old, he studied until the second grade, and now he is married. His wife works as a housekeeper and bread maker. He has four children who attend school and are his only dependents. 

Nelson is a farmer and he also works in town selling sorbets. He learned farming from his father and he learned sorbet selling from a friend who offered him a job. Currently this work is going very well for Nelson. The place where he farms is at a 5 minute walking distance from his home, and the other place where he works takes a 30 minute bus ride. He does his farm work from 6:00 a.m. until noon, and when he leaves to sell sorbets he works from 2:00 p.m. until 5:00 p.m. 

The loan that he is requesting from CrediCampo will be used for preparation of the land to plant corn, to pay the rent for the land, and to buy farming supplies. With the help of the loan he can cover these necessities. 

Nelson's plan is to continue working so he can improve his home. This is his biggest dream, together with his wife. The loan will help them to improve corn production and later sell it, and to save little by little to improve their home. They will achieve all of this, working together for one common goal.

loans.use: to prepare the land where he will grow corn, to pay the rent on the land, and to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: On Group

texts.en:
On is 28 years old. She is a married woman with one child, living in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a vegetable, fish and meat vendor and her husband is a policeman. 

On is a leader of this borrower group. She is requesting a loan to purchase the ground parts of a latrine. This loan helps her family live in good conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can expand her business and her child can get bachelor’s degree.

loans.use: to purchase the ground parts of latrine.

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, eggs, noodles, sugar, etc. for her general store business.

Gleceria has been in this business for 8 years. She earns additional income from food vending and rice retailing. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now request a new loan to further build her business.

Gleceria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Amarila

texts.en:
Amarila is 42 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, chips, sugar, coffee, etc.

Amarila has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from farming rice. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, eggs, chips, sugar, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell lumber business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional lumber to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for 36 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional lumber to sell.

loans.name: Segundino

texts.en:
Segundino is 64 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Segundino is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Segundino has been raising livestock for 12 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 38 years old and married with two children who are in school. Emma works very hard to provide for her children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like candies, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

Emma has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like candies, noodles, coffee, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oil, salt, sugar, pepper, and others items, for her business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 50 years old and widowed with two children. She works very hard to provide for her children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase eggs, soap, spices, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc to sell.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Erlinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase eggs, soap, spices, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Khosbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Khosbayar, 41 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling and installing electric heaters for a living since 2006. His business is environmentally friendly, so the government supports his efforts and imposes a low level of taxation. 

Mr. Khosbayar is requesting a loan of 2250 USD to import extra heaters from Korea in order to continue to sell his goods without worrying about shortage. This kind of heater has ample demand and it is installed under floors, heating the home from the bottom.

loans.use: to import low pressure heaters.

loans.name: Somaly Group

texts.en:
Somaly is 49 years old. She is a married woman with four children living in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer, her husband is a construction laborer and all of her children are employed. 

Somaly is a leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in improved conditions. In the future, Somaly hopes that she will open a grocery retail shop and renovate her house.

loans.use: to buy the ground parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Suubileg

texts.en:
Mr. Suubileg, 31 years old, lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been providing taxi services since 2006. His elder daughter goes to high school and his younger daughter has an illness related to the brain. 

Mr Suubileg is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to start a new business. He will rent a stall at the trade center and import clothes from China. His wife wants to work as a saleswoman for his business. His wife has long stayed at home, unemployed. The new business will not only increase the family income, but also provide his wife with the job she has wanted.

loans.use: to start a clothing sales business.

loans.name: Rosa Marta

texts.es:
Al pensar en queso, crema, tortilla y cebolla, nuestro apetito se abre y  se nos antoja un delicioso quesillo. Doña  Rosa Martha es experta en la  elaboración de este producto, desde hace ocho años lo comercializa por algunos sectores de la ciudad de Granada.   Con la ayuda de vendedores ambulantes su negocio  y ganancias  han incrementado. 
Su primer préstamo lo utilizó  para la compra de productos lácteos al por mayor, de esta forma logró expandirse, contratando personal, además de la atención que brinda en su residencia donde inició con este proyecto.  Solicita el crédito para comprar: Crema, Quesillo y Tortillas. Las utilidades le servirán para mantenerse al día en sus pagos, también desea mejorar la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco, sin embargo su meta principal es seguir trabajando con KIVA y  llegar a todo los rincones de  la ciudad de Granada.
texts.en: When thinking of cheese, cream, tortillas, and onions, our appetite is ignited and we crave a delicious quesillo. Rosa Marta is an expert at making this dish. Eight years ago she started selling them in different parts of the city of Granada. With the help of walking vendors, her business and earnings have increased. Her first loan was used to buy dairy products wholesale, and this way she managed to expand, hire employees, and earn the attention of her hometown where she began this project. She requests the loan to buy: cream, cheese, and tortillas. The profits will help her to stay current with her payments. She also wants to improve the infrastructure of her home little by little, however, her main goal is to continue working with Kiva and to reach every corner of the city of Granada.

loans.use: to buy cream, cheese, and tortillas.

loans.name: Mauricio Antonio

texts.es:
Mauricio de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo 3 estudian educación básica y el otro tiene 5 años por lo cual aún no asiste a la escuela.          

Mauricio es agricultor, él siembra maíz, maicillo y sandia, ya cuenta con cinco años realizando la siembra, el lugar donde cultiva le queda a una distancia de 20 minutos de su casa, él trabaja de 6:00 AM  a 12:00 del mediodía y uno de sus hijos le ayuda en el trabajo antes de irse a la escuela.

El dinero del préstamo lo utilizará para preparar el terreno y pagar el alquiler donde cultivará, además comprará la semilla y fertilizantes (abono, gramoxone, etc) para obtener una buena producción, la temporada es muy buena y le permite obtener muy buenos ingresos durante la venta de sandía.

Sus propósitos son trabajar más y brindarle mejor estabilidad a su familia, cancelar las tierras donde trabaja para que sean propias y así reducir los gastos de alquiler y poder cultivar más, todo esto espera lograrlo con mucho esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Mauricio is 37 years old, studied until the third grade in school, and lives with his wife who takes care of the household chores. He has four children of which three are studying basic education and the other is only 5 years old and does not attend school.

Mauricio is a farmer. He grows corn, millet and watermelon. He has been planting for five years.  The field where he farms is a distance of 20 minutes from his home. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 12:00 noon and one of his children helps him at work before going to school.

The loan will be used to prepare the soil and to pay rent where he farms, also to buy seed and fertilizers (manure, herbicide, etc.) to get good production. The season is very good and allows him to get a good income by selling watermelon.

His goals are to work more and provide better stability for his family, to stop farming where he currently works and have his own land, reduce rental costs and to grow more.  All this he hopes to accomplish with much effort and hard work.

loans.use: to prepare the soil and pay the rent where he farms, also buy seed and fertilizers (manure, herbicide, etc.) to obtain good production.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en:
Manny is 37 years old, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years. Manny requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stock of clothes to sell.

In the future, Manny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rubelyn

texts.en:
Rubelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. 

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.  In the future, Rubelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Neang Group

texts.en:
Neang is 32 years old. She is a married woman who has two children at Pursat Province, Cambodia. To earn a living, she and her husband sell second hand clothes. 

Neang is a leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan will help her family live in good conditions. In the future, Neang hopes that she can expand her business, build a kitchen, and support her children in their studies until they get jobs.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine

loans.name: Khishigsuren

texts.en:
Mrs Khishigsuren, 41 years old, lives with her husband and twin daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been offering a taxi service for four years. Her husband has the profession of producing explosives used in mining sites. Their daughters go to high school. 

Last year she used her loan for completing her house but due to a sudden increase in construction material prices, the house was left unfinished. So, she is requesting a loan of 2,400,000 MNT to buy shingles and paint to complete her house. After that, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and less pollutants released.

loans.use: to buy shingles and paint to complete her house.

loans.name: Ma. Lilibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Lilibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Ma. Lilibeth is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc., for her food production business.

Ma. Lilibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc., for her food production business.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marites is 38 years old and has two children who are in school.

Marites has a native bag making business in the Philippines. Marites requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Marites has been in this business for 10 years. Marites would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 37 years old and single and she works very hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, candies, soap, etc., to sell .

Vilma has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like canned goods, candies, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Gengen

texts.en:
Gengen is 28 years old and married with one child. Gengen has been raising livestock for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gengen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock. Gengen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins, feed and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Angeline

texts.en:
Angeline is 38 years old and married with two children. Her two children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a buy-and-sell live shrimp business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years. 

Angeline has requested a 30,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more live shrimp to sell. In the future, Angeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more live shrimp to sell.

loans.name: Norjeda

texts.en:
Norjeda works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a barber shop business in the Philippines. Norjeda has been in this business for 15 years now.

She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials and tools for her business.  In the future, Norjeda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es:
Carlos de 36 años de edad, estudió hasta cuarto grado, está soltero y vive con sus padres que dependen de él.

 Carlos es agricultor, desde pequeño se dedica a trabajar en la tierra y lo aprendió de su padre, de igual manera hace cinco años está trabajando en la siembra de sandía además tiene un camión donde hace viajes y es otra fuente de ingresos, su padre le ayuda en la siembra, y para llegar al lugar hace un recorrido de 10 minutos a pie.

El préstamo lo utilizará para pagarle a los trabajadores que le ayudaron a preparar la tierra, para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para lograr una buena producción.

Dentro de sus planes a futuro es diversificar su producción y sembrar hortalizas es una idea de negocio que siempre ha tenido y él cree que es viable, todo esto lo puede lograr poniendo esmero y esfuerzo a su trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos, who is 36 years old, went to school through fourth grade. He is single and lives with his parents, who depend on him.

Carlos is a farmer. He has worked on the land since he was young, and he learned this work from his father. In the same way, he has been planting watermelons for five years. In addition, he has a truck which he uses to make trips and is another source of income. His father helps him with planting. To arrive at his fields takes 10 minutes on foot.

He will use the loan to pay the workers who helped him prepare the land and to buy seeds and fertilizers to achieve a good production.

Among his future plans are diversifying his production and planting vegetables, which is an idea that he has always had and believes is viable. He can achieve all this by putting care and effort into his work.

loans.use: to pay for labor that he will use for planting and to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of three grown children from Canogan province of Isabela. She has been engaged in a hog raising business for more than 10 years. 

Rebecca is asking for a loan to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise. With this, she will be able to improve the productivity of her hog raising business, thus augmenting her sales and income. 

She dreams of expanding her business so that it will generate more revenue necessary for the family's needs, such as food and paying the bills.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Tufa

texts.en: Tufa is a 63-year-old married woman with eight children. She has a plantation and a small garden where she grows taro, bananas, and yams and vegetables such as cabbages, pumpkins, cucumbers, and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Tufa needs a loan to buy a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds for her business. She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial assistance. Tufa will use the profits from her sales to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a mist blower, chemicals, fertilizers, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Giljoy

texts.en:
Giljoy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Giljoy has been in this business for two years now.

She has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Giljoy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Redalyn

texts.en:
Redalyn is 21 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Redalyn has restarted her  business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor.

Redalyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nerlita

texts.en:
Nerlita is 36 years old and married with three children.  She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Nerlita is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in the pig fattening business for three years and also earns additional income from selling sea-shells. Nerlita is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Litia

texts.en: Litia is a 31-year-old married woman with four children. She would like to expand her small elei fabric printing business, selling designed lavalava sarongs in her community and to the public. In order to do this, Litia needs a loan to buy fabric materials and fabric paints and brushes. She hopes to use her profits to save for her family's weekly essential needs. She has just joined the SPBD program in order to gain access to financial assistance and hopes to improve on her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and fabric paints and brushes.

loans.name: Anakereti

texts.en: Anakereti is a 22-year-old single lady with no children. She runs a small business selling snacks and finger foods, etc., in her community and has been doing this for three years. Anakereti has requested a loan to purchase a kerosene oven, boxes of chicken leg quarters, rice, flour, sugar, soya, tomato sauce, and mutton flaps, to help her increase the quality of her business. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Anakereti will help her family meet their essential needs.

loans.use: to purchase a kerosene oven, boxes of chicken leg quarters, rice, flour, sugar, soya, tomato sauce, and mutton flaps.

loans.name: Zenaida Eva

texts.en:
Zenaida Eva is 49 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Zenaida Eva is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 8,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Zenaida Eva can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Dina

texts.es:
Dina tiene 26 años de edad,estudió hasta segundo grado, actualmente está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la venta de pizza, solo tiene un hijo que aún no asiste a la escuela porque está pequeño, por lo tanto el hogar solo lo conforman ellos tres.

Dina se dedica a la venta de verduras, ya tiene un años en este negocio que aprendió por la necesidad de tener mas ingresos para su familia, Dina sale a vender verduras en la colonia y lugares cercanos, lo hace de casa en casa, ella sale a vender desde las 8 de la mañana y regresa a casa hasta que termina de vender la mayoría de la mercadería.

El préstamo lo utilizará para comprar más verduras debido a que sus clientes hoy compran más y por lo tanto la demanda es más grande, esto le permitirá obtener más ganancias para los gastos del hogar.

Ella sueña con tener un negocio que le genere mejores ingresos, trabajar más para mejorar su vida y la de su familia y brindarle un buen futuro a su hijo.
texts.en:
Dina is 26 years old, she studied until the second grade, and is currently in a relationship. Her partner works selling pizza. She only has one son who does not even attend school yet because he is still young, so the household is made up of the three of them. 

Dina works selling vegetables. For one year she has had this business, which she learned out of the necessity to have more income for her family. Dina goes out to sell her vegetables in La Colonia and places nearby. She does this from door to door, leaving to sell at 8:00 in the morning and returning home when she has sold the majority of her products. 

The loan will be used to buy more vegetables since her customers are buying more these days, so the demand is higher. This will let her earn more money for the household expenses. 

She dreams of having a business that will generate better income, of working more to improve her life and the lives of her family, and of offering a good future to her son.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover higher education costs

loans.name: Lelibeth

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lelibeth works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Lelibeth is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Lelibeth has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: María Francisca

texts.es:
María de 53 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene dos hijos mayores de edad.

María se dedica a la venta de tortillas, tiene 3 años en esta labor y hasta el momento le va muy bien, su horario de venta es de 10:00 AM a 1:00 PM, y lo realiza en su lugar de residencia.

Ella solicita este préstamo para mejorar el techo de su humilde vivienda que se encuentra muy deteriorada, comprará madera, clavos, y algunas tejas que le harán falta, esto le permitirá tener su casa más segura antes que llegue el invierno.              

Sus planes compartidos con su esposo son mejorar poco a poco su vivienda hasta tenerla muy segura, ellos saben que con la venta  de tortillas y el trabajo en la agricultura van a lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and never had the opportunity to attend school.  She lives with her husband and dedicates herself to domestic tasks.  She has two grown children. 

María works selling tortillas.  She has been working in this field for three years and right now it is going very well.  Her schedule for sales is from 10am to 1pm and she makes her tortillas in her home. 

She is asking for a loan in order to improve the roof of her humble abode which has become very deteriorated.  She will purchase wood, nails, and some tiles that she lacks.  This will allow her to make her house more safe before the winter arrives. 

Her plans, shared with her husband, are to improve their home little by little in order to make it more secure.  She knows that with they sale of tortillas and through agricultural work they will be able to meet their goals.

loans.use: to improve the roof of her humble abode which has become very deteriorated, she will purchase wood, nails, and some tiles that she lacks.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un joven campesino de 20 años de edad, que se dedica a trabajar de forma independiente, produciendo y comercializando queso campesino, el oficio lo aprendió de manera empírica con el fin de generar recursos para aportar a la economía de su hogar. Trabaja en compañía de dos familiares, y su horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 2 a 6 pm.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de utensilios de cocina y moldes para los quesos, esto le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y aumentar su producción, con lo que podrá satisfacer la demanda actual de sus productos y mejorar los ingresos.
Guillermo, con su espíritu de superación y el entusiasmo con el que realiza su labor, desea seguir luchando para sacar adelante su negocio, lograr que sea reconocido en todo el municipio y en un futuro cercano, tener un local propio para mejorar la higiene y la calidad de su producto, logrando obtener una rentabilidad estable que le brinde la oportunidad de disfrutar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a 20-year-old young man living in the country who makes a living by working in an independent fashion, producing and selling farmer's cheese. He gained experience in this work in order to generate resources to contribute to his household budget. He works in a company of two family members and his work hours are Monday to Sunday from 2 to 6 pm.

The loan he is requesting will be invested in buying cooking utensils and molds for cheeses. This will allow him to improve his working conditions and to increase his production, and he will thus be able to satisfy the current demand for his products and to improve his earnings.

With his desire to overcome obstacles and the enthusiasm with which he does his work, Guillermo wants to keep striving to get his business ahead, to be known throughout the entire municipality in the near future, to have a place of his own to improve the hygiene and the quality of his product, and to be able to obtain a stable profit that will provide him with the opportunity to enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and molds for cheeses

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 33 years old, with six children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Her house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her pig-raising business and is committed to regain what she lost. Susana  is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Susana  has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Susana  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Sandy Shirley

texts.es:
Sandy es una mujer creativa y trabajadora de 30 años de edad, que desde hace un año se dedica a trabajar en el campo de la confección de línea propia, el oficio lo aprendió de su madre. Trabaja todos los días elaborando blusas que luego decora a mano con imágenes llamativas que descarga de internet y luego las vende entre familiares, amigos y vecinos del sector.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de telas, pintura textil, aerógrafo, hilos y herramientas de trabajo, lo que le permitirá tener mayor variedad de colores y texturas para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diversos gustos, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos.
Sandy sueña con tener su propio almacén en su casa, en el que pueda generar mayor rentabilidad y así disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sandy is a creative and hardworking woman who is 30 years old. One year ago she began working in the field of sewing her own clothing line. She learned the skill from her mother. She works every day making blouses that she then decorates by hand with decorative images downloaded from the internet, and later she sells them to friends, family, and neighbors in the area. 

The loan that Sandy requests will be invested in purchasing fabrics, textile paint, an airbrush, cords, and work tools, which will give her a better variety of colors and textures to offer her customers and satisfy their diverse tastes, improving sales and profits. Sandy dreams of having her own store in her home, where she could earn more income and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric, textile paint, an airbrush, cords, and work tools.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a broom-making business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her broom-making business.

She has been in this business for nine years. Marina earns more income from raising pigs. Marina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her broom-making business

loans.name: Wily

texts.en:
Wily is a 42-year-old father who is currently residing in a rural community. He aims to improve his corn-farming business to increase his income and continue sending his three children to college. The main source of their living is farming. 

He planned to expand his plantation but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000.00 to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to pay the expenses incurred in planting corn. Through hard work and strong determination, Wily believes that he will improve his farming business as well as their status of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicides and to pay the expenses incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a 62-year-old married woman. She is a mother of five kids. Teresita's husband has no job due to the bad economic situation there. She opened a small grocery store four years ago so she can provide her family with all their needs. 

Teresita took a loan from ASKI. This loan will help her to buy more products to sell in her grocery store. By taking this loan, she will be able to improve her business and increase income.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil, rice, candies, noddles and beverages.

loans.name: Marco Tulio

texts.es:
Marco  de 38 años de edad, estudió hasta segundo grado de educación básica por tener que trabajar a corta edad,  vive con su compañera de vida y tres hijos. Su señora se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  sus hijos estudian en el centro escolar de la comunidad.


 Marco es propietario de un apero de pesca con el cual hace viajes al mar en horas de la noche,  para capturar pescado y comercializarlo en la zona. Decidió dedicarse al negocio de la pesca por ser rentable y conocer del mismo. 


 Marco está solicitando el crédito para la compra de redes de pesca (hilo). Con ello aumentara la cantidad de redes y la diversidad de mariscos para luego venderlos. Con nuevas redes su equipo aumentara en calidad y vida útil.


Los sueños de Marco son poder tener en óptimas condiciones su apero de pesca en vista que su medio de trabajo y subsistencia. Desea que sus hijos tengan la oportunidad de estudiar y poder tener mejores oportunidades en la vida
texts.en:
Marco is 38 years old and studied up to the second grade of elementary school because he had to work at a young age. He lives with his life partner and three children. His wife dedicates herself to domestic tasks and his children are studying at the school in his community. Marco is the owner or a fishing boat with which he makes trips to the ocean during the night to catch fish and sell them in the area. He decided to earn a living from the fishing business because it is profitable and because he knows how to do it. 

Marco is asking for the loan to buy fishing nets (thread). He will thus increase the number of nets and the diversity of the shellfish he catches to then sell. With new nets, his equipment will increase in quality and utility.

Marco's dreams are to be able to have his fishing boat in optimal condition, as it is his means of work and subsistence. He wants his children to have the opportunity to study and to be able to have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets (thread)

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 55 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school. Rosalina  works very hard to provide for them. Both her business and the family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Rosalina  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 5,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Rosalina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 36 years old and has three children who are in school.

Gemma's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Gemma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Mom Group

texts.en: Mom is 44 years old. She is a married woman who has seven children and lives at Pursat Province, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers. Mom is a leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan helps her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can breed pigs and support her children in their studies until they get jobs.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine.

loans.name: El Recreo Group

texts.es: Es un grupo esforzado, la coordinadora es la señora Nereyda de 31 años de edad, acompañada y madre de cuatro hijos de la edades de 14, 11, 2 años y un bebé de 5 meses, quienes son su motivo para seguir esforzándose y salir adelante para proporcionarles a sus hijos lo necesario para su crecimiento, se dedica a la venta de variedad de especies y el crédito lo requiere para la compra de especies como es la manzanilla, clavo de olor, canela, punto azul, entre otro, lo comercializa en las principales calles de la capital para aumentar las ventas y así obtener mayores ingresos. Otra integrante es la señora Guillermina de 45 años, que vende variedad de especie y también a la compra-venta de zapatos de niños y adultos, también encontramos al socio Odell de 19 años quién labora en un taller de zapatería y la señora Sayra de 25 años dedicada a la compra-venta de frutas de temporada.
texts.en:
This is a dedicated group, coordinated by Señora Nereyda.  She is 31 years old, and she is in a relationship. She has 4 children, ages 14, 11, and 2 years, plus her 5-month-old baby.  They are the reason that she continues to strive and move forward--to give them what is needed for them to develop.  

She sells a variety of spices, and the loan that she is requesting is for the purchase of spices such as chamomile, cloves, cinnamon, punto azul [blue point], etc. She sells them on the main streets of the capital in order to increase her sales and thus obtain more income.  

Another member is Señora Guillermina, age 45, who sells a variety of spices, and also buys and sells shoes for children and adults.  The member Odell, age 19, works in a shoemaking shop; and Señora Sayra has worked buying and selling seasonal fruit for 25 years.

loans.use: to purchase spices such as chamomile, cloves, cinnamon, flax seed, punto azul [blue point], etc.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 54 years old and widowed with four children, one of whom is in school. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Erlinda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 9,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Erlinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Evelin

texts.en:
Evelin is 45 years old and married with three children. With one child still in school, Evelin works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items such as toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, coffee, chocolate drink, sugar, bread, etc. She has been in this business for 3 years.

Evelin requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, coffee, chocolate drink, sugar, bread, etc. to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items like toothpaste, canned goods, shampoo, coffee, chocolate drink, sugar, bread, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Marisela Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Marisela heredó el talento de sus padres para la elaboración de dulces de coco y azúcar, y es que desde pequeña aprendió las técnicas  necesarias, sin pensar  que en un  futuro iban servirle como una herramienta para subsistir.  Hoy en día Marisela se gana la vida vendiendo estos productos en los  pueblos de Dirià y Diriomo con el apoyo de su suegro. 
Su visión es poder expandirse a otros departamentos del país. Solicita el préstamo para comprar: Coco, Azúcar y Especies. El préstamo le permitirá comprar cantidades necesarias  de productos e ingredientes que utiliza para la preparación de  sus deliciosos dulces, asimismo, brindarle mejores  oportunidades a su familia y por supuesto, hacer más próspero su negocio con arduo esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Marisela inherited the talent of making candies from coconut and sugar from her parents. Since she was young, she learned the necessary techniques without thinking that it would serve her as a tool for survival in the future. Today, Marisela makes a living selling these products in the towns of Diriá and Diriomo with the support of her father-in-law. Her vision is to be able to expand to other sections of the country. 

She is applying for a loan to buy coconut, sugar, and spices. The loan will allow her to buy the necessary quantities of products and ingredients that she will use in preparing her delicious candies. Similarly, it will afford better opportunities for her family and of course, will make her business more successful with hard work.

loans.use: to buy coconut, sugar, and spices.

loans.name: Lilian Marleny

texts.es:
Lilian tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija de cuatro años de edad que actualmente cursa kinder, y en su casa viven cuatro personas.

Lilian es abogada, actualmente también se dedica  a  la piscicultura, ella cuenta con 5 años realizando esta interesante actividad, comenzó como una prueba y poco a poco ha ido creciendo y además su padre se involucra en este trabajo.


Este préstamo lo solicita, para construir mas peceras y para comprar alimentos para los peces que cultiva, de esta forma no se verá estancada en esta actividad y no faltarán los ingresos para su familia.

Lilian es una mujer de propósitos, pero los mas principales son mejorar su calidad de vida y ampliar mas el negocio para que a su familia no le falte nada.
texts.en:
Lilian is 37 years old, is married and has a four-year-old daughter who is currently in kindergarten. There are four people living in her house.

Lilian is a lawyer. Currently she is making a living from fish farming. She has been working in this interesting business for five years. It started as an experiment and little by little it has been growing. Her father is also involved in this work.

She is asking for this loan to build more fish ponds and to buy food for the fish she is cultivating. In this way she won't be stagnant in this business and her family will have enough income.

Lilian is a woman with many goals, but the primary ones are improving her quality of life and expanding the business further so that her family won't lack for anything.

loans.use: to build more fish ponds and to buy food for the fish.

loans.name: Kunthim Group

texts.en: Kunthim is 19 years old. She is a farmer in Pursat Province, Cambodia. She earns approximately $3 per day. Kunthim is the leader of this borrower group. She will use her portion of the group’s loan to buy the ground parts of a latrine. This loan helps her family live in better conditions. In the future, she hopes that she can build a kitchen for the family.

loans.use: To buy the ground parts of a latrine.

loans.name: Zeny

texts.en:
Zeny is 40 years old and blessed with three children. Despite being widowed, she has the determination to improve their status of living and give her children a better life. To generate income, she cultivates their farm land by planting corn for sale. 

She aims to improve her corn farming business to ensure production. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to request a loan amount of PHP 20,000.00 to buy certified corn seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides, and to pay the expenses incurred in planting corn. She is hoping that her loan request will be granted for her to be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy certified corn seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides, and to pay the expenses incurred in planting corn

loans.name: Jera

texts.en:
Jera is 35 years old and married with four children. With two children in school, Jera works very hard to provide for them. Her business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Jera has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Jera is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marichu

texts.en: Marichu works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gear and materials for her fishing business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional gear and materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is twenty-six years old and has four children, two of whom are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store business.

With your help, Genelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Adán Antonio

texts.es:
Adán es un joven emprendedor de 22 años de edad, por sus escasos recursos económicos solo estudió hasta quinto grado, está soltero pero tiene una hija de dos años que depende de él, actualmente él vive con sus padres. 

Adán se dedica a la Agricultura desde muy pequeño, esta labor la aprendió de su padre, también él trabaja como jornalero, su trabajo está a una distancia 20 minutos caminando, y trabaja en un horario de 6:00 AM a 12:00 del mediodía.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo lo utilizará para cancelar la cuota de arrendamiento por el terreno donde cultiva y el resto para comenzar la preparación de la tierra antes que llegue el invierno, el préstamo le ayudará a tener el capital necesario para trabajar.  

Dentro de sus planes a futuro está seguir cultivando y cada año ir mejorando y creciendo su producción y darle los estudios a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Adán is a young entrepreneur of 22 years of age. Due to limited economic resources, he only studied until the fifth grade. He is single but has a 2-year-old daughter who depends on him. He currently lives with his parents. Adán has worked in agriculture since he was small. He learned his work from his father. He also works as a day laborer. His job is located a 20 minute walk away and he works a schedule from 6:00 a.m. until 12:00 noon. 

He is applying for a loan with CrediCampo which he will use to pay the rental fees for the land where he farms and the rest will be used to begin land preparation before winter arrives. The loan will help him have the funds needed to work. 

His future plans include continuing to farm and each year improving and growing his production, and to give his young daughter an education.

loans.use: to pay rent for the land where he farms and to begin land preparation.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. Helen  is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Helen's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her  business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Helen is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

She has been with NWTF since 2013 in her efforts to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Eufracia

texts.en: Eufracia works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a business buying and selling lumber, nipa roofing and bamboo in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of lumber, nipa roofing and bamboo to sell. Eufracia has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 47 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Helen has been in pig fattening for 2 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en:
Kheun (pictured here) is 57 years old and lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. He has been married for almost 22 years and has three sons. One of his sons is married and lives outside the family home, one is a waiter, and another one stays at home.

Kheun and his wife are farmers. In addition, he is also a fisherman when he is not at the farm. Under his wooden house is an open air space, so he wants to build a concrete brick room. With the concrete brick room that he wants to build, Kheun can sleep or keep elements.

loans.use: to build a concrete brick room under his wooden house.

loans.name: Josa

texts.en: Josa is 31 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a business raising livestock in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vitamins and vaccines for her livestock. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. Josa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and vaccines for her livestock

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en: Lorena is 38 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like canned goods, candies, biscuits, soft-drinks, laundry soap, etc. to sell. Lorena has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this one. She has been running the general store for 10 years, and earns additional income from raising pigs. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ma. Jacquiline

texts.en: Ma. Jacquiline is single and has a business buying and selling used clothing in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell. Ma. Jacquiline has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Carlos, es soltero, vive solo, como un medio para salir adelante y apoyar a sus padres económicamente, aprendió por cuenta propia a reparar y administrar un taller de motos, lo realiza con la colaboración de sus ayudantes, inicia sus labores de  7:00 a.m. y finaliza a las 4:00 p.m.
Con el capital comprara cables para frenos, focos, bujías, cadenas entre otros materiales para realizar un buen trabajo y tener a sus clientes satisfechos, espera mejorar el servicio y tener un negocio más rentable.
Su aspiración es ampliar su negocio para mantenerse trabajando, apoyar a sus padres y seguir teniendo una fuente de empleos.
texts.en:
Carlos is single and he lives alone.  As a means of moving forward and supporting his parents financially, he learned, on his own, how to fix motorcycles and run a repair shop. He does this with the help of his assistants, starting his work at 7:00 a.m. and finishing at 4:00 p.m. 

With the capital, he will purchase brake cables, headlamps, spark plugs, and chains, along with other materials, in order to do good work and keep his customers satisfied; and he hopes to improve service and have a more profitable business.

His goal is to expand his business in order to keep working and supporting his parents, and continue having a source of employment

loans.use: to purchase brake cables, headlamps, spark plugs, chains, and similar items.

loans.name: Noutifafa 2 Group

texts.fr:
Présidente du groupe NTIFAFA2, restauratrice et ménagère, Adjo est une femme âgée de 38 ans vivant dans le quartier de Sanguéra, localité frontalière entre la ville Lomé et celle Kpalimé au Togo. Elle vit en couple avec ses 4 enfants. Depuis 2010 qu’elle a commencé son petit commerce de riz avec le soutient de son mari, Adjo a développé ses qualités d’accueil et son désir de satisfaction client, ainsi elle sollicite un prêt pour acheter 3 sacs de riz et 8 kilogrammes de poulets congelés dans le but de répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle entre 15h et 18h au lieu de 6h à 12 uniquement.
Le groupe est essentiellement composé de femmes commerçantes des produits de beauté, de la farine de blé, les habits de la friperie, des céréales et produits alimentaires, les ustensiles de cuisine et les protéines pour ne citer que ceux là. Elles sollicitent toutes un crédit pour renforcer leur activité. Certaines personnes dans le groupe n'ont pas pris du crédit mais figurent dans la photo.
texts.en: The leader of the group Ntifafa2, Adja cooks food for sale and takes her of her household. She is 38 years old and lives in the Sanguera neighborhood, located in the border area between the town of Lomé and the town of Kpalimé in Togo. She is in a relationship and has four children.  Since launching her business selling rice in 2010, with the support of her husband, Adjo has expanded her services and her efforts to meet customer demand. Thus she is seeking a loan to buy three bags of rice and eight kg [18 lbs] of frozen poultry in order to be able to serve her customers during the hours of 3 PM to 6 PM as well,  in addition to  her current opening hours of 6 AM to 12 PM. This group is composed of female entrepreneurs who sell beauty products, wheat flour, second-hand clothing, cereals, food products, kitchen utensils, and protein supplements, to list just some items. The group members are seeking a loan to strengthen their business. Some members of the group appearing in the photo are not taking out a loan.

loans.use: to buy three bags of rice and eight kg of frozen poultry.

loans.name: María Silvia

texts.es:
María vive junto a su esposo y sus 2 pequeños hijos, con la familia vive también la suegra de la de ella quien cuida a los nietos mientras los padres trabajan comercializando mariscos en zonas cercanas a su comunidad.

María tiene más de siete años de experiencia en el  negocio de la compra y venta de mariscos. Su esposo realiza la pesca en la zona costera, por vivir en una zona comercial decidió dedicarse a dicha actividad. 

  María solicita el crédito para invertirlo en su totalidad en la compra de una lancha, ya que solamente cuenta con un motor y la idea es tener dos equipos de pesca trabajando y aumentar sus ventas y sus ingresos.   

Los sueños de María y su esposo son tener equipos de pesca en óptimas condiciones, ya que de ellos dependen los ingresos familiares. También con los ingresos obtenidos quieren dar educación a sus hijos, que para su punto de vista es el mejor legado o herencia que pueden dejarles.
texts.en: María lives with her husband, their two young children and her mother-in-law. Her mother-in-law takes care of the children while their parents are at work selling seafood in areas close to their village. María has been buying and selling seafood for more than seven years. Her husband fishes along the coast, and as they live in a good commercial fishing area, he chose to do that for a living. María is requesting the loan to invest in purchase of a speedboat, as they only have one boat right now. The idea is to have two fishing boats so that they can increase their sales and their income. María and her husband's dream is to have fishing boats in top conditions as their family income depends on that. She wants to use the income they receive to give her children a good education because she believes that education is the best inheritance that they can give to them.

loans.use: to buy a speedboat for fishing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, and gravel to finish construction of his home.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús de 37 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador que desde hace mucho tiempo se ha dedicado a trabajar como albañil, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica; pero luego se retiró porque tenía que ayudarle a sus padres a trabajar la agricultura; luego se acompañó con una mujer muy trabajadora que realiza los oficios domésticos del hogar, junto a ella formo su familia con la que tiene una hija de 17 años y un hijo de 12 años de edad, quienes estudian a dos cuadras de distancia.

Jesús tiene 15 años de trabajar como albañil, anteriormente él trabajaba como ayudante, pero luego aprendió a realizar muy bien este trabajo y hoy  es del que obtiene sus ingresos, así también trabaja en la agricultura.

El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de un caballo, ya que por el momento están a un precio más bajo, y quiere aprovechar porque para el tiempo de cultivar suben precios, y tiene la necesidad de comprarlo para llevar el agua hasta donde trabaja, ya que le queda un poco lejos.
 
Jesús en un futuro quiere poder comprar ganado, para generar ingresos, ya que su trabajo no es permanente, así también espera poder dejarles a sus hijos un  patrimonio del que  puedan tener ingresos y que les ayude a mantener sus estudios.
texts.en: Jesus is 37 years old and is a very hard-working man. He has worked as a builder for a long time. He studied up to second grade of elementary school, but he had to stop going to school to help his parents on the farm. Later he met his partner who is a very hardworking woman and with whom he has a 17-year old daughter and a 12-year-old son. His wife works as a homemaker and his children attend a school that is located two blocks from their home. Jesus has worked as a builder for 15 years. Previously he worked as a builder's assistant, but he learned how to do the work well and this is how he makes a living. He also does agricultural work. He wants to use the loan to buy a horse because right now they are at a good price and he wants to take advantage of this offer because when growing season begins, the prices go up. He needs a horse to carry water to the place where he works, which is far away. In the future, Jesus want to buy cattle to generate income for his family, as he does not have a permanent contract at work. He also hopes to be able to leave his children an inheritance which they can make money from and which will help them to continue their educations.

loans.use: to buy a horse

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es:
Telas de distintas texturas y colores adornan la vivienda de Marlene Rivera. No se considera una modista profesional  pero si una excelente costurera, muy detallista,  ya que cada pieza que fabrica cuenta ese sello que tanto la caracteriza y la hace favorita entre sus clientes por su fino trabajo y creatividad. Todo esto lo ha logrado con mucho esfuerzo. 
Marlene solicitó un préstamo para comprar: Telas, Sipor e hilos. Con sus ganancias,  planea mejorar su calidad de vida y continuar trabajando con mayor entusiasmo.
texts.en:
Fabrics of different colors and textures adorn the home of Marlene Rivera. She is not considered a professional dressmaker, but she is an excellent seamstress. She is very detailed, and every piece that she makes carries this mark, which characterizes her and makes her a favorite among her clients for her fine work and creativity. She has achieved all of this with a lot of effort. 

Marlene requests a loan to buy: fabric, zippers, and thread. With her earnings, she plans to improve her quality of life and continue working with much enthusiasm.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers, and thread.

loans.name: Maria Delmy

texts.es:
María, opta por más capital para realizar la compra de aceita, detergentes, jabón, bebidas, dulces, arroz, frijol, para mejorar el inventario de la tienda, cumplir con las demandas de sus clientes y seguir teniendo los ingresos económicos que tanto necesita para salir adelante.
Gracias al crédito anterior su negocio a ofrece más variedad de productos, cuenta con la preferencia de sus clientes, con las nuevas ganancias ha podido salir adelante con sus compromisos económicos.
texts.en: María has decided to request a new loan to buy oil, detergent, soap, drinks, sweets, rice, beans etc. to add to the stock of her convenience store, meet customer demand and continue to receive the income that she needs so much to move forward. Thanks to her previous loan, her business now offers a wider variety of products, she has loyal customers and has been able to use the profits to meet all of her expenses.,

loans.use: to buy oil, detergents, soap, drinks, sweets, rice and beans

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, comenta que con el préstamo anterior ha podido fortalecer la tienda con productos que cubren las necesidades de sus clientes, ha cumplido con el pago de las cuotas en el tiempo establecido y brinda a su familia un estilo de vida más digno.
Solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en comprar aceite, arroz, pan, frijol, detergente, galletas, dulces y bebidas, para tener más variedad de productos a la disponibilidad de los clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro says that with his previous loan he was able to fortify his store with products to meet the needs of his customers.  He made all of his payments as scheduled, and he has provided his family with a more decent standard of living.

Pedro is requesting a new loan to invest in cooking oil, rice, bread, beans, detergent, cookies, sweets, and drinks, so that he can have a greater variety of products available for his customers.

loans.use: to buy products for his store

loans.name: Dalia Marisol

texts.es:
Dalia, se decidió por otro crédito para continuar elaborando la venta de pupusas y surtir la tienda, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de dos mesas con sillas, golosinas, bebidas, pan, harina, chicharrón, quesillo, aceite entre otros materiales para tener un mejor inventario en el negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a contar con la materia prima para mantenerse trabajando, ha mejorado un poco su economía lo que le permite apoyar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en: Dalia has decided to take another loan so that she can continue with her business selling pupusas [grilled, filled corn cakes] and stock up her store.  She will invest this loan in the purchases of 2 tables with chairs, snacks, drinks, bread, flour, pork rinds, cheese, cooking oil, and other products, so that she can have more inventory for her business.  Her previous loan helped her to have the raw materials on hand that she needed to keep working.  This has improved her finances a bit, which is enabling her to support her children in their education.

loans.use: to buy 2 tables with chairs, snacks, drinks, bread, flour, pork rinds, cheese, and cooking oil

loans.name: Yenny Azucena

texts.es:
Yenny, es una madre que lucha día a día para ganar el sustento diario para ella y su hija de 6 años, no tiene ayuda del extranjero, los únicos ingresos con los que cuenta son los que genera al realizar la venta de ropa oficio, que aprendió por cuenta propia, su jornada de trabajo es de 8:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., además  vende jugos naturales, por su experiencia no representa problemas.
Con el préstamo comprara blusas, ropa interior, camisas, faldas, pantalones, naranjas, bolsas, para mejorar la mercadería y ofertas a sus clientes, espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar las ventas y a tener mejores ganancias.
Su sueño fortalecer el negocio con productos novedosos para mejorar su economía y salir adelante con su hija.
texts.en:
Yenny is a mother who struggles day by day to earn the daily support for herself and her six-year-old daughter. She does not have help from elsewhere; the only income she counts on is what she earns selling clothing, which she learned on her own. Her work day is from 8:00 a.m. until 4:00 p.m. She also sells natural juices, and since she is experienced it does not present problems. 

With the loan she will buy blouses, undergarments, shirts, skirts, pants, bags, and oranges, to improve merchandise and offers for her customers. She hopes that this investment will help her to improve sales and make better profits. 

Her dream is to strengthen her business with fashionable products to improve her finances and prosper with her daughter.

loans.use: to buy blouses, undergarments, shirts, skirts, pants, bags, and oranges.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wigs for her business.

loans.name: Escolastica

texts.en:
Escolastica is fifty-seven years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Escolastica's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Escolastica has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Escolastica is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: José Manuel

texts.es:
José tiene 47 años de edad, es bachiller y está esta casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos en este matrimonio y de los cuales uno de ellos está estudiando, y los otros dos le ayudan a trabajar haciendo pantalones y camisas, solo su esposa y sus hijos dependen de él.

José es sastre desde hace 24 años, este oficio se lo enseñó un primo y le gustó el oficio, fue así que él decidió trabajar con su esposa en este oficio y poco a poco han ido obteniendo clientes, en el trabajo se involucran dos hijos y lo realizan de 7:00 AM a 5:00 PM pero cuando tienen demasiados encargos terminan de trabajar hasta las 8 de la noche.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para comprar hilos, zipper y tela para continuar con la elaboración de ropa, ya que él además de elaborar los uniformes de las escuelas hace pantalones particulares y así tiene esa otra fuente de ingreso ya que el trabajo es familiar, esto le ayudará mucho ya que con el dinero va comprar mas materiales que necesita.

Él sueña con que Dios le preste vida para poder seguir trabajando de sastre  y poder tener el sostén de la casa ya que este es un buen ingreo para su familia, y le gustaría que sus hijos puedan perfeccionarse en este trabajo para que les sirva en un futuro.
texts.en:
Jose, 47, is a high school graduate and is married.  His wife does the household chores.  Together they have 3 children.  One of his children attends school, while the other 2 help him in his work making pants and shirts.  Only his wife and his children depend on him.

Jose has been a tailor for 24 years.  He learned this trade from an uncle, and he enjoys this line of work.  This is why he decided to work with his wife in this occupation.  Gradually, he has been acquiring customers.  He involves two of his children in this work, which he does from 7am until 5pm.  However, when he has too many orders he works until 8pm.

Jose is requesting a loan because he needs to buy thread, zippers, and fabric to continue with his business making clothing.  In addition to making the uniforms for some schools, he makes custom pants.  This gives him an additional source of income, because the work is similar.  This loan will help him a lot, because with the funds he will buy the materials that he needs.

Jose dreams that God will continue to give him life so that he can continue his work as a tailor and thereby support his household, because this is a good income for his family.  He would like his children to improve their skills in this work, because this will serve them well in the future.

loans.use: to buy thread, zippers, and fabric

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 62 years old and married with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Elisa has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Elisa requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elisa has been in this business for nine years. Elisa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Sam Oeur

texts.en:
Sam Oeur (in photo) is 46 years old and lives in a village outside of Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1996 and has four children--three sons and one daughter.  Two of her children are married and the other two are garment factory workers.

Sam Oeur is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a mason. She is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her children who are garment factory workers for driving to work.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her children to drive to work.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is thirty-three years old, married, and has five children.  

Tessie and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. 

Tessie is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Tessie has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her business.

With your help, Tessie can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future she  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is 46 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonila's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Leonila  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Leonila has taken a  housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Leonila is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to expand her business and to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jose Benjamin

texts.es:
José, manifiesta que la inversión anterior le permitió aumentar un poco el área de siembra, tener una cosecha abundante y granos de calidad, pudo mejorar sus ventas, con las nuevas ganancias ofrece un estilo de vida mucho más favorable a su familia y cancelado puntualmente sus cuotas.
El capital que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas y semilla, para la próxima siembra, de esta manera preparara el terreno, eliminara la maleza y protegerá el cultivo de plagas.
texts.en: José states that the previous loan allowed him to increase his planting area a little and have an abundant harvest of quality grains. He was able to improve his sales. With the new earnings, he can offer a much more favorable lifestyle to his family and pay his bills punctually. He will invest the capital that he is soliciting now in the purchase of compost, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds for the next planting. In this way he will prepare his land, eliminate the weeds, and protect his crop from pests.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides, pesticides, and seeds

loans.name: Datun

texts.en:
Datun lives north of Bogor, a semi-urban area about two hours from Jakarta. He is married and lives with four persons in the family home.

Datun began working with Ruma two years ago because he was interested in the income from selling mobile airtime. He feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and servicing bill payments. For the last three months, he has had around $154 - $155 per day in sales on average (just mobile phone airtime credit sales). 

As the business continues, he hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: to process more mobile phone airtime credits and bill payment transactions on weekends.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Mercedes De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Desde pequeña Mercedes estuvo rodeada en el ambiente del comercio. Creció viendo a su madre en las afueras de los mercados en Granada, donde ofertaba una diversidad de productos con una clientela  fija. El destino, la llevó a emigrar al país vecino de Costa Rica, ahí se desempeñó como doméstica y  logró ahorrar poco a poco para volver a su natal Nicaragua y establecer su propio negocio. 
Solicita el crédito para comprar Camisas, Pantalones, Camisolines y Granos básicos. Esto le permitirá ganancias e invertirá en la construcción de su vivienda.  De igual modo,  su objetivo  es  adquirir un espacio en el Mercado de la ciudad de Granada en un futuro. Es posible que sus sueños se cumplan,  porque Mercedes es una eterna luchadora que nunca se da por vencida.
texts.en:
Since she was young, Mercedes was surrounded by a commercial environment. She grew up seeing her mother outside the markets of Granada, where she offered a variety of products to a regular clientele. Fate took her to emigrate to the neighboring country of Costa Rica. There she worked as a domestic worker and managed little by little to save to return to her native Nicaragua and establish her own business.

She is applying for the loan to purchase shirts, pants, lingerie, and basic grains. This will give her earnings, and she will invest in the construction of her house. In the same way, her goal is to acquire a space in the market of the city of Granada in the future.
