It is possible that her dreams will be accomplished, because Mercedes is a perpetual fighter who never gives up.

loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, lingerie, and basic grains

loans.name: Adrian Darío

texts.es:
Adrian es un hombre trabajador y pujante de 33 años de edad, padre de dos hijos de 5 y 9 años a los que ha sacado adelante con empeño y dedicación.
Actualmente se desempeña como conductor de transporte público, oficio que le genera bastante estrés, esto lo impulsó a buscar un hobby y aprendió a pintar cerámicas, las cuales su esposa le ayuda a vender para generar ingresos adicionales para solventar los gastos familiares.
El crédito que solicita será invertido en la compra de figuras en cerámica y pinturas, así podrá tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los gustos diversos, mejorando las ventas y los ingresos.
Adrian sueña con fortalecer y acreditar su negocio, para lograr reconocimiento y que éste sea rentable y auto sostenible, para que le permita mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y brindar una educación de calidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Adrian is a hardworking and robust man who is 33 years old. He is the father of two children of 5 and 9 years old whom he has provided for with determination and dedication. 

He is currently working as a driver of public transportation, a trade that generates a fair amount of stress for him. This motivated him to search for a hobby, so he learned how to paint ceramics. His wife helps him sell them to earn additional income to cover the family's expenses. 

The loan that he is requesting will be invested in the purchase of ceramic figures and paints so that he will have more variety to offer to his customers, satisfying their varying tastes and improving his sales and his income.

Adrian dreams of strengthening and validating his business in order to attain recognition. He wants his business to be profitable and self-sustaining, allowing him to improve his family's living conditions and to provide a quality education to his children.

loans.use: to buy ceramic figures and paints.

loans.name: Alfredo William

texts.es:
Alfredo es un hombre muy trabajador de 38 años de edad, su estudio académico es  bachillerato, el cual logró sacar en su mismo lugar de residencia, luego decidió formar su familia junto a una mujer muy trabajadora con la que tiene un niño de 6 años de edad, su esposa ejerce su trabajo en la unidad de salud. 

Alfredo ejerce su trabajo como promotor de salud, él viaja a los cantones, todos los días se levanta muy temprano, para irse a trabajar a las comunidades las cuales están a 9 kilómetros de su casa, ya tiene tres años de trabajar como promotor de salud, anteriormente su trabajo no era estable, pero con mucho esfuerzo encontró un trabajo que si lo es.

Alfredo utilizara el crédito para reparar su vehículo ya que es el medio de transporte que utiliza para irse a trabajar, también que las comunidades que visita son poco transitadas y peligrosas, pero por el momento Alfredo no cuenta con  el dinero, lo que le hace difícil reparar su auto y por ende esto afecta su trabajo.

Alfredo quiere en un futuro tener casa propia, lo que piensa conseguir con mucho esfuerzo, así también espera poder pagarle los estudios a su hijo para que se forme como un profesional y pueda tener mas oportunidades  de empleo.
texts.en:
Alfredo is a very hard-working man of 38. His level of education is through high school, which he managed to complete in the same place where he lives. Then he decided to form his family along with a very hard-working woman with whom he has a six-year-old son. His wife works in a health unit.

Alfredo works as a health promoter. He travels to the cantons. Every day he gets up very early to leave to work in the communities that are 9 kilometers from his house. He has already been working as a health promoter for three years. Before that, his work was not stable, but with much effort he found work that is.

Alfredo will use the loan to repair his vehicle, since it is the means of transportation that he uses to go to work, also because the communities that he visits are not much transited and are dangerous. But for the moment, Alfredo doesn't have the money, which makes it difficult for him to repair his car, and in the end, this affects his work.

In the future, Alfredo wants to have his own house, which he thinks he can obtain with much effort. He also hopes to be able to pay for the education of his son, so that he can be formed as a professional and can have more employment opportunities.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy supplies for her water pipe store.

loans.name: Xejuyupenses Group

texts.es:
Catarina (segunda de izquierda a derecha, de güipil multicolor en la fotografía) es una señora casada de 41 años de edad, vive junto a sus tres hijos de los cuales son dos hombres de 9 y 6 años de edad y una mujer de 3 años de edad, quienes viven en el Departamento de Suchitepequez. 
Doña Catarina  es una mujer trabajadora, ya que su mayor deseo es ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Ella comenta que actualmente se dedica a la compraventa de hilo y ropa típica de diferentes clases. Ella eligió esta actividad porque es bastante rentable y productiva, por lo que ahora cuenta con 7 años de experiencia en esta labor. A través de lo que realiza obtiene ingresos y ganancias aceptables, que le ayudan a cubrir los gastos de su familia. Como también comenta que se dedica a la venta de helados en su comunidad.
Ahora ella ha tomado la iniciativa de formar un grupo, con el objetivo de mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo, ya que en su comunidad hay personas con mucha creatividad en cuanto a los negocios. El préstamo lo utilizaran para la compra de hilos y ropa típica.
Ella es una mujer soñadora y uno de sus sueños es ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ganancias, ya que anhela mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y a su vez seguir dándoles estudios a sus hijos, para que se preparen y sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Catarina (second from the left and wearing a multicolored huipil blouse in the photo) is 41 years old and married.  She lives in the department of Suchitepequez with her three children, two, ages 9 and 6, and a girl, age 3.

Catarina's a hardworking woman because her biggest desire is to help her family get ahead.  She said that currently she works buying and selling thread and different types of traditional clothing.  She basically chose this job because it's profitable and productive, and now she has seven years of experience.  She earns an acceptable income and profits, which help her cover her family expenses.  She also said she earns a living selling ice cream in her community.

Now she has taken the initiative to form a group to improve their families' finances.  There are a lot of people in her community who are very creative with their businesses.  She'll use the loan to buy thread and traditional clothing.

Catarina's a dreamer, and one of her dreams is to expand her business to increase her profits.  She wants to improve her family's living conditions as well as give her children an education so they'll be prepared to become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy thread and traditional clothing

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak (in photo) lives in the area surrounding Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. He has three sons - one is a garment factory worker, another one works for a factory that produces salt and another one is still young. His wife is a garment factory worker.

Sopheak is a commute leader assistant. In addition, he is employed at an NGO. He wants to buy a motorbike to drive to work, but he does not have money. Hence he decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to drive to work.

loans.name: Anabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 44 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as biscuits, noodles and sardines to sell.

Anabelle has borrowed and repaid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Anabelle aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as biscuits, noodles and sardines to sell

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice grains to sell.

Dolores has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Dolores would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie, 42 years old, is married and has six children. For the past four years, she has operated a business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Kiva to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

Julie has previously borrowed seven times from ASKI to sustain her business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Jayna

texts.en:
Jayna is 43 years old, married, and has only one child. Due to financial hardship, she aims to improve her small retail store to help her husband in sustaining their daily necessities. 

She wants to acquire more stocks of grocery items to resell but she has insufficient capital. For this reason, she is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, snack foods, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell. 

Through this loan, she believes that she will be able to increase her product offerings and income.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of canned goods, noodles, laundry soaps, snacks, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Alma works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from food vending and a general store. Alma is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Alma has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Analin

texts.en:
Analin is 43 years old and married with eleven children, six of whom are in school, Analin works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as soap, sugar, shampoo and canned goods to sell.

Analin has been in this business for 9 years. In the future Analin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as soap, sugar, shampoo and canned goods to sell

loans.name: Shang Ti

texts.en:
Shang Ti is a weaver, and she also works setting up a loom. Her husband is a construction worker. She has two daughters - one has full-time employment and another one is in university.

Shang Ti asks for a loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business and she will also use a part of the loan to purchase a computer for her daughter who is in university. 

Shang Ti’s family lives on an Island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To buy weaving materials for her weaving business and a computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 59 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling ready-to-wear products in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks such as shorts, slippers and shirts to sell.

Azucena has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 3 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Azucena aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as shorts, slippers and shirts to sell

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as sugar, milk, coffee, noodles and soap to sell.

Catherine has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as sugar, milk, coffee, noodles and soap to sell

loans.name: Yanti

texts.en:
Yanti lives north of Bogor about two hours from Jakarta. Yanti manages a small shop selling mobile phone airtime credit.  Yanti is married and lives with four persons in the family home. 

Yanti joined Ruma one month ago because she found it interesting to sell mobile phone airtime credits.  With assistance and support from Ruma’s staff, Yanti sees improvements in her shop.  For the last month, she earned an average of $1  – 2 per day in mobile phone airtime credit sales.  She hopes to get a Kiva loan as working capital to process more transactions on the weekends.  Her goal for her business is to expand and have more new business in the future

loans.use: To process more mobile phone credit sales on the weekends

loans.name: Emelyn

texts.en:
Emelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Emelyn has been in this business for seven years. Emelyn earns more income from farming sugarcane.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Esther works hard to support her family.

She has a hollow blocks making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food and fish vending. Esther is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional cement, sand, and other materials needed for her hollow blocks making business.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past 24 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cement, sand, and other materials needed

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 48 years old and married with seven children, three of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks such as spices, eggs and biscuits to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 2 years. 

In the future Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks such as spices, eggs and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Dominga Claudina

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 38 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar ya que en su tiempo los padres no la mandaban a la escuela, ella está acompañada y su pareja trabaja en un molino niña, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales tres estudian, y solo sus hijos dependen de ella.

Dominga trabaja en la venta de pupusas por las tardes, pero también se dedica al trabajo en el molino junto con su esposo, ya tienen 19 años administrando el molino, este trabajo nació de la necesidad de obtener ingresos y porque en la zona no hay molinos cercanos por lo tanto tomaron a bien aprovechar, el trabajo lo realizan de 7:00 AM a 3:00 PM

El préstamo que ella ha solicitado a CrediCampo lo necesita para comprar un repuesto del motor de un molino que se le ha dañado, el molino que van a  reparar es para moler alimentos para animales, y una parte del crédito lo utilizará para las escrituras de unos lotes que un abogado le está elaborando. 

Dominga sueña con tener salud para poder seguir trabajando y ayudar a sus hijos, para que se preparen en el estudio y que puedan tener legalmente un terreno que con mucho sacrificio han comprado ya que los hijos van creciendo y necesitan un lugar propio para vivir.
texts.en:
Dominga is 38 years old. She did not have the opportunity to study, as in her time, her parents did not send her to school. She is in a relationship, and her partner works in a mill. She has 4 children, three of whom are studying. Her children are her only dependents. 

In the afternoons, Dominga sells pupusas (a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans), but she also works with her husband in the mill. They have been running the mill for 19 years now. They started this work because they needed income, and as there are no mills near the zone, they saw a good opportunity. They work from 7:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.

She has requested a loan from CrediCampo, which she needs in order to purchase a replacement part for the motor of a damaged mill that they use for grinding animal feed, and part of the loan will be used for deeds to a few parcels of land that an attorney is drawing up for them. 

Dominga dreams of being healthy enough to continue working and helping her children so that they prepare themselves with their studies; and of legally owning the land that they have made great sacrifices to purchase, as the children are growing up and need a place.

loans.use: to purchase a replacement part for the motor of a mill that has been damaged.

loans.name: Elsi Yamileth

texts.es:
Elsi de 37 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y su esposo es soldador de estructuras metálicas, tiene tres hijos, y Elsi vive en casa de su padre juntos con sus hijos.

Elsi se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, tiene diez años de dedicarse a esta labor, su esposo también se dedica a lo mismo y a las estructuras metálicas, el lugar donde cultivan está a una distancia de 25 minutos caminando y su horario de trabajo es de 6:00 AM a 12:00 MD.

El préstamo solicitado lo utilizará para cancelar la cuota de arrendamiento por el terreno que alquila para la siembra, para comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para obtener buena producción logrando así asegurar sus ingresos.

 Su sueño para un futuro es poder darle una buena educación a sus hijos para que salgan adelante y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elsi is 37 years old, studied up to the third grade, has a partner who is a welder of metallic structures, has three children, and lives at her father's house with her children. 

Elsi has worked in agriculture for ten years, her partner works in the same filed and also welding metallic structures. The area where they farm is located at 25 minutes of walking distance and her work schedule is from 6:00 a.m. until noon. 

The loan that she is requesting will be used to repay the rental fee of the plot of land that she rents for sowing, and to buy the fertilizers that she needs to obtain a good harvest, which will ensure her income. 

Her dream for the future is to be able to provide a good education to her children, so that they can get ahead in life and become professionals.

loans.use: to repay the rental fee of the plot of land that she rents for sowing, and to buy the necessary fertilizers.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan lives in a village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She has one son and five daughters. Four are married, one is a garment worker and another one works for a factory that produces pure drinking water. 

Phan sells porridge and sells Khmer noodles from home. Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok, are considered the national dish of Cambodia that can be served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumber.

Anyway, she wants to buy a motorbike for her daughter who is a garment factory worker to drive to work. Therefore, she decided to apply for a loan in order to make the purchases!

loans.use: to buy a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Joan has been in this business for six years now.

Joan has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, and spices

loans.name: Gleceria

texts.en:
Gleceria is 52 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a 17000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional nipa to sell.

Gleceria has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her business for 13 years, and she earns additional income from her general store.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional nipa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase products to stock up his store.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 39 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory of milk, coffee, sugar, chips, soft drinks, and other items to sell.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years, and earns additional income from food vending.

Gloria aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of milk, coffee, sugar, chips, soft drinks, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Djifina, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de savon et d’habillement. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente SOUNCOURA , 2 eme assise  de la droite vers la gauche est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, du sel et de la poudre de gombo à Beleko. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle composée de femmes.  Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Group Djefako is composed of married women who are on average 36 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of N’Djifina, Wacoro township, Dioïla prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They met through families, friends, and neighborhood relations.

They trade cereals, condiments, soap, and clothing. This is the fourth solidarity loan for the women of group Djefako. To meet huge demand from their clientele, they are turning to Soro Yiriwaso.

Customer Souncoura, the second woman sitting from the right to the left, currently retails condiments. She plans to purchase onion, salt, and okra powder from Beleko. She retails from home to a female clientele who pays cash. She is forecasting an average monthly profit of 10,000 XOF, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Porng

texts.en: Porng, age 24, lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has been married since 2009 and has two daughters; one attends school and another one is still too young. Porng is a construction contractor, while his wife is a garment factory worker. Porng wants to buy additional construction materials, which would help him in his work. Hence he has applied for a loan in order to make the purchases.

loans.use: To buy additional construction materials.

loans.name: Kolaban Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOLABAN est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Djifina, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de gâteau, de savon et la galette. Les femmes du groupe KOLABAN sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJOMINE, première assise à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de feuilles d’oignon sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et au marché du village, a une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group KOLABAN is composed of married women, who average 39 years of age and three children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of N’Djifina, in Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, cakes, soaps, and galettes. 

The women of the group KOLABAN are on their fourth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers. They turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise  as cited above. 

This client, DJOMINE, who is sitting first from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of condiments. She intends to purchase 2 sacks of chives locally from women in the village. The retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at the village market. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as chives

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase brick, cement, sand, and iron, in order to build a wall.

loans.name: 3.19.1012.5.tt Quán Lào Group

texts.en:
Cừ is 63 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Cừ operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. Cừ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Cừ is the group leader of the 3.19.1012.5.TT Quán Lào solidarity group, which consists of four members. This is Cừ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell.

With her business profit, Cừ hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en: Teresita is 42, married and blessed with three children. She and her husband aim to improve their rice farming business to increase their production and income to satisfy their needs and support the education of their children. To expand their rice plantation, Teresita is asking for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in planting rice. Through patience and hard work, they believe that they will increase their production and income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in planting rice

loans.name: Sam Oeun

texts.en:
Sam Oeun (pictured here) is 36 years old and lives about 10 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has been married since 1998 and has four children. Sam Oeun is a cleaner and her husband is a moto kangbei driver for a company. He wants to have his own moto kangbei to supplement his moto kangbei taxi driving business when he is not at work. This will enable him to earn extra income to better support his standard of living. Hence, Sam Oeun decided to apply for a loan to buy a moto kangbei for her husband!

In the past, they were commonly known as "tuk tuks" (a three-wheeled motorcycle taxi), but they are now officially called "moto kangbei" by government authorities.

loans.use: To buy a moto kangbei (motorcycle taxi) for her husband to drive

loans.name: 02.06.06 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Quỳnh is 61 years old and she is married with two children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She operates a business selling clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Quỳnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Quỳnh is the group leader of the 02.06.06 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of six members. This is her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quỳnh is applying for a loan to purchase clothes to resell.

With her business profit, Quỳnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to resell

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 39 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Josie works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Josie has been in this business for 10 years. 

Josie has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like biscuits, shampoo, soap, canned goods, and spices to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like biscuits, shampoo, soap, canned goods, and spices to sell

loans.name: Lory

texts.en:
Lory is 35 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for three years and also earns additional income buying and selling rice.

Lory is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlinda works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling ready to wear products. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, ground coconut, etc for her food vending business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, milk, sugar, ground coconut, etc

loans.name: Sulma Lisseth

texts.es:
Sulma de 34 años de edad, está acompañada y su esposo se dedica a la ganadería y a la comercialización de los productos que de ella se derivan.,tienen 2 hijas que se encuentran estudiando educación básica.

Sulma tiene varios años de dedicarse a la venta de leche y cuajada, también elabora pan dulce en un horno artesanal, el pan lo vende en su misma localidad ya que por ser muy conocida con sus vecinos no necesita trasladarse a otro lugar, y le va muy bien en su negocio por lo que seguirá adelante para que no le falte nada a su familia.

El préstamo solicitado lo necesita para construir una pequeña galera que a la vez le servirá como establo para resguardar a los animales (ganado bovino) y guardar también el alimento de su ganado.

Sus sueños son aumentar sel número de ganado, e incrementar la producción de lácteos, con las ganancias del negocio podrá cubrir los gastos de la familia y cualquier otra necesidad.
texts.en:
Sulma is 34 years old, has a partner who works raising livestock and selling livestock-related products, and has two daughters who are currently in primary school. 

Sulma has worked for several years in the sale of milk and curd. She also bakes sweet bread in an artisanal oven, which she sells in her town. She is well known by her neighbors and does not need to travel to other places to sell her bread. She does very well with her business, which is why she will go forward with it so that her family has everything it needs. 

She needs this loan to build a small shed that will also serve as a barn to keep the animals (cattle) and also to keep the food for her cattle. 

Her dreams are to increase the number of cattle, and to increase the production of dairy products. With the profits from the business, she will be able to cover the expenses of her family and any other need.

loans.use: to build a small shed which she will also use as a barn to keep her animals (cattle).

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years now.

Lorna has requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 57 years old and married with children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income buying and selling rice.

Ma. Elena has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, bread, and chips. She has borrowed and repaid 23 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, coffee, bread, and chips

loans.name: Ma. Marites

texts.en:
Ma. Marites is 39 and married, with two children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Ma. Marites has requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, and corn for her food production. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar, milk, and corn for her food production

loans.name: Amparo

texts.en:
Amparo is 62 years old, married and has nine children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Amparo requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Amparo has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to save money for the secure future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ana Rose

texts.en:
Ana Rose is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell.

Ana Rose has been in this business for five years. Ana Rose earns more income from her general store.

Ana Rose has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle works hard to support her family. Annabelle is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear (clothing) business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Annabelle has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Annabelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Meerkan

texts.ru: Мееркан, 39 лет, имеет большой опыт в сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Начав свое дело с 1 коровы, 1 лошади и 10 овец, за 19 лет Мееркан увеличила поголовье скота до 10 дойных коров, 10 лошадей и 150 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль заемщицы составляет 20,000 сомов (KGS). В зимний период Мееркан содержит скот в хозяйстве, а летом и весной выводит на джайлоо. Также заемщица занимается полеводством, выращивая пшеницу и ячмень. Образование Мееркан среднее, она замужем и имеет 5 детей, старшая дочь-замужем, остальные дети дошкольного и школьного возраста. Все члены семьи активно помогают по хозяйству, также нанимают пастуха, выплачивая ему 5,000сомов (KGS). В Банк "Бай-Тушум" заемщица обратилась впервые, на полученный кредит планирует купить корм для скота, что позволит расширить ее хозяйство.
texts.en: Meerkan is 39 years old. She has a long experience in agriculture. Having launched her business with one cow, one horse and 10 sheep, over the  period of 19 years Meerkan has increased her livestock headcount to 10 dairy cows, 10 horses and 150 sheep. This borrower's monthly revenue is 20,000 KGS. In the winter season, Meerkan keeps her livestock on the farm, and in the spring and summer she brings the animals out to pasture. She also grows produce: wheat and barley. Meerkan has received secondary education. She is married and has five children. Her eldest daughter is married; other children are of school and preschool age. All family members are actively helping on the farm. They also hire a shepherd at the salary of 5,000 KGS. This is the first time Meerkan has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance insitutitoin. She plans to use her loan to buy livestock feed, which will allow her to expand her farm.

loans.use: to buy feed for livestock.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.en:
Antonieta is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Antonieta is 38 years old and has three children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines. Antonieta requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Antonieta has been in this business for two years. In the future, Antonieta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena is 61-years-old, widowed and has five children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Azucena requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Azucena has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 22 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Azucena would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Flordelinda

texts.en:
Flordelinda is 34 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the store for three years and also earns an income from raising pigs.
 
Flordelinda has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, and soft drinks. She has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn works hard to support her family. Edelyn is married and has a business buying and selling rice grains in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Edelyn has been in this business for four years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en:
Edelyn is 49-years-old and has four children.  Edelyn is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Edelyn requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edelyn has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Edelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years now. She works hard to support her family. 

Melita has requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell. In the future, Melita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 64 years old and a widow with four children. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Erlinda has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 36 and married, with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. 

Estelita has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and fish. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, vegetables, and fish

loans.name: Kotognontala Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOTOGNONTALA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Djifina, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de patte d’arachide, de galette et de savon. Les femmes du groupe KOTOGNONTALA sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente DASSOUN , première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de patte d’arachide. Elle compte acheter 1 sac d’arachide non décortiqué sur place avec les femmes du village, elle le décortique puis le transforme en pâte d’arachide de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, ainsi qu’au marché du village, à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 9. 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour assurer la scolarité de ses enfants.
texts.en:
The group KOTOGNONTALA is composed of married women, who average 40 years of age and three children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of N’Djifina, in Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in condiments, peanut butter, galettes, and soap. 

The women of the group KOTOGNONTALA are on their fourth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers. They turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. 

This client, DASSOUN, who is sitting first from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of peanut butter. She intends to purchase a sack of unshelled peanuts locally from women in the village. She shells the peanuts and then processes them into quality peanut butter.

The retail sales are made to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home, as well as at the village market. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 9,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Segundo Abel

texts.es:
Segundo Abel tiene 43 años de edad, vive junto a su madre en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica al servicio de pintado de plantones, desde hace dos años, es un emprendedor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de material para pintar y de esta manera seguir brindando este servicio.
texts.en:
Segundo Abel is 43 years old and lives with his mother in the Morropon district, a community with a warm climate. The population is engaged in agriculture, raising livestock, and trade. It is located in the province of the same name which belongs to the Piura region in northern Peru.

He is an entrepreneur who began providing painting services two years ago. He has applied from a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles to purchase new equipment for painting to continue providing his service.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for his painting business.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. Flordeliza is a widow and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials like linen, threads, etc.

Flordeliza has been in this business for 38 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like linen, threads, etc.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 44 years old and married with ten children. With four children in school, Helen works very hard to provide for them. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal  in the Philippines. Helen has been in this business for 21 years.

Helen has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 35-years-old with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, cream, etc.

Leonora has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling beauty products.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like soap, milk, canned goods, cream, etc.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, spies, fish, etc. for her food vending business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, spices, fish, etc

loans.name: Paula Raquel

texts.es:
Paula es una mujer muy emprendedora de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado de educación básica, se ha dedicado a luchar por sus tres hijos los cuales son menores de edad ya que es madre soltera.

Paula se dedica a la venta de vitaminas y medicina desde hace 5 años, ella sale a los cantones mas cercanos , los cuales están a una distancia de 8 kilómetros. Esta actividad la realiza para poder cubrir los gastos del hogar y poder brindarles a sus hijos el apoyo ya que son menores de edad.

Paula utilizará el crédito para comprar medicamentos y ropa, para salir a vender a los cantones cercanos, por el momento paula necesita que le ayuden  económicamente, para que así pueda seguir con su negocio.

En un futuro paula desea poder tener una casa en buenas condiciones, y que en ella pueda tener su tienda de medicamentos, vitaminas y ropa. De igual forma espera dejarles a sus hijos un negocio del que puedan obtener ingresos para que cubran sus gastos..
texts.en:
Paula is a very entrepreneurial woman of 31 years of age. She studied up to the third grade of primary school, and has devoted herself to fighting for her three children, who are minors, as she is a single mother. 

Paula has worked selling vitamins and medicines for the last 5 years. She goes to the neighboring cantons, which are at a distance of 8 kilometers. Paula does this in order to cover her home expenses and to be able to provide support to her children, as they are minors. 

Paula will use the loan to buy medicines and clothes to sell in the neighboring cantons. At present, Paula needs financial support in order to be able to continue with her business. 

In the future, Paula would like to be able to own a house in good condition, where she could have her shop with medicines, vitamins and clothes. She also hopes to leave her children a business from which they could obtain income to cover their expenses.

loans.use: to buy medicines and clothes to sell in the neighboring cantons.

loans.name: Kounadia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe KOUNADIA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 24 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Djifina, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, d’ustensile en caoutchouc et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe KOUNADIA sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente CHITAN SOLO , première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’ustensile en plastique. Elle compte acheter 10 grosses bassines, 10 douzaine de bol à café et 10 pièces de seau chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante, a une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The group KOUNADIA is composed of married women, who average 24 years of age and three children each. The women all live in traditional families in the village of N’Djifina, in Commune de Wacoro, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. They do commerce in grains, condiments, rubber utensils, and cakes.

The women of the group KOUNADIA are on their fourth solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. The funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above.

This client, CHITAN SOLO, who is sitting first from the left, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of plastic utensils. She intends to purchase 10 big basins, 10 dozen coffee cups, and 10 buckets from wholesalers at the weekly market. At her home and sometimes by hawking, she makes her retail sales to a mixed customer base paying with cash. She envisions making an average monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase plastic utensils

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 54 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayalti, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un pequeño taller que se dedica a la labor de tejido y bordado desde hace un año, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de colores de hilos para realizar sus trabajos y de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 54 years old and she lives with her husband and children in the district of Cayaltí, a community engaged in agriculture, trade, and livestock-raising. It is located within the Province of Chiclayo that belongs to the Lambayeque Region on Peru’s northern coast.

She has had a small knitting and embroidery shop for a year, and she has requested a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa for the purchase of a variety of colored thread, in order to carry out her work. In this way, she will provide her customers with better service.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of colored thread in order to carry out her work.

loans.name: Maria Cotamia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maria Cotamia works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store. Maria Cotamia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase stock to sell in her buy and sell of rice grains business.

Maria Cotamia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell in her business

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 58 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Magdalena is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Magdalena has been farming rice for 10 years and earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Sociedad 12 De Abril  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Sociedad 12 de Abril está formado por 10 mujeres quienes son amigas y vecinas que laboran en un mercado de la ciudad. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad esta bañada por 4 ríos dándole el nombre de la Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos, su centro histórico fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad en 1999, su gente mantiene su cultura y tradiciones.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Agueda, es una socia muy amable y gentil que forma parte del grupo de crédito Sociedad 12 de Abril desde hace 2 años, tiempo en el que ha llegado a establecer una muy buena amistad con todas sus compañeras, los créditos le ayudan a mejorar su negocio y a sacar adelante a su familia.
La Señora Agueda tiene 59 años de edad, es madre soltera de 3 hijos mayores de edad que son casados y viven independientes, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Agueda todos los días se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras en un mercado de la ciudad, este trabajo  lo realiza desde que tenía apenas 18 años de edad y ahora cuenta con un puesto propio.
 El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de frutas de temporada. Su sueño es  tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Sociedad 12 de Abril” is composed of 10 women who are friends and neighbors that work in one of the city markets. They live in different locations within the city of Cuenca, a city bathed by four rivers, giving it the name "Santa Ana de los 4 Ríos". Its historical center was declared a World Heritage Site in 1999, and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

One of the members of this group is Señora Agueda, who is very friendly and kind. She has been a member of the Sociedad 12 de Abril Communal Bank for 2 years; and during this time she has come to establish a very good friendship with all of her companions. The loans help her to improve her business and keep her family going.

Señora Agueda is 59 years old, and she is a single mother of 3 grown children who are married and living independently. As she does not have her own home, she rents. 

Every day Doña Agueda works selling fruit and vegetables in a market in the city; she has been doing this work since she was just 18 years old, and now she has her own stand. She will invest the money from her loan in the purchase of seasonal fruit. Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making belts in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase raw materials to make belts. 

Merlyn has been in this business for five years. Merlyn earns more income from buying and selling herbal medicine.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her business

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 41 years old, married and has two children.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Marcelina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feed.

Marcelina has been raising pigs for 14 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Marcelina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 54 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc.

Miguela has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money for a secure future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks like canned goods, eggs, milk, soap, shampoo, etc

loans.name: Nely Vicenta

texts.en:
Nely Vicenta is 38 years old and has four children.  Nely Vicenta is married and two of her children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Nely Vicenta requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to pay the laborers' salaries to clean the farm.

Nely Vicenta has been in this business for 8 years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

loans.use: to pay laborers to clean the farm

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 52 years old and married with seven children, two of whom are in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell.

Remedios has borrowed and paid back four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Remedios aspires to renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

Vevencia has been in this business for 16 years. 

In the future Vevencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Wilda

texts.en:
Wilda works hard to support her family. Wilda is married and has a banana-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a 12,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell.

Wilda has been in this business for eight years now. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia is 56 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Arsenia has been in this business for three years. In the future Arsenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Luminada

texts.en: Luminada lives in the Canogan province in the Isabela area. She runs a motorcycle transport business. She has had previous loans that she repaid without much challenge. Her business has improved since she started investing in the business. She learned about ASKI through friends who asked her to join them so that she could save and access funding for her business. She now seeks a loan to buy spare parts for her motorcycle. This will improve how she works. This will also increase her income. She will use the extra income to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is married with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imelda is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a 15,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy household goods like noodles, eggs, canned goods, chips, etc.

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy household goods like noodles, eggs, canned goods, chips, etc.

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa is 57 years old and a widow with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, bread, soap, etc to sell.

Ninfa has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and earns additional income from rice retailing.

Ninfa aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, bread, soap, etc to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 37 years old and has three children. Josephine is married and has three children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Josephine requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed one time in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additonal feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 5,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, paint and bamboo for the renovation of her fishing boat.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like wood, paint and bamboo for the renovation of her fishing boat

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 53 years old and married with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Marivic has been in this business for seven years.

In the future Marivic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Medelyn

texts.en:
Medelyn is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Medelyn is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a mat weaving business in the Philippines. Medelyn requested a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like lilas, dye, etc., for her mat weaving business.

Medelyn has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Medelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like lilas, dye, etc., for her mat weaving business

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 49 years old and married, and she works very hard to provide for the family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Vilma has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Doris Angelica

texts.es:
Ella es Angelica  es una joven de 23 años, la infancia y parte de la adolescencia fue un poco compleja, ya que la madre después de un matrimonio de 18 años quedo sola con ella y los otros tres hermanos, por lo cual aunque trabajaba duro apenas podía garantizarles la educación básica, después de graduarse del colegio a los 16 años, Angelica  inicio el primer trabajo, todo esto con el fin de lograr reunir el dinero necesario para iniciar los estudios superiores, Angelica siempre se interesó por el tema de la belleza, le apasionaba la idea de poder a través de masajes y tratamientos ayudar a las personas a aumentar el autoestima, sin embargo no lo consideraba una carrera muy seria y por ende la principal opción era estudiar Derecho, sin embargo esta era una carrera muy costosa y sería muy difícil para ella reunir el dinero necesario, transcurrió el tiempo y debido al extenso horario de trabajo para Angelica fue muy difícil organizarse para iniciar los estudios, y además de ello el dinero que recibía por el trabajo apenas le alcanzaba para ayudar en pequeña medida con los gastos de la casa y cubrir los gastos personales, así transcurrió el tiempo y a la edad de  veinte años Angelica se casó, para ese entonces ella trabajaba y los gastos habían incrementado significativamente.

Durante los siguientes tres años ella continuo trabajando  y en la vida de casada el dinero que le sobraba era muy poco, además de ello para ella era muy importante trabajar duro para en un futuro poder ayudar económicamente a la familia, pero principalmente a la madre. 
En la actualidad Angelica tiene 23 años, ya logro matricularse e iniciar los estudios superiores en el área de Cosmetología y Estética integral, la meta inicial es aprovechar y captar los mayores conocimientos posibles y culminar los estudios siendo una excelente profesional para en un tiempo no muy lejano iniciar un negocio en sociedad con la hermana quien estudia belleza, el sueño es lograr establecer un centro de belleza integral donde además de realizar procedimientos estéticos tales como masajes relajantes, reductores, mascarillas y demás también se pueda proporcionar a los pacientes todo lo correspondiente al cuidado físico tal como manicure, pedicura peluquería etc. 
Por ahora para Angelica es de gran esfuerzo poder costear los estudios, ya que aparte de las mensualidades, ella debe comprar ciertos materiales y aditamentos para las prácticas, es por eso que ella solicita del convenio kiva, además de ello debe disponer de ciertas horas en la noche para la realización de las tareas y talleres correspondientes a las clases, Sin embargo cuenta con todo el espíritu y voluntad para no desfallecer y culminar de la mejor manera la carrera en Cosmetología y estética.
texts.en:
This is Angelica, a young woman of 23 years of age. Her childhood and part of her teenage years were a bit complex, as her mother, after a marriage of 18 years, was left alone with her and her three siblings. Even though Angelica's mother worked hard, she could barely guarantee her children's basic education. After graduating from high school at age 16, Angelica started her first job with the goal of gathering the money required to begin her higher education. Angelica was always interested in the topic of beauty and was passionate about the idea of helping people improve their self esteem through massages and treatments. However, she did not consider this a very serious career and her main choice was to study Law, which was nevertheless a very expensive degree and it was very difficult for her to gather the required money. Time went by and due to Angelica's extensive work schedule, it was very difficult to make the arrangements to begin her studies. In addition to that, the money she was paid for her work was only enough to help to a small extent with her household expenses and to cover her personal expenses. Time went by and Angelica got married at the age of 20. At that point, she still worked and her expenses had increased significantly.

During the following three years, she continued working and there was barely any money left over in her married life. It was very important for her to work hard in order to be able to help her family in the future, especially her mother. 

Currently, Angelica is 23 years old. She was able to register and begin her higher education in the field of Cosmetology and Comprehensive Aesthetics. Her initial goal is to take advantage of her studies, obtain as much knowledge as possible and finish her studies to become an excellent professional. In the not too distant future she would like to start a business in partnership with her sister who is in beauty school. Her dream is to be able to open a comprehensive beauty center, where in addition to conducting aesthetic procedures such as relaxing and reductive massages, face packs and so on, patients could also receive everything related to physical care, like manicures, pedicures, hair styling, etc. 

At the moment, it is a great effort for Angelica to be able to afford her studies, since in addition to the monthly fees, she must buy certain materials and  devices for her training. This is why she is requesting a Kiva loan. She must also make some time available in the evening for doing her homework and  workshops related to her classes. She possesses nevertheless all the spirit and will power not to give up and to finish in the best possible way her degree in Cosmetology and Aesthetics.

loans.use: to pay for one semester of tuition.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 47 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a business buying and selling coconut shells in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of coconut shells to sell.

Virginia has been in this business for two years.

In the future Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of coconut shells to sell

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 59 years old and single with two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Rosario has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Rosario has taken a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan purchase to building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosario is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home

loans.name: Betheline

texts.en:
Betheline lives in Canogan, which is in the Isabela region. She is already a rather successful businesswoman and feels happy since she has managed to find a very good and reliable partner in her business. Her credit history is exemplary and rich. Betheline has her own shop where she runs a food and household goods trading business. Her shop is much visited, since she has a great assortment of sweets, cakes, soft drinks, juices, bread, sausages and a great variety of household goods. The sale of these all help her to offer a better quality of life to her family.

Now, Betheline is asking for a loan of PHP 13,000 to refresh her shop assortment, which will surely help her to cater to more buyers and have a higher level of profit from sales.

loans.use: to buy beverages, snack foods and spices for her business

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 26 years old and has three children.  

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Elvira is taking out a housing loan amounting to 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Elvira has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her buying and selling business.

With your help, Elvira can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family after the typhoon.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a married woman living in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Leonila has been engaged in fishing and catching crabs. This is the source of her income.

She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo which will be used to make crab traps. This in turn will make her work easier and allows her to be more productive. Leonila has hopes of expanding her business and making it a success.

loans.use: to buy bamboo which will be used to make crab traps

loans.name: Thou's Group

texts.en:
Thou is aged 27 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Cheung Prey district, Thou has been farming rice and working as a paid construction worker. The current business earns her about 42,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the first loan for Thou with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor fees. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Phearum's Group

texts.en:
Phearum, 27, is married with two dependent children. Her family lives in a house with a thatch roof located in Kampong Cham province’s Koh Sotin district, and the main source of her family’s income is from farming rice. To supplement the income, she also sells coffee and grocery items in her village. Having been in this business for nine years, she is able to earn about 47,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Phearum has just begun with VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phearum is going to use her portion to buy more coffee and grocery items to resell. She hopes to make more income from her current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more coffee and grocery items to resell

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Maria Liezel

texts.en:
Maria Liezel is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Maria Liezel is 43 years old and has three children who are in school.

Maria Liezel's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Maria Liezel is taking out a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Maria Liezel has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Maria Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house after the typhoon

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married with seven children. With two children in school, Emma works very hard to provide for them.

Emma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Emma has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Emma is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Vanessa

texts.en:
Vanessa is twenty one years old and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vanessa's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Vanessa has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.
