She is using the loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vanessa is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en: Thon is a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province and she is 26 years old.  She is a married mother of one little son who is too young for schooling. To make a living, Thon grows rice and pineapple as the main source of income and does paid work for another fee. She has been engaged with rice farming for 16 years and she can earn 35,900 KHR per day. She is in the second loan cycle loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Her past loan, which she has fully repaid, has enabled her to improve her lifestyle. Now, she is leading the group of two to get a new loan. She is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR and her joint borrower is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for fertilizer for her pineapple. She hopes that her pineapple will produce a better crop yield for her than last year.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizer for her pineapple

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es: Manuel es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son maíz y frijol. Manuel desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y poder mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografia. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Manuel is a man who is very responsible with the obligations of his home, as he has always been characterized by giving the best to his children. He lives with his wife and their children, and he is very hard-working; he has always carried out his work cheerfully and with enthusiasm.

He works in agriculture, and every year he plants the principal crops of the zone, such as corn and beans.

Manuel wants to increase his sales, so he visited the offices of Integral in order to request a loan that will allow him to purchase compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and similar items; and to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph. 

He hopes to have the help that he has requested, as he has no other income; this way he will continue providing for his home without any limitations.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, pesticide, and similar items, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is 52 years old from Nyahururu. She is a widow and is blessed with two children aged 24 and 21 years old. She has been running her business of selling foodstuff and other items in her shop for the last 20 years. To enable her to buy stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar, rice and other items, she has applied for her third loan of KES 54,000 from Vision Fund Kenya.

Her monthly income right now is KES 20, 000 and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start dairy farming and to pay back her loan to VisionFund Kenya.

In the future, she hopes to be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize flour, wheat flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Touch

texts.en:
Touch, 62, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Srey Snom district. She has five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice and planting cassava for 44 years and the current business earns her family about 37,000 KHR per day.
Touch has been with VisionFund for three cycles and successfully repaid the past loans. She is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sokran's Group

texts.en: A local villager from Battambang province, Sokran is a young mother blessed with two kids who are still young. She supports her family via rice and corn farming as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. This is the second microloan for Sokran and her fellow group member in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The positive impact of her past loan has enabled her to uplift her lifestyle better than before. For this cycle, she and her joint borrower are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her portion of the loan to pay for plowing fees and to buy corn seeds. She hopes that she will gain a better yield than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing fees and to buy corn seeds

loans.name: Sros' Group

texts.en:
Sros, age 33, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To make a living, Sros has been farming rice and raising pigs for ten years. The current business earns her about 80,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
Sros has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely repaid the past loan. She is leading her group of two to apply for a loan. She wants to use her portion of the loan to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is 57 years old and has five  children. Zosima is widowed and has children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Zosima is taking out a housing loan amounting to 7,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Zosima has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her general store.

With your help, Zosima can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house after the typhoon

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a farmer living in the Litein area of South Rift, Kenya, where she is married and has two children, both of school-going age. She appreciates farming and has been doing it for four years, with her primary income sources being milk, eggs and tea. She stated that what she loves most about farming is poultry farming because of the egg production. Her biggest challenge is poultry diseases.

She chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because of good and fair interest rates on their loans. During the training she learned that MFIs (micro finance institutions) finance small income earners, and also how she can develop a savings culture. 

This loan will help her expand her poultry farm and hence, raise her profits, which will help cater for their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Ma. Loila

texts.en:
Ma. Loila works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Ma. Loila will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ma. Loila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family after super typhoon Haiyan

loans.name: Heat's Group

texts.en:
Heat is 41 years old and a resident from Battambang province. She’s a mother of four children, one of whom is in school. The only source of her income is via rice farming, which she has been involved in for 10 years. This business returns her a decent income in order to feed the family. 

This is the fourth loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans with success, and they have improved her lifestyle better than before. For this loan cycle, she forms a group of four to get a new loan. The total amount of her entire group loan is 2,900,000 KHR (Cambodian riels), of which 500,000 KHR is her loan portion. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to renovate her house. She hopes that she will able to live in a better shelter. Therefore, she does not need to worry during the upcoming rainy season anymore.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чынаре 32 года. Она более одного года занимается розничной торговлей прохладительных напитков и мороженного, в настоящий момент товарооборот составляет более 50,000сомов (KGS). Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сомов (KGS). Чынара имеет высшее образование,закончила экономический факультет ОшТУ, и достаточный опыт в ведении собственного бизнеса. Чынара не замужем, проживает вместе с родителями и сама занята в бизнесе.  В Банк "Бай-Тушум" обращается в первый раз и на полученный кредит планирует увеличить товарооборот на весенний сезон, а именно закупить мороженное и прохладительные напитки. В дальнейшем Чынара нацелена на расширение своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Chinara is 32.  For more than a year, she's been selling soft drinks and ice cream wholesale.  Her sales currently amount to more than 50,000 som, and her monthly income is 20,000 som.  She graduated from Osh Technological University with a degree in economics and has a decent amount of experience operating her own business.  Chinara is unmarried, lives with her parents and has an active hand in running her business.  This is the first time she is seeking a loan from Bai Tushum & Partners; she hopes to increase her sales for the spring by increasing her stock of ice cream and soft drinks.  She hopes to be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: stock up on ice cream and soft drinks to sell wholesale

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 48 years old and married with one child in school. Marissa works very hard to provide for the family.

Marissa's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Marissa has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a 5,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Marissa is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future, would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beniko, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments et de charbon. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leur quatrième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente YIRIDIE, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter de l’oignon, de la feuille de baobab et du sel à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 10.000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouma group is made up of married women who, on average, are 42 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in Beniko, Guegneka commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali).  The group members know each other through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell cereals, condiments, and coal. With the goal of satisfying the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fourth group loan. They will use this new loan to buy the goods already mentioned.

Yiridie, the person standing in the middle of the photo, is illiterate but works selling condiments. She plans to buy onions, baobab leaves, and salt in Fana. Sales will be made at retail from her home to a mixed group of customers. 

Yiridie hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 10,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Hildegarda

texts.en:
Hildegarda is single and is 48 years old; she works hard to help her parents.

She has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Hildegarda is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of abaca fiber to weave in her abaca weaving business.

Hildegarda has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of abaca fiber to weave.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SANIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 37 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Djifina, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de poisson congelé et de gâteau. Les femmes du groupe SANIYA sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MATOU, première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson congelé. Elle compte acheter 25 kg de poissons de mer, chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12. 000Fcfa, qui sera en partie réinvesti dans son activité, et le reste pour assurer la scolarité ses enfants.
texts.en:
The Saniya group is made up of married women who, on average, are 37 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in N'Djifina, Wacoro commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). They group knows each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members work selling condiments, frozen fish, and cakes. With the goal of satisfying the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their second group loan. This new loan will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

Matou, the first person seated from the left in the photo, is illiterate but works selling frozen fish. She plans to buy 25 kilograms of salt-water fish from the wholesalers in Fana. Sales will be made at retail from her home to a mixed group of customers. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 12,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be reinvested back into her business and the other part will ensure her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rosalina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Rosalina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

Rosalina has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional fishing net for her business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina works hard to support her family. Marina is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Marina has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Marina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Noami

texts.en:
Noami works hard to support her family. Noami is married and has a business buying and selling dried fish and vegetables in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Noami has been in this business for 11 years now.

In the future, Noami would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Paulina works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling vegetables in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs.  Paulina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks of vegetables to sell in her vegetable business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Paulina has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Junith

texts.en:
Junith works hard to support her family. Junith is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Junith has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Junith would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of abaca fiber to weave.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of abaca fiber to weave.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell in her rice business.

Lucy has been in this business for 9 years. Lucy earns additional income from a general store.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Charlene

texts.en:
Charlene is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Charlene is 21 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Charlene has a food vending business in the Philippines. Charlene requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like vegetables fish, spices, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Charlene has been in this business for 2 years. Charlene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like vegetables fish, spices and meat for her food production business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 39 years old and married with three children.

Gina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Gina has borrowed and paid back 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Gina aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 45 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Beniko, commune de Guegneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de poisson frais, de savon, d’habillement et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur septième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MADJOUGOU , première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de poisson frais. Elle compte acheter du poisson chez les pécheurs à Sorokoro. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché journalier de Fana, à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 21.000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Tiessiri group is made up of married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in Beniko, Guegneka commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrate region in the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell condiments, fresh fish, soap, clothing, and other goods. With the goal of satisfying the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their seventh group loan.

Madjougou, the person standing first from the left in the photo, is illiterate and she works selling fresh fish. She plans to buy fish from the fishermen in Sorokoro. Sales will be made at retail at the daily market in Fana to a mixed group of customers. 

Madjougou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 21,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SINIGNESSIGUI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 43 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de N’Djifina, commune de Wacoro, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de poisson, de gâteau, de galette et de savon. Les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ADAM, deuxième personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des assis est analphabète, elle est actuellement restauratrice. Elle compte acheter du riz, des condiments et la de pâte alimentaire chez les grossistes à Fana. La vente des plats se fait en espèce dans sa  gargote au bord de la route Fana Béléko à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 11 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti son activité.
texts.en:
The Sinignessigui group is made up of married women, who average 43 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of N'Djifina in the Wacoro municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They practise restauration activities and buy and sell cereals, fish, cakes, savoury pancakes and soap.

The women of the Sinignessigui group are on their second group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of being able to satisfy their huge customer demand. These loans will be used to buy the aforementioned goods.

The customer, Adam, who is sitting second from the right in the photo is illiterate and currently practises a restauration activity. She is planning to buy rice, condiments and dough from wholesalers in Fana. She sells her dishes for cash in her little cafe on the side of the Fana Béléko road to a mixed customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 11,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for restauration activity.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana Coura, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, d’habillement, de produit cosmétique et d’encens. Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente ASSITAN 1 ere assise  de la droite vers la gauche dans le rang des assises, est vendeuse de pagne wax. Elle compte acheter 9 pièces de pagne wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle ainsi qu’au marché journalier de Fana, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 35 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Laidou group is made up of married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Fana, Fana Coura neighborhood, Guegneka commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrate region in the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell cereals, condiments, clothing, cosmetics, and incense. In order to meet the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their 11th group loan.

Assitan, the first person seated from the right in the photo, sells wax pagne. She plans to buy nine lengths of wax pagne from the wholesalers in Bamako. Sales are made at retail from her home and at the daily market in Fana to a mixed group of customers.

Assitan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita is 64 years old and married with four children.

Cristita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, matches, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Cristita has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and raising pigs.

Cristita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, matches and shampoo to sell.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Miguela will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Miguela would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is 34 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

Ailyn has borrowed and paid back 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the gasoline business for 13 years and also earns an income from a vulcanizing shop.

Ailyn aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of gasoline to sell.

loans.name: Nieta Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NIETA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 54 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Fana Coura, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de drap et rideau, de banane, de l’atièké et de la galette. Les femmes du groupe NIETA sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MAMOU, première personne a partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de banane. Elle compte acheter 550 kg de banane chez les grossistes à Banco.  La vente se fait en gros et en espèce à Fana, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 33 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The Nieta group is made up of married women, who average 54 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the Fana Coura district of Fana in the Guégneka municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They buy and sell sheets and curtains, bananas, "atiéké" (a traditional dish made from cassava) and savoury pancakes. 

The women of the Nieta group are on their 15th group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of being able to satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Mamou, who is standing on the far left of the photo is illiterate and currently sells bananas. She is planning to buy 550kg of bananas from wholesalers in Banco. She sells her bananas wholesale and for cash in Fana to a mixed customer base. She expects to make an average monthly profit of 33,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Nafama Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe NAFAMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 32 ans, et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Barouéli, commune de Barouéli, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de produit cosmétique, d’habillement et de fruits et légume.  Les femmes du groupe NAFAMA sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente ASSAN , première personne a partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de pagne. Elle compte acheter 8 pièces de pagnes wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. Ces pagnes seront vendus en détail  et en espèce chez elle et au marché, à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Nafama group is made up of married women who, on average, are 32 years old and have three children. They all live in traditional families in Baroueli, Baroueli commune, Baroueli prefecture, Segou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members work selling cosmetics, clothing, and fruits and vegetables. In order to satisfy the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yirwaso. They are on their 22nd group loan. This new loan will be used to buy the goods already mentioned.

Assan, the first person on the left, is illiterate and works selling pagne [bright, colorful fabric]. She plans to buy eight lengths of wax pagne from the wholesalers in Bamako. These pagnes will be sold at retail and for cash from her home and at a market to a mixed group of customers. 

Assan hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which will be reinvested back into her business.

loans.use: to buy pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de savon, de charbon de bois, de produits cosmétiques et du lait.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJENEBA ABDOU , première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter du sel, du cube Maggi, du poisson fumé, de l’oignon, du macaroni, de la poudre d’oignon et du chou chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. Ces condiments seront vendus en détail et en espèce chez elle, à une clientèle mixte.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000FCFA qui sera partie réinvestie dans son activité et le reste assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women, who average 36 years of age with five children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala in the Guégneka municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They buy and sell cereals, condiments, soap, charcoal, cosmetics and milk.

The women of the Benkadi group are on their fifth group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of being able to satisfy their huge customer demand. These loans will be used to buy the aforementioned goods.

The customer, Djeneba Abdou, who is sitting on the far left of the photo is illiterate and currently sells condiments. She is planning to buy salt, Maggi stock cubes, smoked fish, onions, macaroni, onion powder and cabbage from wholesalers at the weekly market. Her condiments are sold from her home on a retail basis for cash and to a mixed customer base. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 15,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business and used to cover her family's daily expenses..

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 36 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Baroueli, commune de Baroueli, préfecture de Baroueli, Région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de produit cosmétique, de savon, d’habillement et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur onzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente MARIAM, assise devant est actuellement vendeuse de savon. Elle compte acheter 12 cartons de savons modernes chez les grossistes à Bamako. Ces savons seront ensuite vendus en détail  et en espèce chez elle et à Barouéli, à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera investi dans l’élevage de bovin.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who, on average, are 36 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in Baroueli, Baroueli commune, Baroueli prefecture, Segou region (fourth administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members sell cereals, cosmetics, soap, clothing, and other diverse goods. In order to meet the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yirwaso. They are on their 11th group loan.

Mariam, seated in front in the photograph, sells soap. She plans to buy 12 boxes of soap from the wholesalers in Bamako. This soap will be then sold at retail and for cash from her home and in Baroueli to a mixed group of customers.

Mariam hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in the raising of cows.

loans.use: to buy soap

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de grains d’arachide, de céréales, de condiments, de savon, de charbon de bois, de fruits et légume et de la boisson.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AWA , première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout est analphabète. Elle est actuellement vendeuse de grains d’arachide. Elle compte acheter 3 sacs d’arachides non décortiqué chez les grossistes à Fana, ces sacs seront décortique avant d’être mis au marché. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce dans le village et ses environs à une clientèle mixte.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 18 000FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Danaya group is made up of married women, who average 34 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala in the Guégnéka municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They practise restauration activities and buy and sell groundnuts, cereals, condiments, soap, charcoal, fruit and vegetables, and drinks.

The women of the Danaya group are on their third group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of being able to satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Awa, who is standing on the far left of the photo, is illiterate and currently sells groundnuts. She is planning to buy three sacks of unshelled groundnuts from wholesalers in Fana. She sells on a retail basis and for cash in the village and surrounding areas to a mixed customer base. 

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 18,000FCFA, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Virginia will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Gen Gen

texts.en:
Gen Gen works hard to support her family. Gen Gen is married and has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines.

Gen Gen requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Gen Gen has been in this business for 5 years now.

Gen Gen would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Dembagnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DEMBAGNOUMAN est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de charbon de bois et du lait.
Les femmes du groupe DEMBAGNOUMAN sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente SITAN , deuxième première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des débout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon. Elle compte acheter 20 sacs de charbon de bois sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en gros et en espèce chez elle, uniquement à ses clients venus de Bamako.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000FCFA qui sera en partie réinvestie dans son activité et le reste assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouman group is made up of married women, who average 39 years of age with three children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala in the Guégnéka municipality, which lies in the Dioïla prefecture of the Koulikoro region (the Republic of Mali's second administrative region). They got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They buy and sell cereals, condiments, charcoal and milk.

The women of the Dembagnouman group are on their fifth group loan; they turned to Soro Yiriwaso with the aim of being able to satisfy their huge customer demand. 

The customer, Sitan, who is standing second from the left in the photo, is illiterate and currently sells charcoal. She is planning to buy 20 sacks of charcoal locally from women in the village. She sells her charcoal wholesale for cash from her home, and only to her customers who come from Bamako.

She expects to make an average monthly profit of 20,000FCFA, which will be partly reinvested in her business, with the rest being used to cover her family's daily outgoings.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: Djiguiya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUIYA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 31 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de charbon, d’igname, d’essence et d’habillement.
Les femmes du groupe DJIGUIYA sont à leur cinquième  prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente BAKORO , deuxième personnes a partir de la gauche dans le rang des assises  est analphabète. elle est actuellement vendeuse d’igname. Elle compte acheter des sacs d’igname chez les grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce dans le village et environnants, a une clientèle mixte.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 45 000FCFA qui sera réinvestie dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Djiguiya group is made up of married women who, on average, are 31 years old and have four children. The all live in traditional families in Warassala, Guegneka commune, Dioila prefecture, Koulikoro region (second administrative region in the Republic of Mali). The group members know each other from family, neighborhood, and friendship ties.

The group members work in food preparation and commerce, selling cereals, coal, yams, gasoline, and clothing. In order to meet the large demand from their customers, the group joined Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their fifth group loan.

Bakoro, the second person seated from the left in the photo, is illiterate and sells yams. She plans to buy bags of yams from the wholesalers at the weekly markets. Sales will be made at retail and for cash in the village and surrounding areas to a mixed group of customers.

Bakoro hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA which will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to buy yams

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a fifty-four-year-old plastic shoe trader in Majaoni, Mombasa. She is a married mother of four whose husband provides for additional income. She has been in this business for the last ten years and is doing great.

This marks her fourth borrowing to finance her business after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to purchase stocks of plastic shoes and sandals to sell and the anticipated profit will service her loan. She hopes to sell wholesale in future.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of plastic shoes and sandals.

loans.name: Judtih

texts.en:
Judtih is 47 years old and married with seven children. With three children in school, Judtih works very hard to provide for them.

Judtih's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Judtih has restarted and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Judtih is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Elvira works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from manicure and pedicure services. Elvira is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients like meat, noodles, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business.

Elvira has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like meat, noodles, spices, vegetables for her food production business.

loans.name: Luis Alfonso

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre trabajador y humilde de 53 años de edad, casado y padre de 4 hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con gran esfuerzo y constancia.
Desde hace 20 años trabaja como comerciante independiente, vendiendo frutas y verduras, inició por la necesidad de generar recursos para su subsistencia, con una carreta que llevaba por varias calles de la ciudad ofreciendo frutas y verduras frescas, poco a poco, con los buenos resultados obtenidos en su labor, logró adquirir un vehículo de un modelo antiguo pero que le ha funcionado y le ha permitido seguir con su labor de una manera más cómoda.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la reparación del vehículo y en la compra de surtido al por mayor de frutas y hortalizas, esto le permitirá seguir prestando un buen servicio a los clientes, que por su amplia trayectoria en el sector lo reconocen y le compran diariamente.
Luis sueña con tener la capacidad económica para brindar educación secundaria y universitaria a sus hijos, para que sean profesionales íntegros y exitosos, y puedan disfrutar de mejores condiciones de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Luis is a hardworking and humble 53-year-old man, he is married and father to four children who he has got ahead in life through a lot of effort and perseverance. He has been working as an independent sales person for the last 20 years selling fruit and vegetables, because he needed to generate an income to get by, he started with a cart which he pushed through many streets in the city selling fresh fruit and vegetable. Little by little, with the good profits he made from his work he managed to buy a vehicle, of an old model, but which has worked and allowed him to continue working in a more comfortable manner.

The loan that Luis is seeking is to invest in the repair of the vehicle and to purchase fruit and vegetables in bulk, this will enable him to continue offering a good service to his customers who, given his long service in this field, know him and buy from him on a daily basis. Luis dreams of having the financial capacity to give his children a secondary and tertiary level of education so that they become well-rounded and successful professionals and that they can enjoy better living and life conditions.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle and buy stock of fruit and vegetables in bulk.

loans.name: Lin

texts.en:
Lin is 26 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Lin is twenty-six years old and has two children who are in school.

Lin's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted and is committed to regain what she lost. 

Lin is taking out a PHP 10,000 Housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Lin has been with NWTF since 2013 in her pursuit of rising out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Lin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida is 55 years old and married with two children. 

Florida is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Florida requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Florida has been in pig fattening for 3 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Florida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is 44 years old and married with six children, three of whom are in school. Wilma works very hard to provide for them.

Wilma's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Wilma  has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Wilma is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Don manuel es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don Manuel solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografia, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Don manuel es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su grupo familiar en casa propia, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la comercializarla a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia. Don Manuel solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra y mejorar el terreno que es el que muestra la fotografia, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.

loans.use: comprar controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas y mejorar el terreno

loans.name: Delly

texts.en:
Delly is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Delly is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Delly has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Delly requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Delly has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Delly would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: On Time Group

texts.en:
Mariam is aged in her late 40s and is married with six grown children. She has been involved in two businesses for seven years now: charcoal selling and poultry. Currently, Mariam grows 300 chicks but she plan to increase her growing limit. She works in her business from 06am to 06pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she paid successfully, to open her current charcoal business and increased her poultry business with 50 chicks. She is so progressive and is a hard working mama. With the increase of her business stocks, Mariam got an extra income which she used to connect electricity to her family living house, bought a fridge, a TV and a digital deck (King’amuzi). She really appreciates Kiva's loan support which makes her feel a person. Her family life has improved and is better than before. Mariam dreams that one day she will be able to connect her house with water and improve her businesses. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "ON TIME" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal and 220 chicks.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang province where paddy rice is the main source of income for the family, Channa is 45 years old and has three children. She has been involved in her current business for years and it brings her about 45,000 KHR per day. Including this loan, she is in her eighth loan cycle whereas her joint borrower is in her fifth loan cycle. 

Now, her living conditions are getting better than before as a result of the positive impact of her the past loan which she has repaid. She is seeking for 1,400,000 KHR whilst her joint borrower is applying for 800,000 KHR. As the group’s representative, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her rice farming. She strongly hopes that she can continue to improve her lifestyle so it is better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice farming.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and married with five children. Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Maria has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as biscuits, candies, snack foods, juice, etc. 

In the future, Maria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Rober

texts.es: Robert  es un joven estudiante de administración bancaria va en el cuarto ciclo de la carrera por el momento trabaja de cajero, su mayor sueño es terminar pronto sus estudios para poder trabajar  en un banco desempeñándose como administrador,  Robert ha vencido toda clase de obstáculos con el apoyo de sus padres que lo han inculcado desde pequeño a salir adelante y agradece a EDAPROSPO y KIVA por el préstamo adquirido ya que ha podido pagar parte de sus estudios y comprar los materiales que le piden en la universidad, Robert agradece por la oportunidad  que recibe de saber que hay personas buenas en todo el mundo que apoyan a los que necesitan salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rober is a young banking administration student going into the forth stage of his degree. At the moment he works as a cashier, his greatest dream is to finish his studies soon, to be able to work in a bank as an administrator. 

Rober has overcome all sorts of obstacles with the support of his parents who taught him to get ahead since he was a child, and thanks to EDAPROSPO and Kiva for the loan he got, which has paid part of his studies and bought the materials necessary for university. 

Rober is thankful for the opportunity he has received to know that there are good people in the world who support those who need it to get through.

loans.use: to pay for his study costs and materials he needs for university.

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe YIRIWA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala, commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de savon artisanal, de fruits et légume et du charbon.
Les femmes du groupe YIRIWA sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO. La cliente DJELIKA , première personne à partir de la droite dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de savon artisanal (gabakourouni). Elle compte acheter 4 sacs de savon avec ses  fournisseurs à Fana. Ces savons seront revendus en détail et parfois en gros aux clients du village et environnants.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 25. 000FCFA qui sera en partie est réinvesti dans son activité et le reste assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group named Yiriwa is made up of married women who are on average 42 years old with five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warassala in the commune of Guégneka, Dioila prefecture in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the republic of Mali)
They met through friendship, neighbourhood and family ties. They work in catering, and the commerce of cereals, condiments, handmade soap, fruit, vegetables and coal.
The women in this group are on their fifth loan. Hoping to satisfy the huge demand of their customers they have joined Soro Yiriwaso. Djelika, who is first on the right in the row of people standing up, is illiterate and at present she sells handmade soap (gabakourouni). She plans to buy four bags of soap from her suppliers in Fana. She will sell the soap retail and sometimes wholesale to her customers in the village and surrounding area.
She plans to make an average monthly profit of 25. 000FCFA which she will use to re-invest in her business and to provide for the daily expenses for her family.

loans.use: to buy handmade soap.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy additional stocks like detergent soap, hair conditioner, cooking oil, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for 41 years. Lolita earns additional income from pig-fattening.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Lolita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like detergent soap, hair conditioner, cooking oil and soft-drinks to sell.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 40 old and has three children. Gina  is married and has two children who are in school.

Gina and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Gina has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through farming rice.

With your help, Gina can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: María Amparo

texts.es:
María, una mujer carismática y emprendedora de 60 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos y cabeza de hogar desde el fallecimiento de su esposo.
Debido a la necesidad de generar ingresos para subsistir, inició su propio negocio de alquiler de lavadoras, comenzó con una máquina pero, gracias a los buenos resultados obtenidos, hoy en día cuenta con 8 lavadoras para alquiler ya sea por horas o por días, dependiendo de la necesidad de sus clientes.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer aún más su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar una lavadora, lo que le permitirá aumentar su capacidad instalada y poder satisfacer la demanda actual de su servicio, logrando así mejorar los ingresos para solventar los gastos básicos del hogar.
María manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es poder hacer de su negocio una actividad más rentable y auto sostenible, que le garantice una estabilidad económica favorable para disfrutar de una vejez tranquila y feliz en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en:
María, a charismatic and enterprising 60-year-old woman is mother to two children and head of the household since the death of her husband.

As she needed to generate income to get by, she started her own business renting washing machines. She started with one machine, but thanks to the good results that she has obtained, today she has eight washing machines for rent, whether by hour or by day, according to the need for customers.

Keen to bolster her business that bit more, María is seeking the help of a loan to buy a washing machine which will enable her to increase her installed capacity and be able to satisfy the current demand for her service, therein growing the sales to cover the household's basic costs.

María states that her greatest dream is to make her business more profitable and self-sustaining, which guarantees her a good financial stability to enjoy a calm and happy old age in the company of her children.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is twenty-eight years old and married, with one child in school. Milagros works very hard to provide for them.

Milagros's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Milagros has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Milagros has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Milagros is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Melitona

texts.en:
Melitona works hard to support her family. She is married and has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines.

Melitona requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc for her business.

Melitona has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc for her business

loans.name: Limousine Group

texts.en:
George is a single man in his early thirties. For ten years now, he has been running his life by managing a butchery, selling meat. He opens his shop from 6 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly return.

From Tujijenge, Tanzania, this is George's fourth loan request, which he will use to restock meat to sell to more people. With his previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, George increased his meat stock. He earned extra income which he used to buy a plot of land where he expects to build a house. He also covered his life welfare and ploughed part of it back to the business. He dreams of expanding his butchery business to the extent that he would be able to employ more teenagers. 

George will share this loan with his loan group "Limousine" which totals six members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock meat to sell to more people.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines.

Mary Ann requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 30 years old with three children who are in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalie's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Rosalie has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Rosalie is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah is 56 years old from Nyahururu. She is single and is blessed with one child aged 21 years.

Teresiah is a shopkeeper, a business which she has been running for the last nine years. To enable her to buy stocks of maize flour, cooking fat, and sugar in bulk, she has applied for her third loan of KES 20,000 from VisionFund Kenya.

Teresiah's monthly income right now is KES 10,000 and she has plans of using the anticipated profits from her expanded business to start poultry farming. In the future, Teresiah hopes to buy a plot of land and build some rental houses.

loans.use: to buy stocks of maize flour, cooking fat, and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 35 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Jennifer is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

Jennifer has been in pig-fattening for 6 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Brenda

texts.en:
Maria Brenda is 51 years old and married with four children.  With three children in school, Maria Brenda works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Brenda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Maria Brenda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Maria Brenda has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Maria Brenda is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.en:
Ruperta is 49 years old and has two children.  Ruperta is married and has two children who are in school.

She and her family  survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Ruperta is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 7,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through farming rice.

With your help, Ruperta can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Antonio William

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre trabajador y pujante, reconocido por ser un esposo y padre ejemplar de dos hijos a los que ha sacado adelante con esfuerzo.
Durante la mayor parte de su vida productiva se ha dedicado a trabajar en su propia panadería, trabaja solo todos los días, temprano en la mañana prepara buñuelos, panes, pasteles y galletas que luego distribuye en una moto a los diversos clientes que le encargan el producto, fieles compradores gracias a su amplia trayectoria en la labor y, cuando existe mucha demanda de producto contrata a un empleado por horas para que le colabore en la entrega de los pedidos; así genera los recursos suficientes para solventar los gastos del hogar.
El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la renovación del seguro obligatorio de la moto, pues es indispensable para poder continuar con su labor y así cumplir con la entrega oportuna de los pedidos a los clientes, así mejorará las ventas y los ingresos para su familia.
Antonio sueña con adecuar un local grande en el centro del municipio donde reside, para mejorar las condiciones de trabajo y generar oportunidades de empleo estables, así tendrá una mayor rentabilidad y podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is a hardworking and a driven man, known for being an exemplary husband and father to two children who he has got ahead in life with a lot of work. For most of his working life he has worked in his own bakery store, he works every day on his one, from early on in the morning to prepare fritters, bread, cakes and biscuits that he then distributes on motorbike to various customers who order the goods, loyal customers thanks to his longstanding experience in the field. When there is a lot of demand for product, he hires an employee by the hour so that they can help him deliver the orders. It is in this way that he generates the resources to cover the household spending.

The loan that Antonio is seeking will be invested in renewing the mandatory insurance for the motorbike as it is essential to continue with his work and therein meet their customer orders, therein improving the sales and income for his family.

Antonio dreams of fitting out a bigger store in the center of the municipality where he lives, to improve the working conditions and generate opportunities for stable employment, to therein have greater profitability and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to renew the mandatory insurance for his motorbike.

loans.name: Conception

texts.en:
Conception works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her 2012 business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Conception will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Conception would like to save money to expand business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 36 years old and married with two children.

Jessica works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Jessica has borrowed and paid back 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Jessica aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.
